SettingDetails.complianceWindowsDeviceHealthAttestation:
Microsoft Attestation Service evaluation settings

Use these settings to confirm that a device has protective measures enabled at boot time. Learn more
SettingDetails.complianceWindowsMobileOsVersionRestrict: Select the newest OS version a mobile device can have. The operating system version is defined as major.minor.build.revision.
Select the oldest OS version a mobile device can have. The operating system version is defined as major.minor.build.revision.
SettingDetails.complianceWindowsOsVersionRestrictionHea: The operating system version is defined as major.minor.build.revision.
SettingDetails.complianceWindowsOsVersionRestrictionMax: Select the newest OS version a device can have. The operating system version is defined as major.minor.build.revision.
SettingDetails.complianceWindowsOsVersionRestrictionMin: Select the oldest OS version a device can have. The operating system version is defined as major.minor.build.revision.
SettingDetails.complianceWindowsRequiredPasswordTypeDes: Select the password type that will be on the device.
SettingDetails.complianceWorkProfilePasswordRequirement: Require a password to unlock work profile
SettingDetails.compliantAppsOption: Compliant apps list. Report noncompliance for any installed apps not in list
SettingDetails.computerNameStaticPrefixDescription: Computers are assigned 15 characters long name. Specify a prefix, rest of 15 characters will be random.
SettingDetails.configureChildSecurityAssociationsName: Configure a separate set of parameters for child security associations
SettingDetails.connectAppBlockAutoLaunchDescription: Blocks the Connect app from automatically launching. If blocked, users can manually launch the Connect app from the Hub's settings.
SettingDetails.connectIfNeededDNSListDescription: Enter the IP address(es) of the DNS servers that will resolve the domains in the list. This setting only applies to domains in the list. Domains and DNS servers are internal resources that cannot be accessed on external networks. So if the domain doesn't resolve, then the VPN connection is created on-demand.
SettingDetails.connectIfNeededDomainsDescription: When users access a domain in this list, the device tries to resolve the domain using DNS. Domains are internal resources that aren't resolved by public DNS. So if the domain doesn't resolve, meaning it doesn't have access to internal resources, then a VPN connection is created on-demand.
SettingDetails.consumerFeaturesDescription: Allows IT admins to turn on experiences that are typically for consumers only, such as Start suggestions, Membership notifications, Post-OOBE app install and redirect tiles.
SettingDetails.contentCachingBlockDeletionDescription: Available for macOS 10.13.4 and later. Also known as tethered caching. If you don’t configure this setting, users will be able to share their internet connection and cached content with iOS or iPadOS devices that are connected to their Mac via USB.
SettingDetails.contentCachingBlockDeletionName: Always keep content from the cache, even when the system needs disk space for other apps
SettingDetails.contentCachingClientListenRangesDescript: Available for macOS 10.13.4 and later. Enter a range of client IP addresses that can use your cache.
SettingDetails.contentCachingDataPathDescription: Available for macOS 10.13.4 and later. The path of the directory that stores the cached content. Must be or end with /Library/Application Support/Apple/AssetCache/Data. If you change this setting later, your cached content won’t automatically move from the old to the new location. To move it automatically, device users will need to edit the location in System Preferences > Sharing > Content Caching.
SettingDetails.contentCachingDisableConnectionSharingDe: Available for macOS 10.15  and later. If you don’t configure, cached content will be deleted when the system needs more storage space.
SettingDetails.contentCachingDisableConnectionSharingNa: Block internet connection and cache content sharing
SettingDetails.contentCachingEnabledDescription: Available for macOS 10.13.4 and later. If enabled, content caching will occur whenever possible, and users won’t be able to disable it.
SettingDetails.contentCachingForceConnectionSharingDesc: Available for macOS 10.15.4 and later. Also known as tethered caching. If you enable, users will be able to share their internet connection and cached content with iOS or iPadOS devices that are connected to their Mac via USB. They won’t be able to disable this feature.
SettingDetails.contentCachingKeepAwakeName: Prevent the device from sleeping while caching is turned on
SettingDetails.contentCachingLogClientIdentitiesDescrip: Available for macOS 10.13.4 and later. Can be helpful to pinpoint client problems. Details logged include the IP address and port number of the clients using the device.
SettingDetails.contentCachingLogClientIdentitiesName: Enable cache to log client details
SettingDetails.contentCachingMaxSizeBytesDescription: Available for macOS 10.13.4 and later. The maximum amount of disk space (in bytes) you want to dedicate to cached content. When not configured, the number defaults to 0 bytes, which gives unlimited disk space to the cache.
SettingDetails.contentCachingParentSelectionPolicyDescr: Available for macOS 10.13.4 and later. The policy to use when a client needs help choosing a parent cache.
SettingDetails.contentCachingParentsDescription: Available for macOS 10.13.4 and later. Enter the local IP address of another content cache to add it as a parent cache. Your cache will  upload and download content to these caches instead of doing so directly with Apple.
SettingDetails.contentCachingPeerFilterRangesDescriptio: Available for macOS 10.13.4 and later. Enter a range of cache IP addresses to add other caches as peers. Peers can query each other about available content.
SettingDetails.contentCachingPeerListenRangesDescriptio: Available for macOS 10.13.4 and later. Enter a range of cache IP addresses to add other caches as peers. Peers can share and download content with each other as needed.
SettingDetails.contentCachingPortDescription: Available for macOS 10.13.4 and later. The number of the TCP port on the device. Used by your cache to accept requests for downloads/uploads. Enter 0 to use whatever port is available.
SettingDetails.contentCachingPublicRangesDescription: Available for macOS 10.13.4 and later. Enter a range of public cache IP addresses that the cloud servers should use to match client devices to caches.
SettingDetails.contentCachingTypeDescription: Available for macOS 10.13.4 and later. Shared content includes apps and software updates. iCloud content includes photos and documents.
SettingDetails.contentTypeToSyncAndroidDescription: User can temporarily turn syncing back on, until the policy syncs again.
SettingDetails.contentTypeToSyncDescription: In addition to email, you can use these settings to configure other items you want to synchronize like contacts, calendar, and tasks. Email is still synchronized, regardless of these settings.
SettingDetails.copyPasteBetweenWorkAndPersonalProfilesD: This setting controls whether or not apps in the work profile are allowed to share data with apps in the personal profile through copy and paste actions.
SettingDetails.copyPasteBetweenWorkAndPersonalProfilesN: Copy and paste between work and personal profiles.
SettingDetails.cryptographyAllowFipsAlgorithmPolicyDesc: Allow the Federal Information Processing Standard (FIPS) policy
SettingDetails.customAppConfigurationFileDescription: For the correct format of the uploaded file, please view the Intune documentation. Learn more
SettingDetails.customBoolError: All configuration keys of type Boolean must have a value of either "true" or "false".
SettingDetails.customIntError: All configuration keys of type integer must be a whole number value.
SettingDetails.customItemHideFromUserConfigurationDescr: Configure this setting if you don’t want an item’s window to be visible after login. This does not apply to servers.
SettingDetails.customPolicyConfigurationDeploymentChann: Select the channel you want to use to deploy your configuration profile. If the channel doesn’t match what’s listed for the payload in Apple documentation, deployment could fail. The selected channel cannot be changed once the profile has been created.
SettingDetails.customPolicyConfigurationProfileDescript: The profile name displayed to users.
SettingDetails.customWiFiPolicyProfileDescription: Wi-Fi connection name displayed to users
SettingDetails.dHGroupDescription: Diffie-Hellman group to be used during IKE (main mode) security association negotiation. Value must match VPN server settings.
SettingDetails.dNSNameDescription: Domain that automatically starts the VPN connection.
SettingDetails.dNSNameDescription1809: Indicates the namespace to which this rule applies. Enter either a fully-qualified domain name (FQDN) or a DNS suffix. Enter a period (.) at the beginning for a DNS suffix.
SettingDetails.dNSSearchDomainsName: When domains resolve using any of these DNS servers
SettingDetails.dNSServerDescription: DNS servers used to resolve the specified domain
SettingDetails.dNSTriggersTableDescription: DNS Triggers are for per-APP VPN.
SettingDetails.dNSTriggersTableIOSDescription: DNS Triggers are for per-APP VPN. For iOS, they only apply when authentication is set to certificates.
SettingDetails.dataProtectionBlockDirectMemoryAccessDes: This policy setting allows you to block direct memory access (DMA) for all hot pluggable PCI downstream ports until a user logs into Windows.
SettingDetails.dataSharingBetweenWorkAndPersonalProfile: This setting specifies whether or not apps in the work profile are allowed to share data with apps in the personal profile.
Data sharing between work and personal profiles.
SettingDetails.dataSharingTypeDescription: This setting specifies whether or not apps in the work profile are allowed to share data with apps in the personal profile.
SettingDetails.dataSharingTypeName: Data sharing between work and personal profiles
SettingDetails.dateAndTimeBlockChangesDescription: Block user from changing date and time on device (Samsung KNOX).
SettingDetails.dateAndTimeBlockChangesName: Block date and time changes (Samsung KNOX)
SettingDetails.dateTimeConfigurationBlockedDescription: Block user from manually setting the date and time.
SettingDetails.daysDescription: Select days to stop updates from installing.
SettingDetails.daysMonthsOrYears: Enter number of days, months, or years
SettingDetails.daysOfEmailToSynchronizeDescription: Control how much email the client will synchronize.
SettingDetails.daysToTrackResolvedMalwareDescription: Days to wait before deleting quarantined malware. 0-90, 0 means never delete.
SettingDetails.deadPeerDetectionRateDescription: Determine how often to check if a peer connection is still active. Low sends a keepalive message every 30 minutes, Medium sends a keepalive message every 10 minutes, and High sends a keepalive message every 60 seconds. Select None to disable dead peer detection.​
SettingDetails.deadlineForFeatureUpdatesDescription: Specifies the number of days a user has before feature updates are installed on their devices automatically
SettingDetails.deadlineForQualityUpdatesDescription: Specifies the number of days a user has before quality updates are installed on their devices automatically
SettingDetails.deadlineGracePeriodDescription: Specifies a minimum number of days after deadline until restarts occur automatically
SettingDetails.dedicatedAndroidEnrollmentTypesHeaderDes: These settings only work for dedicated devices.
SettingDetails.defaultAppPermissionPolicyDescription: This setting specifies the default permission policy for all apps in the work profile. Recommended value: Prompt
SettingDetails.defaultMostSecureToolTip: The default value for this setting is the most secure option.
SettingDetails.defaultNotificationsOption: Use the default Windows Update notifications
SettingDetails.defaultPermissionPolicyDescription: Define the default permission policy for requests for runtime permissions.
SettingDetails.defaultPrinterDescription: Name (network host name) of an installed printer.
SettingDetails.defenderDetectedMalwareActionsDescriptio: Allow to specify any valid threat severity levels and the corresponding default action to take. Only enforced in desktop devices running Windows 10 or later.
SettingDetails.defenderDisableCatchupFullScanDescriptio: This setting allows you to configure catch-up scans for scheduled full scans. A catch-up scan is a scan that is initiated because a regularly scheduled scan was missed. If you block this setting, catch-up scans for scheduled full scans will be turned off.​
SettingDetails.defenderDisableCatchupQuickScanDescripti: This setting allows you to configure catch-up scans for scheduled quick scans. A catch-up scan is a scan that is initiated because a regularly scheduled scan was missed. If you block this setting, catch-up scans for scheduled quick scans will be turned off.​
SettingDetails.defenderPotentiallyUnwantedAppActionDesc: Added in Windows 10, version 1607. Specifies the level of detection for potentially unwanted applications. Default is off.
SettingDetails.defenderScheduleScanDayDesc: Selects the day that the Microsoft Defender scan should run
SettingDetails.defenderScheduleScanEnableLowCpuPriority: This setting allows you to enable or disable low CPU priority for scheduled scans. If you enable this setting, low CPU priority will be used during scheduled scans.​
Configure low CPU priority for scheduled scans​
SettingDetails.defenderSecurityCenterContactOptionsText: Specify at least one of the following contact options.
SettingDetails.defenderSecurityCenterDisableAccountUIDe: Configure if end users can view the Account protection area in the Microsoft Defender Security Center. Hiding this section will also block all notifications related to Account protection.
SettingDetails.defenderSecurityCenterDisableAppBrowserU: Configure if end users can view the App and browser control area in the Microsoft Defender Security center. Hiding this section will also block all notifications related to App and browser control.
SettingDetails.defenderSecurityCenterDisableClearTpmUID: Configure the display of the Clear TPM button.
SettingDetails.defenderSecurityCenterDisableFamilyUIDes: Configure if end users can view the Family options area in the Microsoft Defender Security center. Hiding this section will also block all notifications related Family options.
SettingDetails.defenderSecurityCenterDisableHardwareUID: Configure if end users can view the Hardware protection area in the Microsoft Defender Security Center. Hiding this section will also block all notifications related to Hardware protection.
SettingDetails.defenderSecurityCenterDisableHealthUIDes: Configure if end users can view the Device performance and health area in the Microsoft Defender Security center. Hiding this section will also block all notifications related to Device performance and health.
SettingDetails.defenderSecurityCenterDisableNetworkUIDe: Configure if end users can view the Firewall and network protection area in the Microsoft Defender Security center. Hiding this section will also block all notifications related to Firewall and network protection.
SettingDetails.defenderSecurityCenterDisableNotificatio: Configure the display of the notification area control. The user needs to either sign out and sign in or reboot the computer for this setting to take effect.
Windows Security Center icon in the system tray
SettingDetails.defenderSecurityCenterDisableRansomwareU: Configure if end users can view the Ransomware protection area in the Microsoft Defender Security Center. Hiding this section will also block all notifications related to Ransomware protection.
SettingDetails.defenderSecurityCenterDisableSecureBootU: Configure if end users can view the Secure boot protection area in the Microsoft Defender Security Center. Hiding this section will also block all notifications related to Secure boot protection.
SettingDetails.defenderSecurityCenterDisableTroubleshoo: Configure if end users can view the Security process troubleshooting area in the Microsoft Defender Security Center. Hiding this section will also block all notifications related to Security process troubleshooting.
SettingDetails.defenderSecurityCenterDisableVirusUIDesc: Configure if end users can view the Virus and threat protection area in the Microsoft Defender Security Center. Hiding this section will also block all notifications related to Virus and threat protection.
SettingDetails.defenderSecurityCenterDisableVulnerableT: Configure the display of update TPM Firmware when a vulnerable firmware is detected.
SettingDetails.defenderSecurityCenterHeaderText: Microsoft Defender Security Center app and notifications
SettingDetails.defenderSecurityCenterHelpEmailDescripti: Enter an email address end users can use to reach the IT department.
SettingDetails.defenderSecurityCenterHelpPhoneDescripti: Enter a phone number or Skype ID end users can use to reach the IT department.
SettingDetails.defenderSecurityCenterHelpPhoneName: IT department phone number or Skype ID
SettingDetails.defenderSecurityCenterHelpURLDescription: Enter the IT department’s support website URL.
SettingDetails.defenderSecurityCenterITContactDisplayDe: Configure where to display IT contact information to end users.
SettingDetails.defenderSecurityCenterITContactDisplayDi: Display in app and in notifications
SettingDetails.defenderSecurityCenterITContactInformati: Provide IT contact information to appear in Microsoft Defender Security Center app and the app notifications.
SettingDetails.defenderSecurityCenterNotificationsFromA: Choose which notifications to display to end users. Non-critical notifications include summaries of Microsoft Defender Antivirus activity, including notifications when scans have completed. All other notifications are considered critical.
Notifications from the displayed areas of app
SettingDetails.defenderSecurityCenterSubHeaderText: Block end user access to the various areas of Microsoft Defender Security Center app. Hiding a section will also block  related notifications.
SettingDetails.defenderSecurityCenterTamperProtectionDe:
Not Configured state is default and will have no impact.
Enabled will enable the Tamper Protection restrictions.
Disabled will disable the Tamper Protection restrictions.
When the Enabled or Disabled state exists on a client, deploying Not configured will have no impact on the setting. To change the state from currently Enabled/Disabled, you must deploy the opposite setting to have effect.
SettingDetails.defenderSubmitSamplesConsentTypeDesc: Checks for the user consent level in Microsoft Defender to send data
SettingDetails.delayAllUpdateVisibilityOption: Major, minor, and non-OS software updates
SettingDetails.delayMajorAndMinorOSUpdateVisibilityOpti: Major and Minor OS software updates
SettingDetails.delayMajorAndNonOSUpdateVisibilityOption: Major OS and non-OS software updates
SettingDetails.delayMinorAndNonOSUpdateVisibilityOption: Minor OS and non-OS software updates
SettingDetails.deliveryOptimizationDODescription: Specifies the download method that Delivery Optimization can use to manage network bandwidth consumption for content distribution scenarios.
SettingDetails.deliveryOptimizationDescription: Specify the download method that will be used to download Windows Updates.
SettingDetails.deliveryOptimizationWUfBHeader: This setting has been replaced, going forward configure the “Download mode” setting from Device Configuration as a “Windows 10 and later” profile, with profile type Delivery Optimization. Learn more about this setting's migration.
SettingDetails.derivedCredentialAppAuthenticationHeader: Create and assign a derived credential profile. This profile enables certificate-based authentication in apps.
Learn more about using derived credentials.
SettingDetails.derivedCredentialsTenantLevelNotConfigur: You have not specified a derived credential issuer for your tenant so that this policy can successfully apply to devices. Click here to specify the issuer.
SettingDetails.developerUnlockDescription: Specifies whether developer unlock is allowed.
SettingDetails.deviceEnrollmentAndAutomatedDeviceEnroll: These settings work for devices that were enrolled in Intune through device enrollment, and for devices enrolled using Apple School Manager or Apple Business Manager with automated device enrollment (formerly DEP).

These settings work for devices that were enrolled in Intune through device enrollment, and for devices enrolled using Apple School Manager or Apple Business Manager with automated device enrollment (formerly DEP). This includes all supervised devices.
These settings work for devices that were enrolled with or without user approval through device enrollment, and for devices enrolled with automated device enrollment (formerly DEP).
Device enrollment and automated device enrollment
Device enrollment and automated device enrollment
SettingDetails.deviceExperienceTypeConfigureMicrosoftLa: Configure Microsoft Launcher on your fully managed devices.
SettingDetails.deviceExperienceTypeDescription: Based on the experience you want to configure, select Kiosk Mode or Microsoft Launcher to start configuring the experience on your devices. If you don't select a device experience type, users will see the device's default home screen experience.
SettingDetails.deviceExperienceTypeMakeMicrosoftLaunche: Use Microsoft Launcher to customize the home screen experience on your org's managed devices. If you make Launcher the default, device users won't be able to use another launcher.
Make Microsoft Launcher the default launcher
SettingDetails.deviceExperienceTypeMicrosoftLauncherCon: Users will not be able to change the wallpaper unless you allow them to. This setting is only available if you configure a custom wallpaper.
Lets you apply your own image as the home screen wallpaper and choose if the user can change it. If you don't configure a custom wallpaper, the device will keep its current wallpaper.
This image will be appear as the wallpaper on the device home screen. This field is only available if you configure a custom wallpaper.

If you allow the user to change the dock's presence, the previous setting will be enforced for the initial deployment. For subsequent deployments, the setting will not be enforced to respect any changes the user may have made. This setting is only available if you configure the dock's presence.
Allow user to change dock presence
The dock is a menu that gives device users quick access to their apps and tools. When it's hidden, users must swipe up to access it.

If you allow the user to enable/disable the feed, the previous setting will be enforced for the initial deployment. For subsequent deployments, the setting will not be enforced to respect any changes the user may have made. This setting is only available if you enable the launcher feed.
The feed is an additional screen to the right of the home screen where device users can access their calendars, documents, and recent activities. If you don't enable it, it will remain disabled.
SettingDetails.deviceGuardCredentialGuardDescription: Enabling with UEFI lock ensures that Credential Guard cannot be remotely disabled. Enabling without UEFI lock allows Credential Guard to be disabled remotely via Group Policy.
SettingDetails.deviceOwnerKioskHeadingText: Configure a kiosk-style experience on your dedicated devices. Prior to configuring these settings, go to Client apps and deploy any apps you want to the devices.
SettingDetails.deviceOwnerKioskLearnMoreText: Learn about Android Enterprise dedicated devices.
SettingDetails.devicePasswordBlockKeyguardFeaturesRepor: Device password: Disabled lock screen features
SettingDetails.devicePasswordExpirationDaysReportingNam: Device password: Number of days until password expires
SettingDetails.devicePasswordHeader: Configure settings that apply to the personal profile on devices using a work profile.
SettingDetails.devicePasswordMinimumLetterCharactersRep: Device password: Number of characters required
SettingDetails.devicePasswordMinimumLowerCaseCharacters: Device password: Number of lowercase characters required
SettingDetails.devicePasswordMinimumNonLetterCharacters: Device password: Number of non-letter characters required
SettingDetails.devicePasswordMinimumNumericCharactersRe: Device password: Number of numeric characters required
SettingDetails.devicePasswordMinimumSymbolCharactersRep: Device password: Number of symbol characters required
SettingDetails.devicePasswordMinimumUpperCaseCharacters: Device password: Number of uppercase characters required
SettingDetails.devicePasswordPreviousPasswordBlockCount: Device password: Number of passwords required before user can reuse a password
SettingDetails.devicePasswordSignInFailureCountBeforeFa: Device password: Number of sign-in failures before wiping device
SettingDetails.deviceSharingAssetTagInformationDescript: Message displayed at the bottom of the login window and lock screen.
SettingDetails.deviceSharingLockScreenFootnoteDescripti: Message displayed on the login window and lock screen.
SettingDetails.deviceTunnelValidationErrorMessage: Device Tunnel requires AlwaysOn to be enabled, authentication set to "Machine Certificates" and Device Scope to be "Device".
SettingDetails.devicesPageDescription: Block access to Devices in Settings app.
SettingDetails.dfciBuiltinHeaderDescName: DFCI can only manage hardware components built into the device. These settings cannot manage attached peripherals (e.g. USB webcams).
SettingDetails.dfciGranularSettingsWarningInfoBox: Warning! The options below are only applicable to certain types of devices. If targeted to non-eligible device, they will report as Non complaint and the devices might not be protected. Learn more
SettingDetails.dfciHeaderName:
Use the Device Firmware Configuration Interface (DFCI) to remotely manage a device's UEFI settings. Learn more.

You can only manage these settings for devices that meet the following requirements:
  • The device manufacturer supports DFCI.
  • The device is registered with the Windows Autopilot deployment service.
  • The device has been rebooted since the last MDM sync.
SettingDetails.diagnosticDataSubmissionLevelDescription: Select level of diagnostic data submission. The enhanced level is not supported after Windows version 1903.
SettingDetails.digitsLowerUpperLettersOption: Require digits, lowercase and uppercase letters
SettingDetails.digitsLowerUpperLettersSpecialCharsOptio: Require digits, lowercase, uppercase, and special characters
SettingDetails.disableAllNotificationsOption: Turn off all notifications, including restart warnings
SettingDetails.disableDeviceLocationDescription: Blocking also prevents admins from locating devices.
SettingDetails.disableMacAddressRandomizationDescriptio: Force devices connecting using this profile to present their actual Wi-Fi MAC address instead of a random MAC address. Since this allows devices to be tracked by MAC address, you should only do this when necessary, such as for network access control (NAC) support. Applies to iOS 14 and later.
SettingDetails.disableOnDemandUserOverrideDescription: Force the On-demand VPN setting to turn on. If you block them, your users will see the on-demand VPN setting on their device but won't be able to make changes to it. Applies to iOS 14 and later.
SettingDetails.disableOnDemandUserOverrideMacOSDescript: Force the On-demand VPN setting to turn on. If you block them, your users will see the on-demand VPN setting on their device but won't be able to make changes to it. Applies to MacOS 11 and later.
SettingDetails.disableOnDemandUserOverrideName: Block users from disabling automatic VPN
SettingDetails.disableUserPromptForServerValidation: Disable user prompts for server validation
SettingDetails.disableUserPromptForServerValidationDesc: Disable to prevent the user from being prompted to authorize new PEAP servers for trusted certification authorities.
SettingDetails.disconnectOnIdleDescription: Enable to disconnect the VPN connection after a specified number of seconds of inactivity.
SettingDetails.disconnectOnIdleInfo: Disconnect on idle and Disconnect on idle timer apply to only when per-app VPN or on-demand VPN is configured.
SettingDetails.disconnectOnIdleTimerDescription: The length of time in seconds to wait before disconnecting a per-app VPN or on-demand VPN connection.
SettingDetails.disconnectOnSleepDescription: Enable to disconnect the VPN connection when the device goes to sleep.
SettingDetails.displayAppListWithGdiDPIScalingTurnedOff: GDI DPI Scaling lets apps that are not DPI aware to become per-monitor DPI aware. Specify the legacy apps that will have GDI DPI Scaling turned off. With GDI DPI Scaling configured to both turn on and turn off on an app, scaling is turned off for the app.
Turn off GDI scaling for apps.
SettingDetails.displayAppListWithGdiDPIScalingTurnedOnD: GDI DPI Scaling lets apps that are not DPI aware to become per-monitor DPI aware. Specify the legacy apps that will have GDI DPI Scaling turned on. With GDI DPI Scaling configured to both turn on and turn off on an app, scaling is turned off for the app.
SettingDetails.displayAppListWithGdiDPIScalingTurnedOnN: Turn on GDI scaling for apps.
SettingDetails.doBackgroundDownloadFromHttpDelayInSecon: Delay the use of the HTTP source in a background download to prioritize the download from peers. After the max delay is reached, the download will resume from the http source. Recommended value is 60 seconds.
SettingDetails.doBandwidthModeDescription: Select the maximum bandwidth that Delivery Optimization uses across all concurrent download activities. Downloads from LAN peers are not throttled even when this policy is set.
SettingDetails.doForegroundDownloadFromHttpDelayInSecon: Delay of the use of the HTTP source in a foreground download to prioritize the download from peers. After the max delay is reached, the download will resume from the http source. Recommended value is 60 seconds.​
SettingDetails.doGroupIdCustomDescription: Use a GUID as the Group ID to create your own custom peer groups, for example if you need to create a group for all devices in a branch office.
SettingDetails.doGroupIdSourceDescription: Group ID is assigned automatically from the selected source. To set your own Group ID select “Custom” and provide a GUID.​
SettingDetails.doMaxCacheAgeDescription: The maximum retention period for each content item in the cache. The recommended value is 7 days.
SettingDetails.doMaxCacheSizeDescription: The maximum cache size Delivery Optimization can utilize, in GB.
SettingDetails.doMaxCacheSizePercentageDescription: The maximum cache size Delivery Optimization can utilize, as a percentage of disk size.​
SettingDetails.doMaxCacheTypeDescription: The maximum cache size that Delivery Optimization can utilize as a either a percentage of disk size, or absolute value (in GB).
SettingDetails.doMaximumBackgroundBandwidthDescription: The maximum background download bandwidth as a percentage of available download bandwidth. The recommended value is 25%. The minimum Value is 5%.
SettingDetails.doMaximumDownloadBandwidthDescription: The maximum download bandwidth that can be used across all concurrent Delivery Optimization downloads in kilobytes per second (KB/s).
SettingDetails.doMaximumForegroundBandwidthDescription: The maximum foreground download bandwidth as a percentage of available download bandwidth. The recommended value is 70%. The minimum Value is 5%.
SettingDetails.doMaximumUploadBandwidthDescription: The maximum upload bandwidth that can be used across all concurrent Delivery Optimization uploads in kilobytes per second (KB/s).
SettingDetails.doMinBatteryDescription: Minimum battery level required to upload data to peers while on battery power. Uploads will automatically pause when the battery level drops below the set minimum battery level. The recommended value is 40%.
SettingDetails.doMinBatteryName: Minimum battery level required to upload (in %)​
SettingDetails.doMinDiskDescription: Minimum disk size required on devices to use peer caching. The recommended value is 32 GB.
SettingDetails.doMinDiskName: Minimum disk size required for peer caching (in GB)​
SettingDetails.doMinFileSizeDescription: Minimum content file size required to use peer caching. The recommended value is 10 MB.
SettingDetails.doMinFileSizeName: Minimum content file size for peer caching (in MB)​
SettingDetails.doMinRamDescription: Minimum RAM required on devices to use peer caching. The recommended value is 4 GB.
SettingDetails.doMinRamName: Minimum RAM required for peer caching (in GB)​
SettingDetails.doModifyCacheDescription: The device drive that Delivery Optimization will use for its cache. The drive location can be specified using environment variables, drive letter or full path.
SettingDetails.doVpnPeerCachingDescription: Enables the device to participate in peer caching while connected via VPN to the domain network.​
SettingDetails.domainAllowListDescription: Further control or limit the Google accounts added in the work profile by manually adding or importing a list of allowed domains using format like "contoso.com". If you don't add anything, any Google account can be added to the work profile.​
SettingDetails.domainAuthorizedAppRulesSummaryLabel: Authorized application Windows Firewall rules from the local store (Domain networks)
SettingDetails.domainGlobalRulesSummaryLabel: Global port Windows Firewall rules from the local store (Domain networks)
SettingDetails.domainIPsecRulesSummaryLabel: IPsec rules from the local store (Domain networks)
SettingDetails.domainIPsecSecuredPacketExemptionSummary: IPsec secured packet exemption with Stealth Mode (Domain networks)
SettingDetails.domainInboundConnectionsSummaryLabel: Default action for inbound connections (Domain networks)
SettingDetails.domainLocalStoreSummaryLabel: Windows Firewall rules from the local store (Domain networks)
SettingDetails.domainOutboundConnectionsSummaryLabel: Default action for outbound connections (Domain networks)
SettingDetails.domainUnicastResponsesToMulticastBroadca: Unicast responses to multicast broadcasts (Domain networks)
SettingDetails.domainsEmailDomainsBladeDescription: Emails that the user sends or receives which don't match the domains you specify here will be marked as untrusted.
SettingDetails.domainsEmailDomainsTableDescription: Emails that the user sends or receives which don't match the domains you specify here will be marked as untrusted.
SettingDetails.domainsInList: Search domains in the following list
SettingDetails.domainsOptional: When users try to access these domains
SettingDetails.domainsSafariPasswordAutoFillDomainsBlad: Users can save passwords in Safari only from URLs matching the patterns you specify here. To use this setting, the device must be in supervised mode and not configured for multiple users. (iOS 9.3+)
SettingDetails.domainsWebDomainsBladeDescription: Documents downloaded from the URLs you specify here will be considered managed (Safari only).
SettingDetails.eAPTypeDescription: Select the Extensible Authentication Protocol (EAP) type that is configured on your Wi-Fi network.
SettingDetails.eDPPolicyAllowDecryptAppDataName: Allow decryption of data created or edited by above apps
SettingDetails.eDPPolicyAppManagementModeAuditName: Audit enterprise data leaving app. User is not prompted.
SettingDetails.eDPPolicyAppManagementModeBlockName: Block enterprise data from leaving app
SettingDetails.eDPPolicyAppManagementModeName: App management mode for these apps
SettingDetails.eDPPolicyAppManagementModeOffName: No prompting or auditing of enterprise data leaving app.
SettingDetails.eDPPolicyAppManagementModePromptName: Prompt user to allow enterprise data to leave app. Affirmative prompts are audited.
SettingDetails.eDPPolicyIntroductionDescription: Before beginning, ensure you understand the implications of deploying EDP policies to managed devices. Learn more about EDP policies http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=627529
SettingDetails.eDPPolicyIntroductionName: Before beginning, ensure you understand the implications of deploying EDP policies to managed devices.
SettingDetails.eDPPolicyNetworkLocationsName: Specify network locations the above apps can access. No other apps can access these locations.
SettingDetails.eDPPolicyOptionalRecoveryCertificateDesc: When a Windows Information Protection policy is configured, Windows encrypts corporate data on the local disk. In the event that the local encryption keys are lost or revoked, the encrypted data becomes unrecoverable. Providing a DRA (Data Recovery Agent) cert will help mitigate this. Windows uses the public key in the DRA cert to encrypt local data. The private key is in your control, allowing recovery of the encrypted data.
SettingDetails.eDPPolicyOptionalRecoveryCertificateName: Data Recovery Agent (DRA) certificate to allow recovery of encrypted data
SettingDetails.eDPPolicyPrimaryDomainDescription: (e.g. contoso.com) Data accessed by protected apps is encrypted and tagged with the first domain name specified. Specify multiple domains with a pipe character (e.g. one.com|two.com).
SettingDetails.eDPPolicyProtectAppContentWhenDeviceLock: Protect app content when device is locked for above apps
SettingDetails.easServicesDescription: For devices running iOS/iPadOS 13.0 or later. By default, Exchange ActiveSync syncs all Exchange data types to iOS devices. Alternatively, you can select to sync only certain data.
SettingDetails.easServicesLinkText: Learn more about each data type.
SettingDetails.easServicesUserOverrideEnabledDescriptio:
For devices running iOS/iPadOS 13.0 or later. By default, iOS users can change the Exchange sync settings on their device. If in the previous setting you selected to sync only certain data, we recommend selecting No for this setting, as this
 will prevent the user from modifying what's synced. ​​​
SettingDetails.easServicesUserOverrideEnabledName: Allow users to change sync settings
SettingDetails.easeOfAccessPageDescription: Block access to Ease of Access in Settings app.
SettingDetails.edgeAllowAddressBarDropdownDescription:
Address bar dropdown is allowed.
Select No, to block address bar dropdown which will also disable search suggestions and minimize network connections from Microsoft Edge to Microsoft Services.
SettingDetails.edgeAllowAutofillDescription: Autofill to populate form fields automatically is allowed. Select No, to disable.
SettingDetails.edgeAllowChangesToFavoritesDescription: Users are blocked from making changes to favorites. To allow users to change favorites. Select Yes, and the favorites list setting must be blank.
SettingDetails.edgeAllowExtensionsDescription: Users are allowed to add or personalize extensions in Microsoft Edge. Select No, to block users from modifying extensions.
SettingDetails.edgeAllowInPrivateBrowsingDescription: InPrivate browsing is allowed. Select No, to block InPrivate browsing.
SettingDetails.edgeAllowLiveTileDataCollectionDescripti: Microsoft Edge collects the Live Tile metadata and sends to Microsoft. Select No, to block collection of Live Tile metadata
SettingDetails.edgeAllowPasswordManagerDescription: Password manager is enabled to save and manage passwords. Select No, to disable.
SettingDetails.edgeAllowPopUpsDescription: Pop-ups are allowed. Select No, to block pop-ups with pop-up blocker.
SettingDetails.edgeAllowSearchEngineCustomizationDescri: Choose whether end users are allowed to make changes to the search engine.
SettingDetails.edgeAllowStartPagesModificationDescripti: Users are allowed to change Start pages. Select No to prevent users from modifying the start pages.
SettingDetails.edgeAllowStartPagesModificationName: Allow user to change Start pages
SettingDetails.edgeBlockCompatibilityListDescription: This list from Microsoft helps Edge properly display sites with known compatibility issues. Set No, to block.
SettingDetails.edgeBlockFullScreenModeDescription: Full screen mode is enabled. Select No, to disable entering full screen mode.
SettingDetails.edgeBlockLiveTileDataCollectionDescripti: Microsoft Edge collects the Live Tile metadata and sends to Microsoft. Select No, to block collection of Live Tile metadata.
SettingDetails.edgeBlockPrelaunchDescription: Pre-launching helps the performance of Microsoft Edge and minimizes the amount of time required to start Microsoft Edge. Set No, to prevent pre-launching of Microsoft Edge.​
SettingDetails.edgeBlockPrelaunchName: Prelaunch Start pages and new Tab​ page
SettingDetails.edgeBlockPrintingDescription: Printing is enabled. Select No, to disable the "print" option in More Actions and Context menus in Microsoft Edge.
SettingDetails.edgeBlockSavingHistoryDescription: Microsoft Edge saves the browsing history. Select No, to prevent saving history.
SettingDetails.edgeBlockSideloadingExtensionsDescriptio: Users are allowed to sideload extensions in Microsoft Edge using the "Load extensions" feature. Select No, to block users from sideloading extensions.
SettingDetails.edgeBlockTabPreloadingDescription: Preloading minimizes the amount of time required to start Microsoft Edge and load web page. Set No, to prevent preloading of tabs.
SettingDetails.edgeBlockTabPreloadingName: Preload Start pages and new Tab page​
SettingDetails.edgeBlockWebContentOnNewTabPageDescripti: When set to Yes, Microsoft Edge will open the URL specified in the "New Tab URL" setting. If "New Tab URL" setting is blank, Microsoft Edge opens the new Tab page listed in Edge settings, and users can change it. When set to No, Microsoft Edge opens a new tab with a blank page and users cannot change it.​​
SettingDetails.edgeBlockWebContentOnNewTabPageName: Allow web content on new Tab page​
SettingDetails.edgeClearBrowsingDataOnExitDescription: Microsoft Edge doesn't clear browsing data on exit. Select Yes, to clear browsing data on exiting Microsoft Edge.
SettingDetails.edgeClearBrowsingDataOnExitName: Clear browsing data on exit (Desktop only)
SettingDetails.edgeClearBrowsingDataOnExitV2Description: Microsoft Edge doesn't clear browsing data on exit. Select Yes, to clear browsing data on exiting Microsoft Edge.
SettingDetails.edgeDisableFirstRunPageDescription: Microsoft Edge displays webpage on first use of Microsoft Edge. Set No, to disable this webpage.
SettingDetails.edgeDisableFirstRunPageName: Show First Run Experience page (Mobile only)
SettingDetails.edgeDisplayHomeButtonDescription: Show or hide the Home button.
SettingDetails.edgeFavoritesBarOptionDefault: On Start and new Tab pages
SettingDetails.edgeFavoritesDescription: By default this setting is blank and users can customize favorites. To publish favorites to Edge and prevent users from changing them, provide a list of favorites (HTML file type).
SettingDetails.edgeFavoritesV2Description: Add the path to the file location of the favorites list, example: http://contoso.com/Kioskfavorites.html.
SettingDetails.edgeHomeButtonConfigurationEnabledDescri: Users are blocked from changing the home button. Select Yes, to allow users to modify the home page(s).​

SettingDetails.edgeKioskFooter: Additional settings for Microsoft Edge Kiosk mode are available in the Microsoft Edge Browser section of the device restrictions policy for devices running Windows 10 or later. Microsoft Edge Browser settings configured in device restrictions for devices running Windows 10 or later only apply to Microsoft Edge version 45 and earlier.
SettingDetails.edgeKioskFooterInPrivateNormalMode: Additional settings for Microsoft Edge Kiosk mode; Normal mode, need to be set in a separate profile: Device Configuration/ Device Restrictions/ Microsoft Edge Browser.
SettingDetails.edgeKioskHeader: By default Microsoft Edge runs in digital / interactive signage mode for Windows 10 and later single app kiosk mode. Learn more about Microsoft Edge kiosk mode.
SettingDetails.edgeKioskHeader1: When kiosk mode is single full-screen app, not configured means Microsoft Edge runs InPrivate full screen for digital signage or interactive displays.​ When kiosk mode is multi app, not configured means Microsoft Edge runs as normal. ​Use setting below to configure Microsoft Edge to support public browsing.
SettingDetails.edgeKioskHeaderEdge86: This kiosk profile requires Microsoft Edge version 87 and later with Windows 10 version 1909 and later. Learn more about Microsoft Edge kiosk mode.
SettingDetails.edgeKioskHeaderMultiApp: By default, Microsoft Edge runs in normal mode (full version of Microsoft Edge). Learn more about Microsoft Edge kiosk mode
SettingDetails.edgeKioskLearnMore: Learn more about configuring Microsoft Edge in Kiosk Mode.

SettingDetails.edgeKioskModeTypeNormalMode: Normal mode (full version of Microsoft Edge)
SettingDetails.edgeKioskResetAfterIdleTimeInMinutesDesc: Edge kiosk mode will reset after inactivity. Available range in minutes:
SettingDetails.edgeNewTabPageUrlDescription: New tabs will open a blank page. Enter a URL to open a web page, example: http://contoso.com
SettingDetails.edgeNewTabUrlDescription: New tabs will open a blank page. Enter a URL to open a web page, example: http://contoso.com

SettingDetails.edgePreventCertificateErrorOverrideDescr: Users can access webpages that contain Secure Sockets Layer/Transport Layer Security (SSL/TLS) errors. Select No, to block users from accessing these websites with certificate errors - recommended for increased security.
SettingDetails.edgeProfileKioskModeDescription: Filter Edge browser settings appropriate for the selected Edge kiosk mode. Default is not to use Edge kiosk mode and all Edge browser settings are available to configure. All settings apply to Microsoft Edge Legacy (Version 45 and earlier).
SettingDetails.edgeProfileKioskModeDigitalSignageHeader: Displays a specific site in full-screen mode, running Microsoft Edge InPrivate protecting user data
SettingDetails.edgeProfileKioskModePublicBrowsingSingle: There are three settings available for loading websites from Edge: Home button URL, Start pages, and new tab URL.
SettingDetails.edgeProvideFavoritesListDescription: Select Yes, to provide a list of favorites. Users are blocked from making changes to favorites.
SettingDetails.edgeRequiredExtensionPackageFamilyNamesD: This setting allows you to specify a list of extensions that cannot be turned off by the user in Microsoft Edge. To learn how to find the package family name of an extension, refer here: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sccm/protect/deploy-use/find-a-pfn-for-per-app-vpn.
SettingDetails.edgeRestrictChangesToFavoritesDescriptio: Users are allowed to make changes to favorites. Set No, to block users from changing favorites.
SettingDetails.edgeShowFavoritesBarDescription: Show or hide the favorites bar.
SettingDetails.edgeShowFavoritesDescription: Show or hide the Favorites bar.​
SettingDetails.edgeShowMessageWhenOpeningInternetExplor: Configure Microsoft Edge to display a notification before a site opens in Internet Explorer 11.
Message when opening sites in Internet Explorer​
SettingDetails.edgeShowSearchSuggestionsDescription: Search suggestions in the address bar are allowed. Select No, to block search suggestions.
SettingDetails.edgeStartPageDescription: List of URLs that specify the Start page for MDM-enrolled devices (Desktop only).
SettingDetails.edgeStartPagesDescription: List of URLs that specify Start pages for MDM-enrolled devices (Desktop only). Enter URLs on separate lines.

SettingDetails.edgeTelemetryForMicrosoft365AnalyticsDes: To see available options for this setting, you must set Share usage data to Enhanced or Optional. Select how you want to share browsing history data with Microsoft 365 Analytics. When set to the default, Not configured, browsing history data is not collected or shared.

SettingDetails.educationProfileAccountNameDesc: The user name of the test taking account. The user can be a domain account (domain\user), a Microsoft Entra account (username@tenant.com) or a local account (username).
SettingDetails.educationProfileAccountNameTypeDesc: The account type of test taking account.
SettingDetails.educationProfileLaunchUriDesc: Url link to an assessment that's automatically loaded when the secure assessment browser is launched.
SettingDetails.educationProfileTakeATestHeader:
Specify the URL of a high-stakes test, and the account users must use to sign into the test. When the user signs in,
    the Take a Test app automatically launches with the test you specified. No other apps can be run on the device while the test is in progress.
SettingDetails.educationProfileTakeATestHeaderDesc: The account can be a local guest account or be in one of the following formats: username, domain\username, computer name\username, username@tenant.com
SettingDetails.educationProfileTakeATestPrintingCapDesc: Students can only access the Take a Test app from devices that are connected to a printer. Also makes the app’s print button available to students.
SettingDetails.educationProfileTakeATestScreenCaptureDe: Allow students and teachers to use screen capture and screen recording tools in the Take a Test app. Teachers can use these tools to see what students are doing in the app.
SettingDetails.educationProfileTakeATestTextSuggestionD: Indicates whether or not to block text suggestions during the test.
SettingDetails.emailAddressTypeDescription: The attribute Intune gets from Microsoft Entra ID to dynamically generate the email address that will be used by this profile e.g. MyName@contoso.com (UPN).

Enables Device Compliance flow from the client. When enabled, the VPN client will attempt to communicate with Microsoft Entra ID to get a certificate to use for authentication.
     The VPN should be set up to use certificate authentication and the VPN server must trust the server returned by Microsoft Entra ID.
SettingDetails.enableConditionalAccessName: Conditional access for this VPN connection

SettingDetails.enableEmailMessageMoveDescription: Control moving email messages between different email accounts.
SettingDetails.enableEmailMessageMoveName: Allow messages to be moved to other email accounts

For example, if you type 'anonymous', each user that authenticates with this Wi-Fi connection using their real user name is displayed as 'anonymous'. This may be required if using device-based certificate authentication.

SettingDetails.enableSingleSignOnDescription: Choose a certificate different from the VPN authentication certificate for Kerberos authentication, in the case of device compliance.

SettingDetails.exploitGuardEPBlockEditingName: User editing of exploit protection interface
SettingDetails.exploitGuardEPExplainationPart1: Configure memory, control flow and policy restrictions that can be used to protect an application from exploits. Each mitigation can be enabled in Audit/Block mode.
SettingDetails.exploitGuardEPExplainationPart2: To enable exploit protection create an XML file representing the system and application mitigation settings of your choice. You can do so using one of two methods:
SettingDetails.exploitGuardEPExplainationPart3: PowerShell: Use one or more of the Get-ProcessMitigation, Set-ProcessMitigation, and ConvertTo-ProcessMitigationPolicy PowerShell cmdlets to configure mitigation settings and export an XML representation of them.
SettingDetails.exploitGuardEPExplainationPart4: Microsoft Defender Security Center UI: In the Microsoft Defender Security Center, click on App & browser control and then scroll to the bottom of the resulting screen to find Exploit Protection. First, use the System settings and Program settings tabs to configure mitigation settings. Then, find the Export settings link at the bottom of the screen to export an XML representation of them.
SettingDetails.exploitGuardEPWarningMessage: You can only revert these settings by manually applying XML to objects in this group.
SettingDetails.exploitGuardNFProtectionDesc: Block outbound connection from any app to IP/domains with low reputations
SettingDetails.exploitGuardNFTitle: Block outbound connection from any app to low reputation IP/domain · This can be enabled in Audit/Block mode.
SettingDetails.factoryResetProtectionEmailsDescription: Email addresses of device admins for factory reset protection.  When a device is factory reset, it will require that one of these admins log in with their Google account to unlock the device.  If none are specified, factory reset protection is not enabled.
SettingDetails.featureUpdatesDeferralPeriodDescription: Defer feature updates for the specified number of days.
SettingDetails.featureUpdatesUninstallPeriodName: Set feature update uninstall period (2 - 60 days)
SettingDetails.fencingConditionStatementStateDescriptio: Device is present within an approved location
SettingDetails.fencingConditionStatementStatusDescripti: Locations have been evaluated on the device
SettingDetails.fileBlockingLevelDescription:
Specify the level of cloud-delivered protection.</br>
Not Configured uses the default Microsoft Defender Antivirus blocking level and provides strong detection without increasing the risk of detecting legitimate files.</br>High applies a strong level of detection.</br>High + uses the High level and applies addition protection measures (may impact client performance).</br>Zero tolerance blocks all unknown executables</br>
While unlikely, setting to High may cause some legitimate files to be detected.</br>
We recommend you set this to the default level (Not configured).
SettingDetails.fileExtensionsToExcludeName: File extensions to exclude from scans and real-time protection
SettingDetails.fileName: Filename (required but unused, for Custom XML and Base64)
SettingDetails.filesAndFoldersToExcludeName: Files and folders to exclude from scans and real-time protection
SettingDetails.firewallAppsAllowedHeader: Allow incoming connections for the following apps.
SettingDetails.firewallAppsAllowedPageDescription: Select apps that are explicitly allowed to receive incoming connections.
SettingDetails.firewallAppsBlockedHeader: Block incoming connections for the following apps.
SettingDetails.firewallAppsBlockedPageDescription: Select apps that should block incoming connections.
SettingDetails.firewallCreateRules: Create Windows Firewall rules. One Endpoint Protection profile may contain up to 150 rules.
SettingDetails.firewallRuleActionTooltip: Specifies whether this rule should block or allow network traffic. If "Not configured," the rule defaults to allow traffic.
SettingDetails.firewallRuleApplicationTooltip: Control connections for an app or program. Apps and programs can be specified either by file path, package family name, or service name.
SettingDetails.firewallRuleAuthorizedUsersHeaderTooltip: Specifies the list of authorized local users for this rule. A list of authorized users cannot be specified if the rule being authored is targeting a Windows service. If not specified, the default is all users.
SettingDetails.firewallRuleAuthorizedUsersPlaceholder: Enter a list of users in SDDL format
SettingDetails.firewallRuleAuthorizedUsersSubheader: Only allow connections from these users
SettingDetails.firewallRuleDirectionTooltip: Specifies whether the rule applies to inbound or outbound network traffic. If "Not configured," the rule defaults to outbound traffic.
SettingDetails.firewallRuleFileNameTooltip: The file path of an app is simply its location on the client device. For example, C:\Windows\System\Notepad.exe or %WINDIR%\Notepad.exe.
SettingDetails.firewallRuleIPAddressSettingsLocalPlaceh: Comma separated list of local addresses
SettingDetails.firewallRuleIPAddressSettingsLocalToolti:
Comma separated list of local addresses covered by the rule. Valid tokens include:​
  • "*" indicates any local address. If present, this must be the only token included.
  • A subnet can be specified using either the subnet mask or network prefix notation. If neither a subnet mask nor a network prefix is specified, the subnet mask defaults to 255.255.255.255.​​
  • A valid IPv6 address.​​
  • An IPv4 address range in the format of "start address - end address" with no spaces included.​​
  • An IPv6 address range in the format of "start address - end address" with no spaces included.
If not specified, the default is "Any address."
Learn more
SettingDetails.firewallRuleIPAddressSettingsRemotePlace: Comma separated list of remote addresses
SettingDetails.firewallRuleIPAddressSettingsRemoteToolt:
Comma separated list of remote addresses covered by the rule. Tokens are case insensitive. Valid tokens include:​​​
  • "*" indicates any remote address. If present, this must be the only token included.
  • "Defaultgateway"
  • "DHCP"
  • "DNS"
  • "WINS"
  • "Intranet" (supported on Windows versions 1809+)
  • "RmtIntranet" (supported on Windows versions 1809+)
  • "Internet" (supported on Windows versions 1809+)
  • "Ply2Renders" ​(supported on Windows versions 1809+)
  • "LocalSubnet" indicates any local address on the local subnet.
  • A subnet can be specified using either the subnet mask or network prefix notation. If neither a subnet mask nor a network prefix is specified, the subnet mask defaults to 255.255.255.255.
  • A valid IPv6 address.
  • An IPv4 address range in the format of "start address - end address" with no spaces included.
  • An IPv6 address range in the format of "start address - end address" with no spaces included.​
If not specified, the default is "Any address."
Learn more
SettingDetails.firewallRuleIPAddressSettingsSubheader: Specify the local and remote addresses to which this rule applies
SettingDetails.firewallRuleInterfaceTypesTooltip: Specifies the interface types to which the rule belongs: "Remote access", "Wireless", or "Local area network." If none selected, the rule applies to all interface types.
SettingDetails.firewallRuleLocalPortsPlaceholder: Comma separated list of local ports
SettingDetails.firewallRuleNetworkTypeTooltip: Specifies the network type to which the rule belongs: "Domain," "Private," or "Public." If none selected, the rule applies to all network types.
SettingDetails.firewallRulePackageFamilyNameTooltip: Package family names can be retrieved by running the Get-AppxPackage command from PowerShell.
SettingDetails.firewallRulePortAndProtocolSubheader: Specify the local and remote ports to which this rule applies
SettingDetails.firewallRulePortSettingTooltip: Comma separated list of ranges. For example, 100-200, 200, 300-320. If not specified, the default is "All ports."
SettingDetails.firewallRuleProtocolTooltip: Select the protocol for this port rule. Transport layer protocols, TCP and UDP, allow you to specify ports or port ranges. For custom protocols, enter a number between 0 and 255 representing the IP protocol. If not specified, the default is"Any."
SettingDetails.firewallRuleRemotePortsPlaceholder: Comma separated list of remote ports
SettingDetails.firewallRuleServiceNameSetWithPopulatedU: Firewall rules for a Windows service cannot be scoped to a list of authorized users. To resolve this conflict, either change the targeted application from "Windows service" to another value, or clear the authorized users list and then enter the Windows service.
SettingDetails.firewallRuleServiceNameTooltip: Windows service short names are used in cases when a service, not an application, is sending or receiving traffic. Service short names can be retrieved by running the Get-Service command from PowerShell.
SettingDetails.firewallRuleUserListSetWithPopulatedServ: Firewall rules for a Windows service cannot be scoped to a list of authorized users. To resolve this conflict, either clear the authorized users list, or change the targeted application from "Windows service" to another value and then enter the authorized users list.
SettingDetails.firewallRulesPortOrPortRangeInvalidChara: Port list can only contain numbers, '-', or ','.
SettingDetails.firewallRulesPortOrPortRangeInvalidError: Port list contains invalid ports and/or port ranges.

SettingDetails.homeScreenLayoutAppAndFolderTableNameToo: The list of apps and folders to add.
SettingDetails.homeScreenLayoutDockDescription: Apps and folders you select will be placed on the dock of end user's iOS devices that you assign this policy to. Items are added from left to right in the order you give them. You can select up to 6 items.
SettingDetails.homeScreenLayoutDockHeader:
Select the apps or folders that you want to add to the dock. Apps and folders that you select will be placed on the dock for devices that have this policy assigned to them. Items will be added from left to right in the order that you add them.

6 items maximum allowed.
SettingDetails.homeScreenLayoutDockHeaderTooltip: Generally, larger iOS devices have a maximum of 6 items that can be displayed.
SettingDetails.homeScreenLayoutFolderHeader:
Add the pages you want to appear in this folder. Apps selected will be laid out on the pages in the folder, from left to right, in the order added below. Click and drag items to reorder them.

20 pages maximum allowed.
SettingDetails.homeScreenLayoutFolderNameDescription: Displayed as folder name on iOS device
SettingDetails.homeScreenLayoutFolderPagesHeader:
Add the apps you want to appear on this folder page. Apps selected will be laid out on the folder page on end user’s iOS device, from left to right, in the order they are given below. Any number of apps greater than the page can display on a single page will be moved to a subsequent pages. Click and drag items to reorder them.

60 items maximum allowed.
SettingDetails.homeScreenLayoutInfoBox: Add apps to your layout row by row. Any positions you don’t fill will be populated by your other apps in the order they install on devices.
SettingDetails.homeScreenLayoutPagesDescription: Apps and folders you select will be placed on the main screen of end user's iOS devices that you assign this policy to. Items are added from the upper-left corner of the screen to the lower-right. If the screen becomes full, items will automatically be placed on the next screen.
SettingDetails.homeScreenLayoutPagesHeader:
Add the pages you want to appear on the home screen. Apps selected will be laid out on the pages on the home screen, from left to right, in the order added below. Click and drag items to reorder them.

40 pages maximum allowed.
SettingDetails.homeScreenLayoutPagesPageHeader:
Add the apps you want to appear on this page. Apps selected will be laid out on the page on the device, from left to right, in the order added below. Any number of apps greater than the page can display on a single screen will be moved to a subsequent screen. Click and drag items to reorder them.

60 items maximum allowed.
SettingDetails.homeScreenLayoutTypeTooltip: Select apps or folders from the dropdown to add to the device.
SettingDetails.httpWithPeeringNatOption: HTTP blended with peering behind same NAT (1)
SettingDetails.httpWithPeeringPrivateGroupOption: HTTP blended with peering across private group (2)
SettingDetails.hybridSleepBatteryDescription:
This policy setting allows you to turn off hybrid sleep when the device is powered by a battery.​
If this policy is disabled, the device will not allow hybrid sleep or hibernate.
If this policy is not configured, users control this setting.
SettingDetails.hybridSleepPluggedInDescription:
This policy setting allows you to turn off hybrid sleep when the device is plugged in.​
If this policy is disabled, the device will not allow hybrid sleep or hibernate.
If this policy is not configured, users control this setting.
SettingDetails.iKEv2AuthenticationMethodDescription: Specify how you want to authenticate to the VPN server. Using certificate-based authentication provides enhances capabilities such as zero-touch experience, on-demand VPN, and per-app VPN.
SettingDetails.iOSAirPrintPortDescription: The listening port of the AirPrint destination. If this key is not specified, AirPrint will use the default port. Available in iOS 11.0 and later.
SettingDetails.iOSBlockDiagnosticDataSubmissionName: Block sending diagnostic and usage data to Apple
SettingDetails.iOSBlockVoiceDialingName: Block voice dialing while device is locked
SettingDetails.iOSEduStudentCertPickerDescription: Configure trusted root and PKCS#12 certificates for the student device certificates type you choose.
SettingDetails.iOSEduTeacherDescription: Configure trusted root and PKCS#12 certificates for teachers.
SettingDetails.iPsecExemptionsBothOption: Both IPv4 and IPv6 DHCP traffic
SettingDetails.iPsecExemptionsDescription: Configure specific traffic to be exempt from performing IPsec.
SettingDetails.iPsecRulesDescription: Apply connection security rules from the local store, regardless of schema or connection security rule versions.
SettingDetails.iPsecRulesName: IPsec rules from the local store
SettingDetails.iPsecSecuredPacketExemptionDescription: If enabled, firewall's stealth mode MUST NOT prevent the host computer from responding to unsolicited network traffic that is secured by IPsec. This option is ignored if stealth mode is blocked.
SettingDetails.iPsecSecuredPacketExemptionName: IPsec secured packet exemption with Stealth Mode
SettingDetails.iWantToDescription: The Connect VPN, Disconnect VPN and Ignore actions apply when a user connects to a network. These actions continue to apply while the user is connected to the network. The Evaluate each connection attempt action applies to all connections to the domains you enter for the action but only if the VPN isn’t already connected.
SettingDetails.iWantToName: I want to do the following
SettingDetails.ikeTlsMissing: TLS Version Min and Max must be set when using user authentication and certificates.
SettingDetails.importCSVBladeAppListWarning: Save the profile by using a CSV with file values in separate columns that match the order displayed in the table below: APP URL, APP BUNDLE ID, APP NAME, PUBLISHER.
SettingDetails.inboundConnectionsDescription: Configure the default action firewall performs on inbound connections.
SettingDetails.inboundNotificationsDescription: Block notifications from displaying to users when an application is blocked from listening on a port.
SettingDetails.inkWorkspaceAccessDescription: Block users from accessing the ink workspace. When this setting is not configured, the ink workspace is enabled (feature is turned on), and the user is allowed to use it above the lock screen.
SettingDetails.inkWorkspaceBlockSuggestedAppsDescriptio: Block recommended apps suggestions in the Ink workspace
SettingDetails.installUnknownSourcesAllowedDescription: When allowed, users can enable the “unknown sources” setting to install apps from sources other than the Google Play Store.
SettingDetails.integrityCheckMethodDescription: Integrity check algorithm to be used during IKE (main mode) security association negotiation. Value must match VPN server settings.
SettingDetails.invalidValuesInSettings: One or more settings have invalid values
SettingDetails.iosAppUrlHelp: Enter the iTunes App Store URL of the app you want. For example, to specify the Microsoft Work Folders app for iOS, enter https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/work-folders/id950878067?mt=8. To find the URL of an app, use a search engine to locate the store page. For example, to find the Work Folders app, you could search Microsoft Work Folders ITunes.
SettingDetails.iosDeviceFeaturesAirprintHeader:
Use these settings to configure iOS devices to automatically connect to AirPrint compatible printers on your network. You'll need the IP address and resource path of your printers.

Learn more about obtaining printer IP addresses
SettingDetails.iosDeviceFeaturesAirprintHelpLinkText: Learn more about obtaining printer IP addresses
SettingDetails.iosDeviceFeaturesExtensibleSingleSignOnH: Configure an app extension that enables single sign-on (SSO) for devices running iOS 13.0 or later.
SettingDetails.iosDeviceFeaturesHomeScreenLayoutHeader:
Configure the layout for the dock and Home Screens on iOS devices. Certain devices may have limits to how many items can be displayed.

Find out how this can impact different form factors here.
SettingDetails.iosDeviceFeaturesHomeScreenLayoutHelpLin: Find out how this can impact different form factors here.
SettingDetails.iosDeviceFeaturesIOSWallpaperHeader:
Display an image that will appear on the Home Screen and/or the lock screen of iOS devices. To display a unique image in each location, create one profile with the lock screen image, and one with the Home Screen image. Then assign both profiles to your users.
  • Max file size: 750 KB
  • File type: PNG, JPG or JPEG
SettingDetails.iosDeviceFeaturesLockScreenMessageHeader: Specify optional text displayed on the locked screen. It is supported on iOS 9.3 and later. Learn More
SettingDetails.iosDeviceFeaturesNotificationsHeader: Specify notification settings for apps. Supports iOS 9.3 and later.
SettingDetails.iosGeneralApplicationRestrictionsHeader:
Use these settings to stay informed about which users install apps that are not approved for use in your company. Select the type of restricted app list:

Prohibited apps - A list of apps that you want to be informed about when users install them.
Approved apps - A list of apps that are approved for use in your company. When users install an app that is not in this list, you will be informed.
SettingDetails.iosGeneralApplicationVisibilityHeader: Use the show apps list to specify the iOS apps that user can view or launch. Use the hidden apps list to specify the iOS apps that user cannot view or launch.
SettingDetails.iosGeneralAutonomousSingleAppModeHeader: Apps you add to this list and assign to a device can lock the device to run only that app once launched, or lock the device while a certain action is running (for example taking a test). Once the action is complete, or you remove the restriction, the device returns to its normal state.
SettingDetails.iosGeneralKioskHeader: Kiosk mode locks various settings into a device, or specifies a single app that can be run on a device. This can be useful in environments like a retail store where you want a device to run only a single demo app.
SettingDetails.iosGeneralSharedDeviceHeader: Configure settings for Apple Shared iPad set up with Apple Business Manager or Apple School Manager. These settings require devices running iOS 13.4 or later.
SettingDetails.ipAddressDescription: If you use hostnames to identify printer destinations, you can obtain their respective IP address by pinging them in the terminal. Can contain IPv4 or IPv6 addresses and ports.
SettingDetails.ipAutoDetectionName: Auto detection of other enterprise IP ranges
SettingDetails.issuerHashDescription: Thumbprint for the single sign-on (SSO) certificate
SettingDetails.keepGoing: Show message with option to open sites in Microsoft Edge​
SettingDetails.keyboardBlockDictationDescriptionMacOS: Block dictation, which is a feature that converts the user's voice to text.
SettingDetails.keyguardDisabledDescriptionAndroid: If the lock screen is disabled, the lock screen features cannot be disabled individually.
SettingDetails.kioskAADUserAndGroup: Microsoft Entra user or group (Windows 10, version 1803 and later, or Windows 11)
SettingDetails.kioskAUMIDDesc: You can find the AUMID by either using Windows PowerShell or querying the registry.
SettingDetails.kioskAddAppByAUMIDHeader: Enter the Application User Model ID (AUMID) of the app you want to run in kiosk mode.
SettingDetails.kioskAddWin32AppDescription: To run a Win32 or line-of-business app in kiosk mode, enter the local path of the app’s executable (.exe) file. Before adding a line-of-business app, go to the Mobile Apps blade and make sure you’ve assigned it to your kiosk devices.
SettingDetails.kioskAppIdentifier: Local path to app executable file (also known as the Identifier)
SettingDetails.kioskAppIdentifierDesc: Enter the local path where the executable is installed.
SettingDetails.kioskAppNameDesc: Friendly name used to identify the app
SettingDetails.kioskAppNotificationBadgeDescription: Badges appear on app icons, and show the number of new, unread notifications.
SettingDetails.kioskAppTableDesc: Add all apps and dependant apps to the grid. This allows these apps to work in Assigned Access. This is required even if using a Custom Start Layout.
SettingDetails.kioskAppTableSummary: Apps are pinned to the full Start layout in the order and tile size you choose below. Click and drag any row in the table to change its display order. Learn more.
SettingDetails.kioskAppTypeDesc: The multiple app mode locks the device to run multiple Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps, or Win32 apps that you specify.
SettingDetails.kioskApplicationTypeDescription: Identifies the type of applications added to this kiosk device.
SettingDetails.kioskAppsInFolderOrderedByName: Apps in folder ordered by name
SettingDetails.kioskBluetoothConfigDescription: Enable end-users to configure and pair devices over Bluetooth.
SettingDetails.kioskConfigurationHeader: Configure your devices to run in kiosk mode. Before you select a kiosk mode, review your app assignments in the Mobile Apps blade. Apps that you want to run in kiosk mode should be assigned to a Windows device. Learn more about Windows kiosk mode.
SettingDetails.kioskCustomAppLayoutInfoBalloon: Choose where apps and folders appear on Managed Home Screen. When not configured, apps and folders can be added and populate the home screen in alphabetical order.
SettingDetails.kioskDebugMenuDescription: Enable users to more easily access debugging tools in Managed Home Screen by adding an entry point in the settings menu. Users simply swipe down and tap the device info icon to view the available tools. If you don't enable quick access, users can still get to the debug menu by tapping the back button about 15 times while in Managed Home Screen.
SettingDetails.kioskDesktopApplicationIdName: Application user model ID (AUMID) for the Win32 app. Learn how to locate the AUMID
SettingDetails.kioskDeviceInfoDescription: Enable users to more easily access device information by adding an entry point in the Managed Home Screen settings menu. Users simply swipe down and tap the device info icon to view device OEM, model, serial number, and SDK level. If you don't enable quick access, users can still discover this information by accessing the Managed Home Screen debug menu.​
SettingDetails.kioskDropOutDescription: Enable IT administrators to temporarily leave multi-app kiosk mode to make changes on the device.
SettingDetails.kioskFolderIconDescription: A graphic image that represents a folder on the home screen. The default is a dark theme rectangle.
SettingDetails.kioskForceRestart: Specify Maintenance Window for App Restarts
SettingDetails.kioskForceRestartDescription: Some apps require restart in order to complete app updates. Set the maintenance window for these app restarts. The default start time is midnight, or zero minutes. If blank, apps will restart at an unscheduled time 3 days after an app update is installed.
SettingDetails.kioskGridSizeInfoBalloon: Choose the grid size of the home screen for your device. An app or folder uses one position in the grid. Apps that don't fit in the grid are moved to the next available position on a new page.
SettingDetails.kioskIconSizeDescription: How big the icons appear on the home screen. Actual size may vary depending on screen width and grid size.
SettingDetails.kioskInfoBoxText: Multiple app kiosk mode – Locks the device to run multiple apps that are launched from the Managed Home Screen app. To use this mode, you must first approve and assign the Managed Home Screen app from the client apps workload.
SettingDetails.kioskLockHomeScreenInfoBalloon: A locked home screen prevents device users from repositioning or creating items on the home screen. ​
SettingDetails.kioskManagedAppsHeader: The following apps for Windows 10 and later have been purchased and synchronized with Intune. Sign in to Microsoft Store for Business to purchase additional apps.
SettingDetails.kioskManagedHomeScreenAutoSignOutDescrip: Automatically sign users out of Managed Home Screen after a period of inactivity and choose whether to not to give end-users option to extend their sign-in session. Sign-in screen must be enabled to configure this setting. This setting is intended for use on dedicated devices enrolled with Microsoft Entra Shared device mode and will sign end-users out of all applications on the device that are integrated with Shared device mode. ​
SettingDetails.kioskManagedHomeScreenAutoSignOutName: Automatically sign-out of MHS and Shared device mode applications after inactive
SettingDetails.kioskManagedHomeScreenInactiveNoticeDela: Define the amount of time, in seconds, for user to have option to resume their session before getting automatically signed out from Managed Home Screen. By default, this value is set to 60 seconds. Automatically sign-out after inactivity must be enabled to configure this setting. This setting is intended for use on dedicated devices enrolled with Microsoft Entra Shared device mode and will sign users out of all applications on the device that are integrated with Shared device mode. ​
Number of seconds to give user notice before automatically signing them out
SettingDetails.kioskManagedHomeScreenInactiveSignOutDel: Define the period of inactivity, in seconds, before user is automatically signed out from Managed Home Screen. By default, this value is set to 300 seconds. Automatically sign-out after inactivity must be enabled to configure this setting. This setting is intended for use on dedicated devices enrolled with Microsoft Entra Shared device mode and will sign users out of all applications on the device that are integrated with Shared device mode. ​
Number of seconds device is inactive before automatically signing user out
SettingDetails.kioskManagedHomeScreenPINComplexityDescr: Choose the complexity of the session PIN. Complex requires alphanumerical characters and simple only requires numbers. Require user to set a PIN for sign-in session must be enabled to configure this setting. This setting is for use on dedicated devices enrolled with Microsoft Entra Shared device mode.​
SettingDetails.kioskManagedHomeScreenPINComplexityName: Choose complexity of PIN for sign-in session​
SettingDetails.kioskManagedHomeScreenPINRequiredDescrip: Enable users to create a PIN that exists for the duration of a single sign-in session. Upon sign-out, this PIN will be cleared. Sign-in screen must be enabled to configure this setting. This setting is for use on dedicated devices enrolled with Microsoft Entra Shared device mode.​​
SettingDetails.kioskManagedHomeScreenPINRequiredName: Require user to set a PIN for sign-in session
SettingDetails.kioskManagedHomeScreenPINRequiredToResum: Require users to enter their session PIN to resume using the Managed Home Screen after the screensaver has appeared. Require user to set a PIN for sign-in session must be enabled to configure this setting. This setting has no effect if screen saver mode is not configured. This setting is for use on dedicated devices enrolled with Microsoft Entra Shared device mode. ​
Required user to enter session PIN if screensaver has appeared
SettingDetails.kioskManagedHomeScreenSignInBackgroundDe: Customize the appearance of the sign-in screen. Sign-in screen must be enabled to configure this setting. This setting is intended for use on dedicated devices enrolled with Microsoft Entra Shared device mode.
