SettingDetails.kioskManagedHomeScreenSignInBackgroundNa: Set custom URL background for sign-in screen
SettingDetails.kioskManagedHomeScreenSignInBrandingLogo: Customize a branding logo for the sign-in screen and session pin prompt. Sign-in screen must be enabled to configure this setting. This setting is intended for use on dedicated devices enrolled with Microsoft Entra Shared device mode. ​
Set custom URL branding logo for sign-in screen and session pin page
SettingDetails.kioskManagedHomeScreenSignInEnabledDescr: Enable a sign-in screen on Managed Home Screen. This sign-in screen is intended for use on dedicated devices enrolled with Microsoft Entra Shared device mode.​
SettingDetails.kioskManagedSettingsDescription: This shortcut gives users another way to access settings. It appears as a non-customizable icon on the home screen (much like an app) and is called Managed Settings. If you disable the shortcut, users can still swipe down on their screen to access these settings.
SettingDetails.kioskMediaVolumeConfigDescription: Device setting used to adjust media volume.
SettingDetails.kioskModeAllowVoiceControlModificationDe: If allowed, users can turn Voice Control on and off.
SettingDetails.kioskModeAppIdDescription: Managed app allowed to run when device is in kiosk mode. No other apps will be allowed to run on device.
SettingDetails.kioskModeAppIdName: Managed app that runs in kiosk mode
SettingDetails.kioskModeAppStoreUrlDescription: URL of app for kiosk mode, e.g. https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/work-folders/id950878067?mt=8
SettingDetails.kioskModeAppStoreUrlName: URL of app for kiosk mode
SettingDetails.kioskModeAppStoreUrlOrManagedAppIdName: App to run in kiosk mode
SettingDetails.kioskModeBuiltinAppIdDescription: To see a list of bundle IDs for common built-in iOS apps, see the
SettingDetails.kioskModeExitCodeDescription: The 4-6 digit PIN will be the code an IT administrator enters on a multi-app dedicated device to pause kiosk mode.
SettingDetails.kioskModeManagedAppChevronName: Managed Intune app to use for kiosk mode
SettingDetails.kioskModeManagedAppDescription: Showing up to 500 managed apps. Use search to find more items.
SettingDetails.kioskModeManagedAppName: Select an app to use for kiosk mode
SettingDetails.kioskProfileHeader: Use these settings to configure kiosk mode. Prior to configuring these settings, make sure you have deployed the apps you want to run in Kiosk mode to the devices from the client apps workload.
SettingDetails.kioskProfileLearnMore: Learn more about Windows kiosk mode.
SettingDetails.kioskProfileNameDesc: This is a friendly name used to identify a group of applications, the layout of these apps on the start menu and the users to whom this kiosk configuration is assigned.
SettingDetails.kioskProfileTableDescription: Set up a kiosk configuration including the list of apps that can be used in kiosk mode, and permitted users.
SettingDetails.kioskRecurrenceDescription: Set how often Maintenance windows for app updates will take place. Recommendation is daily to avoid unscheduled app restarts.
SettingDetails.kioskScreenOrientationDescription: The direction that the Managed Home Screen appears on the device.
SettingDetails.kioskScreenSaverConfigDescription: Start screen saver when the device screen times out or locks.
SettingDetails.kioskScreenSaverDetectMediaConfigDescrip: Screen saver mode won't start if audio or video is playing on the device.
SettingDetails.kioskScreenSaverDetectMediaConfigName: Detect media before starting screen saver
SettingDetails.kioskScreenSaverDisplayTimeConfigDescrip: When left blank or set to 0 seconds, the screen saver remains active until a user interacts with the device.
SettingDetails.kioskScreenSaverDisplayTimeConfigName: Number of seconds the device shows screen saver before turning off screen
SettingDetails.kioskScreenSaverStartDelayConfigDescript: Requires a number greater than zero when screen saver mode is enabled.
SettingDetails.kioskScreenSaverStartDelayConfigName: Number of seconds the device is inactive before showing screen saver.
SettingDetails.kioskSelectionDescription: Single app, full-screen kiosk mode will lock a single Store app above the Windows Lockscreen to be used by a Local user account or guests via Autologon. Multi-app kiosk mode locks the device to run multiple Store apps, Win32 apps, or apps by specified by AUMID. Multi-app kiosk mode can be used by guests via Autologon, Microsoft Entra accounts, or Local user accounts.
SettingDetails.kioskSelectionUsersDescription: Configures the logon type to access the applications on this kiosk device.
SettingDetails.kioskShowTaskbarDesc: Show or hide the Windows taskbar on the kiosk.
SettingDetails.kioskSingleInfoBoxText: Single app kiosk mode – Locks the device to run the selected app. To use this mode, you must first approve and assign the selected app from the client apps workload. On fully managed devices, the only selected app that will apply is Managed Home Screen. All other apps will be treated as a required app instead.
SettingDetails.kioskStartMenuLayoutXmlDesc: Provide an XML layout that defines in what order apps should be displayed on the Start Menu
SettingDetails.kioskStartMenuLayoutXmlDescV2: Importing an XML file configuring the Start layout overrides the existing display order and tile size selections. Learn more
SettingDetails.kioskTargetSModeDescription: Set to Yes, will exclude Win32 apps in the kiosk profile. Set to No, Win32 apps are available, but this kiosk profile will not deploy to S-mode devices.
SettingDetails.kioskTargetSModeName: Target devices running Windows 10/11 in S mode
SettingDetails.kioskUserAccountDesc: For kiosks in public-facing environments with auto logon enabled, a user type with least privilege (e.g. local standard user account) should be used. To configure a Microsoft Entra account for kiosk mode, use this format: AzureAD\user@contoso.com.
SettingDetails.kioskUserLogonTypeAutologon: Auto logon (Windows 10, version 1803 and later, or Windows 11)
SettingDetails.kioskUsersTableDesc: The user accounts that will be locked to this kiosk configuration. For kiosks in public-facing environments with auto logon enabled, a user type with least privilege (e.g. local standard user account) should be used. To configure an Microsoft Entra account to kiosk mode, use this format: AzureAD\user@contoso.com.
SettingDetails.kioskWifiConfigDescription: Enable end-users to connect to different Wi-Fi networks.
SettingDetails.kioskWifiSsidsDescription: Further control or limit Wi-Fi access by manually adding or importing a list of allowed networks by SSID. Managed Home Screen users will only be able to connect to these networks. Wi-Fi configuration must be enabled to configure this setting.​ If you don't add anything, all available networks will be shown to the device user.
SettingDetails.knoxBlockDataRoamingDescription: Block data roaming over the cellular network.
SettingDetails.knoxBlockDiagnosticDataSubmissionDescrip: Block submitting diagnostic data from device.
SettingDetails.knoxBlockFingerprintUnlockDescription: Block using fingerprint to unlock device.
SettingDetails.knoxBlockGeolocationAndroidDescription: When blocked, devices are disabled from using location information. When not configured, Intune does not change or update the default behavior on the device.
SettingDetails.knoxBlockGeolocationDescription: Specifies whether location services are enabled and can track the location of the device.
SettingDetails.knoxBlockScreenshotDescription: Block capturing contents of screen as an image.
SettingDetails.knoxCellularDataDescription: Block data usage over cellular networks. When not configured, data usage over cellular networks is allowed and editable by users.
SettingDetails.knoxRequireEncryptionOnRemovableStorageD: Storage cards must be encrypted. Not all devices support storage card encryption. For more information, see the device and mobile operating system documentation.
SettingDetails.knoxRequireEncryptionOnRemovableStorageN: Encryption on storage cards (Samsung KNOX only)
SettingDetails.lanManagerAuthenticationLevelDesc: This security setting determines which challenge/response authentication protocol is used for network logons.
SettingDetails.lanManagerWorkstationDisableInsecureGues: If you enable this setting, the SMB client will reject insecure guest logons.
SettingDetails.lanManagerWorkstationEnableInsecureGuest: If you enable this policy setting or if you do not configure this policy setting, the SMB client will allow insecure guest logons. If not configured, the SMB client will reject insecure guest logons.
SettingDetails.learnMoreAboutVPNName: Learn more about setting up a VPN
SettingDetails.lidClosePowerActionBatteryDescription:
This policy setting specifies the action that Windows takes when a user closes the lid on a mobile PC when the device is powered by a battery.​
If you enable this policy setting, you must select the desired action.
​If you disable this policy setting or do not configure it, users can see and change this setting.
SettingDetails.lidClosePowerActionPluggedInDescription:
This policy setting specifies the action that Windows takes when a user closes the lid on a mobile PC when the device is plugged in.​
If you enable this policy setting, you must select the desired action.
​If you disable this policy setting or do not configure it, users can see and change this setting.
SettingDetails.lifetimeDescription: Specify the security association lifetime (key interval). Choose a whole value between 10 and 1440.​
SettingDetails.limitCPUUsageDuringScanDescription: Maximum CPU % usage during a scan (50 recommended).
SettingDetails.limitCPUUsageDuringScanName: CPU usage limit during a scan
SettingDetails.localAddressRangesDescription:
These local address ranges will be allowed over the VPN interface.
For a single IP address, enter the same address in both fields.
SettingDetails.localGuestAccountDesc: When configured, a local guest account tile is added to the bottom-left of the device’s sign-in screen. When the student clicks on the tile, the Take a Test app launches a focused test-taking environment with the specified assessment URL.
SettingDetails.localPortRangesDescription:
List of allowed ports (e.g. 100-120, 200, 300-320).
For a single port, enter the same port number in both fields.
Local port range should be set only when protocol is either TCP or UDP (6 or 17), otherwise you will get an error trying to save the profile.
SettingDetails.localSecurityOptionsAdministratorAccount: Define a different account name to be associated with the security identifier (SID) for the account “Administrator”.
SettingDetails.localSecurityOptionsAdministratorElevati: Define the behavior of the elevation prompt for admins in Admin Approval Mode.
SettingDetails.localSecurityOptionsAllowAnonymousEnumer: Windows allows anonymous users to perform certain activities, such as enumerating the names of domain accounts and network shares. Enable this policy to prevent anonymous enumeration of SAM accounts and shares.
Anonymous enumeration of SAM accounts and shares
SettingDetails.localSecurityOptionsAllowPKU2UAuthentica: Block PKU2U authentication requests to this device to use online identities.
SettingDetails.localSecurityOptionsAllowRemoteCallsToSe: Edit the default Security Descriptor Definition Language string to allow or deny users and groups to make remote calls to the SAM.
Restrict remote RPC connections to SAM
SettingDetails.localSecurityOptionsAllowSystemToBeShutD: Block the option to shut down the computer from the Windows logon screen. In this case, users must be able to log on to the computer successfully and before they can perform a system shutdown.
SettingDetails.localSecurityOptionsAllowUIAccessApplica: Enable apps from unsecure locations in the file system to run with UIAccess integrity level.
Allow UIAccess apps to prompt for elevation without using the secure desktop.
UIA elevation prompt without secure desktop
SettingDetails.localSecurityOptionsAllowUndockWithoutHa: Prevent a portable computer from being undocked without having to log in.
SettingDetails.localSecurityOptionsBlockMicrosoftAccoun: Prevent users from adding new Microsoft accounts to this computer.
SettingDetails.localSecurityOptionsBlockRemoteLogonWith: Block local accounts that are not password protected from logging on from locations other than the physical device.
SettingDetails.localSecurityOptionsBlockRemoteOpticalDr: Enabling this settings allows only interactively logged on user to access CD-ROM media.
Restrict CD-ROM access to local active user
SettingDetails.localSecurityOptionsBlockUsersInstalling: Restrict installing printer drivers as part of connecting to a shared printer to admins only.
Install printer drivers for shared printers
SettingDetails.localSecurityOptionsClearVirtualMemoryPa: Clear the virtual memory pagefile when the device is powered down.
Clear virtual memory pagefile when shutting down
SettingDetails.localSecurityOptionsClientDigitallySignC: This security setting determines whether packet signing is required by the SMB client component. If this setting is enabled, the Microsoft network client will not communicate with a Microsoft network server unless that server agrees to perform SMB packet signing. If this policy is disabled (default), SMB packet signing is negotiated between the client and server.
SettingDetails.localSecurityOptionsClientSendUnencrypte: Enable this setting to block the Server Message Block (SMB) redirector from sending plaintext passwords to non-Microsoft SMB servers that do not support password encryption during authentication.
Send unencrypted password to third-party SMB servers
SettingDetails.localSecurityOptionsDetectApplicationIns: App installations requiring elevated privileges will prompt for admin credentials.
SettingDetails.localSecurityOptionsDisableClientDigital: This security setting determines whether the SMB client attempts to negotiate SMB packet signing. If this setting is enabled (default), the Microsoft network client will ask the server to perform SMB packet signing upon session setup. If packet signing has been enabled on the server, packet signing will be negotiated. If this policy is disabled, the SMB client will never negotiate SMB packet signing.
SettingDetails.localSecurityOptionsDisableServerDigital: This security setting determines whether packet signing is required by the SMB server component. If this setting is enabled, the Microsoft network server will not communicate with a Microsoft network client unless that client agrees to perform SMB packet signing. If this setting is disabled, SMB packet signing is negotiated between the client and server. Default: Disabled.

This security setting determines whether the SMB server will negotiate SMB packet signing with clients that request it. If this setting is enabled, the Microsoft network server will negotiate SMB packet signing as requested by the client. That is, if packet signing has been enabled on the client, packet signing will be negotiated. If this policy is disabled, the SMB client will never negotiate SMB packet signing. Default: Disabled
SettingDetails.localSecurityOptionsDoNotAllowAnonymousE: Windows allows anonymous users to perform certain activities, such as enumerating the names of domain accounts and network shares. Enable this setting to allow anonymous users to enumerate the SAM accounts.
SettingDetails.localSecurityOptionsDoNotRequireCtrlAltD: Require CTRL+ALT+DEL to be pressed before a user can log on.
Require CTRL + ALT + DEL to log on
SettingDetails.localSecurityOptionsDoNotStoreLANManager: This security setting determines if, at the next password change, the LAN Manager (LM) hash value for the new password is stored. It’s not stored by default.
LAN Manager hash value stored on password change
SettingDetails.localSecurityOptionsEnableAdministratorA: This security setting determines whether the local Administrator account is enabled or disabled.
SettingDetails.localSecurityOptionsEnableGuestAccountDe: This security setting determines if the Guest account is enabled or disabled.
SettingDetails.localSecurityOptionsFormatAndEjectOfRemo: Define who is allowed to format and eject removable NTFS media.
SettingDetails.localSecurityOptionsGuestAccountNameDesc: Define a different account name to be associated with the security identifier (SID) for the account “Guest”.
SettingDetails.localSecurityOptionsHideLastSignedInUser: Do not display the username of the last person who signed in on this device.
SettingDetails.localSecurityOptionsHideUsernameAtSignIn: Do not display the username of the person signing in to this device after credentials are entered and before the device’s desktop is shown.
SettingDetails.localSecurityOptionsInformationShownOnLo: Configure the user information that is displayed when the session is locked. If not configured, user display name, domain and username are shown.
User display name, domain and user names
SettingDetails.localSecurityOptionsLmNtlmV2AndNotLmOrNt: NTLMv2 and not LM or NTLM
SettingDetails.localSecurityOptionsLogOnMessageTextDesc: Set message text for users attempting to log in.
SettingDetails.localSecurityOptionsLogOnMessageTitleDes: Set message title for users attempting to log in.
SettingDetails.localSecurityOptionsMachineInactivityLim: Define maximum minutes of inactivity on the interactive desktop’s login screen until the screen saver runs.
Minutes of lock screen inactivity until screen saver activates
SettingDetails.localSecurityOptionsMinimumSessionSecuri: This security setting allows a client to require the negotiation of 128-bit encryption and/or NTLMv2 session security.
Minimum Session Security For NTLM SSP Based Clients
This security setting allows a server to require the negotiation of 128-bit encryption and/or NTLMv2 session security.
Minimum Session Security For NTLM SSP Based Server
SettingDetails.localSecurityOptionsOnlyElevateSignedExe: Enforce PKI certification path validation for a given executable file before it is permitted to run.
Only elevate executable files that are signed and validated
SettingDetails.localSecurityOptionsRestrictAnonymousAcc: By default, this security setting restricts anonymous access to shares and pipes to the settings for Named pipes that can be accessed anonymously and Shares that can be accessed anonymously
Anonymous access to Named Pipes and Shares
SettingDetails.localSecurityOptionsSmartCardRemovalBeha: This security setting determines what happens when the smart card for a logged-on user is removed from the smart card reader.
Disconnect if a Remote Desktop Services session
SettingDetails.localSecurityOptionsStandardUserElevatio: Define the behavior of the elevation prompt for standard users.
SettingDetails.localSecurityOptionsSwitchToSecureDeskto: Enable all elevation requests to go to the interactive user's desktop rather than the secure desktop. Prompt behavior policy settings for admins and standard users are used.
Route elevation prompts to user’s interactive desktop
SettingDetails.localSecurityOptionsUseAdminApprovalMode: Define whether Admin Approval Mode and all UAC policy settings are enabled.
Run all admins in Admin Approval Mode
Admin Approval Mode For Built-in Administrator
SettingDetails.localSecurityOptionsVirtualizeFileAndReg: Determine whether app write failures are redirected to defined registry and file system locations instead of causing the app to fail.
Virtualize file and registry write failures to per-user locations
SettingDetails.localSecurityOptionspromptForConsentForN: Prompt for consent for non-Windows binaries
SettingDetails.localSecurityOptionspromptForConsentOnTh: Prompt for consent on the secure desktop
SettingDetails.localSecurityOptionspromptForCredentials: Prompt for credentials on the secure desktop
SettingDetails.localStoreDescription: Apply global firewall rules from the local store to be recognized and enforced.
SettingDetails.localStoreName: Windows Firewall rules from the local store
SettingDetails.lockScreenAllowTimeoutConfigurationDescr: Specify whether to show a user-configurable setting to control the screen timeout while on the lock screen of Windows 10 Mobile devices. If this policy is set to Allow, the value set by "Screen timeout" is ignored.
SettingDetails.lockScreenBackgroundImageURLDescription: Custom welcome screen background image URL. Must be a .png file with endpoint https://
SettingDetails.lockScreenBlockCortanaDescription: Block the user from interacting with Cortana through speech while the system is locked.
SettingDetails.lockScreenBlockToastNotificationsDescrip: Block toast notifications above the device lock screen.
SettingDetails.lockScreenMessageDescription: Specify optional text displayed on the locked screen. The "All, except when specified" Language message is shown if a custom message is not specified for a device's default language.
SettingDetails.lockScreenMessageLearnMoreText: Learn more about lock screen messages.
SettingDetails.lockScreenMessageMessageInputValidation: Lock screen message's Message cannot be empty
SettingDetails.lockScreenMessageMessageLocaleValidation: Lock screen message's Language cannot be empty
SettingDetails.lockScreenTimeoutInSecondsDescription: Set the duration (in seconds) from the screen locking to the screen turning off for Windows 10 Mobile devices. Supported values are 11-1800.
SettingDetails.lockdownTenantRequireNetworkDuringOutOfB: Prevent the user from proceeding past the Network page in Windows setup until the device successfully connects to a network.
Require users to connect to network during device setup
SettingDetails.loggingReportLocationDescription: Where to get reports (through post messages) about websites turned on in Enterprise mode.
SettingDetails.loginItemsCustomItemsTableDescription: Enter the path of the file, folder, or custom app that you want to open at login. Apps that have been built or customized for your org are typically located in the Applications folder, with a path that looks like /Applications/Example.app
SettingDetails.loginItemsCustomItemsTableName: Add the files, folders, and custom apps that will launch at login
SettingDetails.loginWindowAdminShowHostInfoDescription: Show the host name and macOS version when the menu bar is clicked.
SettingDetails.loginWindowAdminShowHostInfoName: Show additional information in the menu bar
SettingDetails.loginWindowAppleMenuHeaderDescription: After users log in, they can access Software Update, System Preferences, and all power settings from the Apple Menu.
SettingDetails.loginWindowFormatDescription: Choose how users log in to the device. Require users to type a username and password; or set to not configured to require users to select their username from a list, and then type their password. If you choose the latter, more settings will appear to let you control the visibility of the list.
SettingDetails.loginWindowFormatListAuthorizedUsersOpti: List all users, prompt for password
SettingDetails.loginWindowFormatName: Require username and password text fields
SettingDetails.loginWindowLogOutDisabledWhileLoggedInNa: Disable Log Out while logged in
SettingDetails.loginWindowPowerOffDisabledWhileLoggedIn: Disable Power Off while logged in
SettingDetails.loginWindowScreenLockDisableImmediateNam: Disable Lock Screen while logged in
SettingDetails.loginWindowShutDownDisabledWhileLoggedIn: Disable Shut Down while logged in
SettingDetails.loginWindowTextDescription: A message that appears to users on the login screen. The message could be, for example, a welcome, a warning, or your organization’s lost and found contact information.
SettingDetails.longSupportMessageDefault: The organization's IT admin can monitor and manage apps and data associated with this device, including settings, permissions, corporate access, network activity and the device's location information.
SettingDetails.longSupportMessageDescription: A long support message is text shown to the end user by the platform in the Device Policy page in Settings > Security > Device admin apps. Per the platform, this is usually accessible by clicking "Learn More" in a short support message's dialog. The "All" Language message is shown if a custom message is not specificed for the device's default language.
SettingDetails.mTUSizeInBytesBounds: MTU must be between 1280 and 1400 bytes
SettingDetails.mTUSizeInBytesToolTip: The largest packet of data, in bytes, that can be transmitted on the network. When not configured, the Apple default size is 1280 bytes. Applies to iOS 14 and later.
SettingDetails.macAddressRandomizationModeDescriptionAn: Use randomized MAC only when needed, such as for NAC support. Users can change this setting. Applies to Android 13 and later.
SettingDetails.macAppStoreAndIdentifiedDevelopersOption: Mac App Store and identified developers
SettingDetails.macBlockClassroomAppRemoteScreenObservat: Blocks AirPlay, screen sharing to other devices, and a Classroom app feature used by teachers to view their students' screens. This setting isn't available if you've blocked screenshots.
Disable AirPlay, view screen by Classroom app, and screen sharing
SettingDetails.macClassroomAppForceUnpromptedScreenObse: Unprompted observation means that teachers can view screens without warning students first. This setting isn't available if you've blocked screenshots.
Allow Classroom app to perform AirPlay and view screen without prompting
SettingDetails.macDeviceFeaturesAirprintHeader:
Use these settings to configure macOS devices to automatically connect to AirPrint compatible printers on your network. You'll need the IP address and resource path of your printers.

Learn more about obtaining printer IP addresses.
SettingDetails.macDeviceFeaturesAirprintHelpLinkText: Learn more about obtaining printer IP addresses
SettingDetails.macDeviceFeaturesAssociatedDomainsHeader: Configure associated domains to share data and sign-in credentials between your org’s apps and websites. This profile can be applied to devices running macOS 10.15 or later.
SettingDetails.macDeviceFeaturesExtensibleSingleSignOnH: Configure an app extension that enables single sign-on (SSO) for devices running macOS 10.15 or later.
SettingDetails.macDeviceFeaturesLoginItemsHeader: Choose which apps, files, and folders open when users log in to their devices. If you don't want users to change how the selected apps open, you can hide the app from the user configuration.
SettingDetails.macDeviceFeaturesLoginWindowHeader: Configure the appearance of the macOS login screen and the functions that are available to users before and after they log in.
SettingDetails.macExtensionsKernelExtensionsHeader: Use these settings to configure kernel extension policy on macOS devices running 10.13.2 or later.
SettingDetails.macExtensionsSystemExtensionsHeader: Use these settings to configure system extension policy on macOS devices running 10.15 or later.
SettingDetails.macFailedLoginResetInMinutesDescription:
How long the lockout will last, in number of minutes. During a device lockout, the sign-in screen becomes inactive so that the user can't sign in. As soon as the lockout ends, the user can try to sign in again.
For devices running macOS 10.10 or later.
SettingDetails.macFileVaultDeferCountDescription: Set the number of times the user can ignore prompts to enable FileVault before FileVault will be required for the user to sign in. Set to '0' to require FileVault to be enabled at the next login. Set to 'No limit, always prompt' to always prompt the user to enable FileVault, however the user will never be required to do so. Set to 'Disable' to disable this feature.
SettingDetails.macFileVaultDeferCountName: Number of times allowed to bypass
SettingDetails.macFileVaultDeferDisablePromptDescriptio: Disable the prompt for the user to enable FileVault when they sign out.
SettingDetails.macFileVaultForceReEncryptionDescription: Available for macOS 10.15 and later. If enabled, Intune will de-crypt the encrypted macOS device, and then re-encrypt it, applying all other settings you’ve configured on this page.
SettingDetails.macFileVaultHeader: Enable Full Disk Encryption using XTS-AES 128 with FileVault 2.
SettingDetails.macFileVaultHideRecoveryKeyDescription: A hidden personal recovery key does not appear on the user's screen during FileVault encryption, reducing the risk of it ending up in the wrong hands.
SettingDetails.macFileVaultPersonalRecoveryKeyHeader: ​A personal recovery key will be generated for the device during encryption. The following settings will apply to that personal recovery key.
SettingDetails.macFileVaultPersonalRecoveryLocationDesc: Remind users how to retrieve their stored personal recovery key. They'll see this message if they try to sign in to their device with the recovery key option on the lock screen, or if they manually disable and re-enable FileVault.
SettingDetails.macFileVaultPersonalRecoveryLocationHint: Example message: "You can retrieve the personal recovery key for your macOS device from the Microsoft Intune app, Company Portal website, or Company Portal apps for Android and iOS/iPadOS. Contoso support cannot access recovery keys that belong to personal devices."
SettingDetails.macFileVaultPersonalRecoveryLocationName: Escrow location description of personal recovery key
SettingDetails.macFileVaultPersonalRecoveryRotationDesc: Specify how frequently in months the personal recovery key for this device will rotate.
SettingDetails.macFileVaultRecoveryKeyTypeDescription: Determine which type of recovery key should be generated for this device. Currently, there is only support for a personal recovery key to be set during encryption.
SettingDetails.macFirewallAppsHeader: Allow or block incoming connections for specific apps.
SettingDetails.macFirewallBlockAllIncomingDescription: Block all incoming connections except those required for basic Internet services such as DHCP, Bonjour, and IPSec. This will block all sharing services.
SettingDetails.macFirewallEnableFirewallDescription: Enable Firewall to configure how incoming connections are handled in your environment.
SettingDetails.macFirewallEnableStealthModeDescription: Enabling stealth mode prevents the computer from responding to probing requests. The computer still answers incoming requests for authorized apps.
SettingDetails.macFirewallHeader: Use firewall to protect devices from unauthorized network access by controlling connections on a per-app basis.
SettingDetails.macForceClassroomAutomaticallyJoinClasse: Students can join a class without prompting the teacher.
Students can automatically join Classroom class without prompting
SettingDetails.macForceClassroomUnpromptedAppAndDeviceL: Teachers can lock a student's device or app without the student's approval.
Allow Classroom to lock the device without prompting
SettingDetails.macGeneralDomainsHeader: Emails that the user sends or receives which don't match the domains you specify here will be marked as untrusted.
SettingDetails.macGeneralPrivacyPreferencesHeader: Configure an app's access to specific data, folders, and apps on a device. These settings apply to devices running macOS Mojave 10.14 and later.
SettingDetails.macKernelExtensionsAllowUserOverridesDes: Identifiers that define which validly signed kernel extensions will be allowed to load.
SettingDetails.macKernelExtensionsAllowedExtensionsTabl: Bundle identifier and team identifiers of kernel extensions that will be allowed. Use an empty team identifier for unsigned legacy kernel extensions.
SettingDetails.macKernelExtensionsAllowedTeamIdsTableDe: Identifiers that define which validly signed kernel extensions will be allowed to load.
SettingDetails.macNumberOfSignInFailuresBeforeLockDescr: The maximum number (2-11) of times that a user can try to sign in (consecutively) before their device locks them out.
SettingDetails.macOSAllowAllAppsAccess: Allow all apps access to private key
SettingDetails.macOSAppleEventReceiverCodeRequirementDe: See the Intune docs to learn how to request and enter the code requirement. Learn more
SettingDetails.macOSAppleEventReceiverCodeRequirementEm: (anchor apple generic and certificate leaf [field.1.2.345.678901.234.5.6.7] /* exists */ or anchor apple) and identifier "com.apple.appname.ui"
SettingDetails.macOSAppleEventReceiverIdentifierDescrip: Enter the bundle ID or file path of an app, process, or executable.
SettingDetails.macOSAppleEventReceiverIdentifierTypeDes: A bundle ID is used to identify an app; a path is used to identify a process or executable.
SettingDetails.macOSAppleEventReceiverTableDescription: Allow the app or process to send a restricted Apple event to another app or process. You will need to know the identifier, identifier type, and code requirement of the receiving app or process.
SettingDetails.macOSPrivacyAccessControlItemAccessibili: Control access to the accessibility app on the device, which houses features such as closed captions, hover text, and voice control.
SettingDetails.macOSPrivacyAccessControlItemBlockListen: A way for apps and processes to listen to and collect data from input devices such as a mouse, keyboard, or trackpad. Block if you don’t want apps and processes to have access to this data. Requires macOS 10.15 or later.
SettingDetails.macOSPrivacyAccessControlItemBlockScreen: Block app from capturing contents of system display. Requires macOS 10.15 or later.
SettingDetails.macOSPrivacyAccessControlItemCodeRequire: See the Intune docs to learn how to request and enter the code requirement. Learn more
(anchor apple generic and certificate leaf [field.1.2.345.678901.234.5.6.7] /* exists */ or anchor apple) and identifier "com.apple.appname.ui"
SettingDetails.macOSPrivacyAccessControlItemDisplayName: The display name of the app, process, or executable.
SettingDetails.macOSPrivacyAccessControlItemFileProvide: Control access to the user's file activity. If allowed, the app can know when a user accesses files managed by a file provider and what app they were using to access them. Requires macOS 10.15 and later.
SettingDetails.macOSPrivacyAccessControlItemIdentifierD: Enter the bundle ID or file path of an app, process, or executable.
SettingDetails.macOSPrivacyAccessControlItemIdentifierT: A bundle ID is used to identify an app; a path is used to identify a process or executable.
SettingDetails.macOSPrivacyAccessControlItemPhotosDescr: Images won’t be protected from an app or process if they’re stored somewhere other than the Photos app.
SettingDetails.macOSPrivacyAccessControlItemPostEventDe: Control access to CoreGraphics APIs, which are used to send CGEvents to the system event stream.
SettingDetails.macOSPrivacyAccessControlItemSpeechRecog: Allow or block access to system speech recognition facility. Requires macOS 10.15 or later.
SettingDetails.macOSPrivacyAccessControlItemStaticCodeV: Statically validates the code requirement. Use this setting if the process invalidates its dynamic code signature.
SettingDetails.macOSPrivacyAccessControlItemSystemPolic: Control access to all protected files on a device. Files might be in locations such as emails, messages, apps, and administrative settings. Apply this setting with caution.
SettingDetails.macOSSoftwareUpdatePolicyScheduleTypeDes: When updates will be available to install. Updates made during or outside of scheduled times require additional input.
SettingDetails.macOSSoftwareUpdatePolicySectionDescript: Create a profile to force assigned devices to automatically install the latest macOS updates. These settings determine how and when software updates deploy. This profile doesn't prevent users from updating the OS manually. Updates will only apply to supervised devices.
SettingDetails.macOSSoftwareUpdatePolicySupervisedName: Create a profile to force assigned devices to automatically install the latest macOS updates. These settings determine how and when software updates deploy. This profile doesn't prevent users from updating the OS manually. Updates will only apply to supervised devices.
SettingDetails.macOSSoftwareUpdateSelectScheduleTypeNam: By default, when an update policy is assigned to a device, Intune deploys the latest updates at device check-in. You can instead create a weekly schedule with customized start and end times. If you choose to update outside of the scheduled time, Intune won't deploy updates until the scheduled time ends.
SettingDetails.macOSSoftwareUpdateSelectUpdateBehaviorN: Select how downloads, installations, and/or notifications should occur for each type of update.
SettingDetails.macRequireClassroomRequestPermissionToLe: Students enrolled in an unmanaged Classroom course must get teacher consent to leave the course.
Require teacher permission to leave Classroom app unmanaged classes
SettingDetails.macSystemExtensionsAllowedExtensionTypes: For devices running macOS 10.15 or later. Select the system extension types that can be installed on the device for a given team ID. Configuring this setting for a team ID found in allowed system extensions could prevent those system extensions from running if they are not an allowed type. If a team ID is specified in allowed team identifiers and not in this one as well, then all extension types will be allowed for that specific team ID.
SettingDetails.macSystemExtensionsAllowedExtensionsTabl: For devices running macOS 10.15 or later. Allow specific system extensions to always run on the device by adding the bundle ID and team ID of the extension. If you configure this setting and want specific extension types that are allowed, configure the system extension type setting by adding the team ID there as well. Entering a team ID that matches a team ID in allowed team identifiers will prevent the policy from being properly deployed.
SettingDetails.macSystemExtensionsAllowedTeamIdsTableDe: For devices running macOS 10.15 or later. A team identifier is 10 alphanumeric characters long. Any system extension signed with the team IDs you enter will be allowed and trusted on devices. You can find your team ID on developer.apple.com. If you configure this setting and want specific extension types that are allowed, configure the system extension type setting by adding the team ID there as well. Entering a team ID that matches a team ID in allowed system extensions will prevent the policy from being properly deployed.
SettingDetails.macSystemExtensionsBlockUserOverridesDes: For devices running macOS 10.15 or later. Blocks device users from approving system extensions that aren't on the allowed list. When not configured, users are allowed to approve unknown extensions even if those extensions are not listed in the configuration profile.
SettingDetails.macTouchIdTimeoutInHoursDescription: Maximum hours after which the user must enter their password to unlock the device instead of using Touch ID. Available for devices running macOS 12 and later.
SettingDetails.managedPasteboardRequiredDescription: Open-in management controls how people share data between unmanaged and managed apps. If you configure this setting, Intune will enforce copy/paste restrictions based on how you configured Block viewing corporate documents in unmanaged apps and Block viewing non-corporate documents in corporate apps.
SettingDetails.managedPasteboardRequiredName: Allow copy/paste to be affected by managed open-in
SettingDetails.maxUserDeferralsDescription: Enter the maximum number of user deferrals allowed, after which a forced update will occur on the device. Available for devices running macOS versions 12 and later.
SettingDetails.meetingInformationDisplayedOnWelcomeScre: Meeting information displayed on welcome screen
SettingDetails.messagingBlockMMSDescription: Disable the MMS send/receive functionality on the device.
SettingDetails.messagingBlockRCSDescription: Disable the Rich Communication Services send/receive functionality on the device.
SettingDetails.messagingBlockSyncDescription: Disable Messaging Everywhere and text message back up and restore.
SettingDetails.microsoftAccountOptionalForMailDescripti: Block access to Windows Mail app without a Microsoft account (Block access recommended)
SettingDetails.microsoftAccountOptionalForMailName: Access to Windows Mail app without a Microsoft account
SettingDetails.microsoftTunnelSiteDescription: The VPN client will connect to the public IP address or FQDN of the site.
SettingDetails.microsoftTunnelSiteNotExist: The site does not exist. Select a new site.
SettingDetails.microsoftUpdatesDescription: Control whether to scan for updates from Microsoft Update.
SettingDetails.minimumNumberOfCharacterSetsDescription:
This setting specifies the minimum number of character sets that the password must contain. The four character sets are:
Lowercase letters
Uppercase letters
Symbols
Numbers
SettingDetails.minimumNumberOfCharacterSetsName: Number of character sets a password must contain
SettingDetails.minimumPasswordLengthDescription: Minimum number of digits or characters in password.
SettingDetails.minutesOfInactivityBeforePassword: Maximum minutes after screen lock before password is required
SettingDetails.minutesOfInactivityBeforePasswordDescrip: Maximum minutes after screen lock before password is required. Immediately recommended. Ignored by device if new time is longer than what's currently set on device.
SettingDetails.minutesOfInactivityBeforeScreenTurnsOffD: Maximum minutes of inactivity until screen locks. Ignored by device if new time is longer than what's currently set on device.  If set to Immediately, devices will use the minimum possible value per device.
SettingDetails.minutesOfInactivityBeforeScreenTurnsOffN: Maximum minutes of inactivity until screen locks
SettingDetails.miracastWirelessProjectionChannelDescrip: If "Miracast wireless projection" is blocked, the value set by "Miracast wireless projection channel" is ignored.
SettingDetails.modifyAccountsDisabledDescriptionDedicat: Block modification of accounts. Only supported on Dedicated devices.
SettingDetails.mopriaDiscoveryResourceIdDescription: OAuth resource URI for printer discovery service as configured in Azure portal
SettingDetails.multiplayerGamingBlockedMacDescription: Yes prevents multiplayer gaming when using Game Center. Available for devices running macOS versions 10.13 or later.
SettingDetails.multiplayerGamingBlockedMacName: Block multiplayer gaming in the Game Center
SettingDetails.mustBeAPathToFolder: Must be a path to local folder
SettingDetails.mustBeAPathToLocalFile: Must be a path to local file
SettingDetails.mustBeAPathToLocalFileOrFolder: Must be a path to local file or folder
SettingDetails.mustBeAValidAppId: Must be a valid App ID.
SettingDetails.mustBeAValidAppleAppStoreUri: Must be a valid app store URI with a country code and ID.
SettingDetails.mustBeAValidApplicationId: Must be a valid application id
SettingDetails.mustBeAValidAumid: Must be a valid application user model id
SettingDetails.mustBeAValidBundleId: Must be a valid bundle id
SettingDetails.mustBeAValidFilePath: Must be a valid file path
SettingDetails.mustBeAValidHttpsUrl: Must be a valid https url
SettingDetails.mustBeAValidIPOrFQDNWithOptionalPortNumb: Value must be a valid IP address or FQDN with optional port number.
SettingDetails.mustBeAValidIPv4Address: Must be a valid IPv4 address (e.g. 192.168.0.1)
SettingDetails.mustBeAValidIPv6Address: Must be a valid IPv6 address (e.g. 2001:0db8:85a3:0000:0000:8a2e:0370:7334)
SettingDetails.mustBeAValidImageUrl: Must be a valid image URL such as www.contoso.com/image.jpg
SettingDetails.mustBeAValidLengthWEPPassword: Must be a valid passphrase length (5 or 13 characters) or HEX key (10 or 26 characters)
SettingDetails.mustBeAValidPort: Must be a valid port (e.g. 0 to 65535)
SettingDetails.mustBeAValidProductKey: Must be a valid product key (format: 12345-22345-32345-42345-52345)
SettingDetails.mustBeAValidTeamId: Must be a valid team id
SettingDetails.mustBeAValidUrlNoProtocol: Must be a valid url or IP address with no protocol (no http or https)
SettingDetails.mustBeAValidUrlOrIP: Must be a valid url or IP address
SettingDetails.mustBeAValidUrlWithIdParameter: Must be a valid URI with an id query parameter. Example: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.microsoft.test2
SettingDetails.mustBeAWellFormedXMLString: Must be a well formed XML string
SettingDetails.mustBeGreaterThanMobileOsMinimumVersion: Must be greater than the minimum OS version for mobile devices
SettingDetails.mustBeGreaterThanOsMinimumVersion: Must be greater than the minimum OS version
SettingDetails.mustBeSingleObject: Must be a single value. Commas not allowed
SettingDetails.mustBeSmallerThanMobileOsMaximumVersion: Must be smaller than the maximum OS version for mobile devices
SettingDetails.mustBeSmallerThanOsMaximumVersion: Must be smaller than the maximum OS version
SettingDetails.mustBeValidAddress: Must be a valid address. Example: 4.3.6.0, itgproxy.com, etc.
SettingDetails.mustBeValidAndroidPackageName: Package name must only contain letters, numbers, underscores, and periods. Must start with a letter.
SettingDetails.mustBeValidBuildVersionFormat: Must be a valid build version format. Example: 18A291, 16G1114, 20E772520a
SettingDetails.mustBeValidDNSSuffix: Must be a valid DNS suffix. Example: itgproxy.com
SettingDetails.mustBeValidDateFormat: Must be a valid date format (YYYY-MM-DD). Example: 2016-10-01, 2016-10-31 etc.
SettingDetails.mustBeValidDomain: Must be a valid domain. Example: contoso.com
SettingDetails.mustBeValidEmail: Must be a valid Email address. Example: username@example.com etc.
SettingDetails.mustBeValidEmailList: Must be in a valid email list format of user1@gmail.com; user2@gmail.com.
SettingDetails.mustBeValidFloatingPoint: Must be a valid floating point number. Example: 1.0, 4.3, etc.
SettingDetails.mustBeValidGuid: Must be a valid UUID. Example: 782AFCFC-7CAA-436C-8BF0-78CD0FFBD4AF, etc.
SettingDetails.mustBeValidHost: Must be a valid host. Example: www.host.com etc.
SettingDetails.mustBeValidHttpURL: Must be a valid HTTP or HTTPS URL. Example: https://www.contoso.com
SettingDetails.mustBeValidIpAddress: Must be a valid IP address. Example: 4.3.6.0
SettingDetails.mustBeValidKaiserWifiFormat: The format is incorrect. User format example: abcd{{WifiMacAddress}}, Password format example: abcd{{WifiMacAddress}}{{PreSharedKey}}
SettingDetails.mustBeValidMonthDayDateFormat: Must be a valid date format (MM/DD). Example: 01/31, 02/28 etc.
SettingDetails.mustBeValidObjectIdentifierFormat: Must be a valid Object Identifier format. Example: 4.3.6.0, 7.01.4, etc.
SettingDetails.mustBeValidOperatingSystemVersionFormat: Must be a valid operating system version format. Example: 1.0.0.0
SettingDetails.mustBeValidOrgUnit: Must be a valid Organizational unit starting with OU and ending with DC. Example: OU=Autopilot,OU=Workstations,DC=contoso,DC=com
SettingDetails.mustBeValidPort: Must be a valid port. Example: 1, 2, 80, etc.
SettingDetails.mustBeValidVersionFormat: Must be a valid version format. Example: 4.3.06, 7.01.4, etc.
SettingDetails.mustNotBeEmpty: The value should not be empty.
SettingDetails.nATKeepAliveIntervalInSecondsToolTip: How often, in seconds, the NAT system checks to make sure the device is still connected to the VPN.
SettingDetails.nATKeepAliveIntervalSecondsBounds: NAT keep alive interval must be between [20, 1440] for wifi and [110, 1440] for cellular, inclusive.
SettingDetails.nATKeepAliveOffloadEnableName: Offload NAT keepalive to hardware when device is asleep
SettingDetails.nATKeepAliveOffloadEnableToolTip: By default, when a device is asleep, the NAT system will continuously check to make sure it's connected to the VPN. This setting lets you disable that behavior.
SettingDetails.nacIdDescCisco:
Cisco AnyConnect requires the Intune device ID to be included in the VPN profile in order to enable NAC.

I allow Microsoft to include device information in the VPN profile, which can be used by Cisco and their partners. Click to learn more, including what data is shared with the service provider.
SettingDetails.nacIdDescCitrix:
Citrix SSO requires the Intune device ID to be included in the VPN profile in order to enable NAC.

I allow Microsoft to include device information in the VPN profile, which can be used by Citrix and their partners. Click to learn more, including what data is shared with the service provider.
SettingDetails.nacIdDescF5:
F5 Access requires the Intune device ID to be included in the VPN profile in order to enable NAC.

I allow Microsoft to include device information in the VPN profile, which can be used by F5 Access and their partners. Click to learn more, including what data is shared with the service provider.
SettingDetails.nacIdHeaderCiscoToolTip:
The device ID will be encrypted and included in the VPN profile. When the user attempts to connect to the VPN, Cisco AnyConnect will pass this value to your NAC infrastructure, which will then query Intune with this value to determine if the device is enrolled and compliant.

Cisco AnyConnect is unable to access the device ID directly so in order to enable NAC, this value must be included in the VPN profile.
SettingDetails.nacIdHeaderCitrixToolTip:
The device ID will be encrypted and included in the VPN profile. When the user attempts to connect to the VPN, Citrix SSO will pass this value to your NAC infrastructure, which will then query Intune with this value to determine if the device is enrolled and compliant.

Citrix SSO is unable to access the device ID directly so in order to enable NAC, this value must be included in the VPN profile.
SettingDetails.nacIdHeaderF5ToolTip:
The device ID will be encrypted and included in the VPN profile. When the user attempts to connect to the VPN, F5 Access will pass this value to your NAC infrastructure, which will then query Intune with this value to determine if the device is enrolled and compliant.

F5 Access is unable to access the device ID directly so in order to enable NAC, this value must be included in the VPN profile.
SettingDetails.networkAndInternetPageDescription: Block access to Network ​and Internet in Settings app.
SettingDetails.networkEscapeHatchDescription: Whether the network escape hatch is enabled. If a network connection can't be made at boot time, the escape hatch prompts the user to temporarily connect to a network in order to refresh the device policy. After applying policy, the temporary network will be forgotten and the device will continue booting. This prevents being unable to connect to a network if there is no suitable network in the last policy and the device boots into an app in lock task mode, or the user is otherwise unable to reach device settings.
SettingDetails.networkLogsTitle: Allow this app to access Android network activity logs
SettingDetails.networkProxyAutomaticConfigurationUrlDes: URL to the PAC script you want to use.
SettingDetails.networkProxyDisableAutoDetectDescription: Automatically detect settings. If enabled, the system tries to find the path to a PAC script.
SettingDetails.networkProxyUseManualServerAddressDescri: Address to the proxy server. Specify an address in the format server[“:”port].
SettingDetails.networkProxyUseManualServerExceptionsDes: Addresses that should not use the proxy server. The system will not use the proxy server for addresses beginning with what is specified in this node. Use semicolons (;) to separate entries.
SettingDetails.networkProxyUseManualServerForLocalAddre: Specifies whether the proxy server should be used for local (intranet) addresses.
Bypass proxy server for local address
SettingDetails.networkSettingsSubtitle: Configure Windows Firewall settings applicable to specific network types.
SettingDetails.networkUsageRulesBlockCellularHeaderName: Add managed iOS apps that should not be allowed to use any cellular data.
SettingDetails.networkUsageRulesBlockCellularRoamingHea: Add managed iOS apps that should not be allowed to use any cellular data when roaming.
SettingDetails.networkUsageRulesBlockCellularRoamingNam: Block use of cellular data when roaming
SettingDetails.networkUsageRulesHeaderDescription: Define what data managed apps can use over cellular networks.
SettingDetails.networkUsageRulesHeaderNameDescription: Define what data managed apps can use over cellular networks.
SettingDetails.nfcBlockOutgoingBeamDescription: Block usage of NFC to beam data from apps.
SettingDetails.nfcBlockedDescription: Disable NFC to prevent devices from pairing with other NFC-enabled devices. Available for iOS/iPadOS devices running 14.2 or later.
SettingDetails.nonEapMethodDescription: This property is used when the end-user is expected to enter a username and password for authenticating the Wi-Fi connection. CHAP protocols provide an additional handshake along with the credential exchange which provides better security. Ensure you select the same protocol that is configured on your Wi-Fi network.
SettingDetails.notificationAndSystemInfoStatusBarOption: Show system notifications and information in device's status bar
SettingDetails.notificationSettingsDescription: Specifies the restriction enforced notification settings for apps, using their bundle identifiers.
SettingDetails.notificationsAlertTypeDescription:
Choose the type of notification for this app:
0: None
1: Banner
2: Modal.
Default is Banner.
SettingDetails.notificationsBundleIdDescription: Enter the Bundle ID of the app to which to apply these notification settings.
SettingDetails.notificationsPreviewTypeDescription: Previews show the contents of recent app notifications. Select when to show previews on the device. Available for iOS/iPadOS 14.0 and later.
SettingDetails.notificationsShowBadgeOnAppIconDescripti: Show badges on the icon for this app. Default is Enable.
SettingDetails.notificationsShowInLockScreenDescrption: Show notifications on the Lock screen. Default is Enable.
SettingDetails.notificationsShowInNotificationCenterDes: Show notifications in Notification Center. Default is Enable.
SettingDetails.notificationsSoundsDescription: Play a sound with the app notification. Default is Enable.
SettingDetails.notifyAppChangesDoNotDimOption: Notify on app changes (but do not dim desktop)
SettingDetails.numberOfComplexCharactersInPasswordDescr: Minimum number of non-alphanumeric characters (like #, %, !, etc.) that the password must contain.
SettingDetails.numberOfComplexCharactersInPasswordName: Number of non-alphanumeric characters in password
SettingDetails.numberOfPreviousPasswordsToBlockDescript: Number of new passwords that must be used until an old one can be reused.
SettingDetails.numberOfSignInFailuresBeforeWipeDescript: Number of consecutive times an incorrect password can be entered before device is wiped of all data.
SettingDetails.numberOfSignInFailuresBeforeWipeName: Number of sign-in failures before wiping device
SettingDetails.numberOfSignInFailuresBeforeWipeWarning: If you set this value to 2, all data on the device is wiped on the second failed passcode attempt. It's very common to enter the wrong passcode. Make sure you understand the impact of this setting.
SettingDetails.numsLowerUpperLettersOption: Numbers, lowercase and uppercase letters required
SettingDetails.numsLowerUpperLettersSpecialCharsOption: Numbers, lowercase, uppercase and special characters required
SettingDetails.offboardConfigurationPkgDescription: Upload a signed configuration package that will be used to offboard the Microsoft Defender for Endpoint client
SettingDetails.onDemandRulesDescription: These settings are used to create a rule. If there is a match with your rule, then the device does the action you choose, like create an on-demand VPN connection.
SettingDetails.onDemandRulesExample: e.g. disconnect VPN on corp Wi-Fi
SettingDetails.onDemandRulesInfo: Learn more about crafting on-demand rules.
SettingDetails.onDemandRulesStory: These rules will be evaluated sequentially. Since order matters, keep the strictest rules towards the top, followed by a gradual progression of leniency. This will ensure proper rule evaluation on the device.
SettingDetails.onDeviceOnlyDictationForcedDescription: Disables connections to Siri servers so that users can’t use Siri to dictate text. Available for devices running iOS and iPadOS versions 14.5 or later.
SettingDetails.onDeviceOnlyTranslationForcedDescription: Disables connections to Siri servers so that users can’t use Siri to translate text. Available for devices running iOS and iPadOS versions 15 and later.
SettingDetails.onboardConfigurationPkgDescription: Upload a signed configuration package that will be used to onboard the Microsoft Defender for Endpoint client
SettingDetails.openSearchXmlUrlDescription: Points to a https link containing the OpenSearch xml file that contains, at minimum, the short name and the URL to the search Engine.
SettingDetails.opportunisticallyMatchAuthDescription: Set keying modules to ignore the entire authentication set if they do not support all authentication suites in that set. If enabled, keying modules will ignore unsupported authentication suites.
SettingDetails.opportunisticallyMatchAuthName: Opportunistically match authentication set per keying module
SettingDetails.organizationalUnitDescription: Full path to Organizational Unit (OU) the computer accounts are to be created in. If not specified well known computer object container is used.
SettingDetails.outboundConnectionsDescription: Configure the default action firewall performs on outbound connections. This setting will get applied to Windows version 1809 and above.
SettingDetails.pFSGroupDescription: Diffie-Hellman group used for perfect forward secrecy (PFS). Value must match VPN server settings.
SettingDetails.pKCSPolicyCertificationAuthorityNameDesc: The fully qualified domain name of the server that hosts the Certification Authority role and issues certificates.
SettingDetails.pKCSPolicyCertificationAuthorityNameName: A friendly name for the certification authority
SettingDetails.pKCSPolicyCustomSubjectAlternativeNameFo: Value can include allowed variables combined with static text. UPN and Email address should include an @, for example: “{{AAD_Device_ID}}@contoso.com”. DNS cannot end with a symbol or contain an @ sign, e.g. “{{DeviceName}}.contoso.com“ or “{{DeviceName}}”. See support variables here: https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2104597
SettingDetails.packageFamilyNameBlankError: Package family name cannot be blank.
SettingDetails.packageFamilyNameInvalidOrWrongFormatErr: Package family name contains invalid characters or is not formatted correctly. Please ensure the value is entered exactly as it appears in the "PackageFamilyName" field when "Get-AppxPackage" is executed.
SettingDetails.packetQueuingDescription: Specify how scaling for the software on the receive side is enabled for the encrypted receive and clear text forward for the IPsec tunnel gateway scenario. This ensures that the packet order is preserved.
SettingDetails.packetQueuingForwardingOnlyOption: Queue packets after decryption is performed for forwarding only
SettingDetails.packetQueuingInboundOutboundOption: Configure both inbound and outbound packets
SettingDetails.passwordBlockKeyguardFeaturesDescription: These features are accessible to users when the device is locked. Users will not be able to see or access disabled features.
SettingDetails.passwordBlockSimpleDescription: Specify whether PINs or passwords such as "1111" or "1234" are allowed. For desktop devices running Windows 10 or later, it also controls the use of picture passwords.
SettingDetails.passwordComplexityDescription:
This setting defines the occurrences of complex elements required for a strong PIN or password.
Require digits, lowercase and uppercase letters is not supported in desktop Microsoft accounts and domain accounts
Require digits, lowercase, uppercase, and special characters is not supported in desktop
Default is Require digits and lowercase letters
SettingDetails.passwordExpirationDescription: Number of days until device password must be changed.
SettingDetails.passwordExpirationInDaysDescription: Number of days until device password must be changed.
SettingDetails.passwordExpirationName: Number of days until password expires
SettingDetails.passwordMinimumAgeInDaysDescription: This security setting determines the period of time (in days) that a password must be used before the user can change it. You can set a value between 1 and 998 days, or you can allow changes immediately by setting the number of days to 0.
SettingDetails.passwordMinimumLengthDescription: Minimum number of digits or characters required in password.
SettingDetails.passwordMinimumSymbolCharactersDescripti: Minimum number of symbols required in password.
SettingDetails.passwordPreviousPasswordBlockCountDescri: Enter the number of unique passwords required before a user can reuse an old one.
SettingDetails.passwordPreviousPasswordBlockCountName: Number of passwords required before user can reuse a password
SettingDetails.passwordSignInFailureCountBeforeFactoryR: Number of consecutive times (4-11) an incorrect password can be entered before device is wiped of all data.
Number of sign-in failures before wiping device
SettingDetails.peersInCustomLocalNetworksOption: Content cachings using custom local networks
SettingDetails.peersInLocalNetworkOption: Content caches using the same local network
SettingDetails.peersWithSamePublicIpAddressOption: Content caches with the same public IP address
SettingDetails.perAccountVPNProfileName: VPN profile for per account VPN
SettingDetails.perAccountVPNProfileTooltip: If you choose a VPN profile from the list, any email that's sent to and from this account in the Mail app will use the VPN. Applies to iOS 14 and later.
SettingDetails.perAppVPNDefenderEndpointInfoName: When using Microsoft Defender for Endpoint with per-app VPN enabled, anti-phishing only applies to the apps associated with this VPN profile. Click here to learn more.
SettingDetails.perAppVPNOnlyAppliesForCertAuth: Choose On-demand VPN to specify a set of rules to automatically connect or disconnect the VPN connection. Choose per-app VPN to restrict the VPN connection to a set of apps or Safari domains.
SettingDetails.perAppVPNnstructions:
Next steps to enable Per-app VPN for iOS devices

1. Finish creating this VPN profile.

2. Go to client apps.

3. Select an app from the list.

4. Go to Assignments.

5. In the VPN dropdown, select the VPN profile you would like the app to use.

6. Deploy the app.
SettingDetails.perAppVPNnstructionsName: After creating this profile, additional steps are required to configure Per-app VPN.
SettingDetails.perMessageSwitchDescription: Display the per-message encryption switch when composing a new email. Select whether or not users can opt in or out of encryption per message. If the “Encrypt by default” setting is enabled, enabling the per-message encryption switch allows the user to opt out of encryption per message.  If the “Encrypt by default” setting is disabled, enabling the per-message encryption switch will allow users to opt in to encryption per message.
SettingDetails.performServerValidationDescription: Enable to verify the server’s identity by validating the certificate during exchange with the PEAP server. We recommend setting this to Yes when possible. Setting this to No or Not Configured is less secure.
SettingDetails.personalProfileAppsAllowInstallFromUnkno: When allowed, users can enable the “unknown sources” setting to install apps from sources other than the Google Play Store.
Allow users to enable app installation from unknown sources in the personal profile
SettingDetails.personalProfileCameraBlockedDescription: Block all cameras on the device
SettingDetails.personalProfilePersonalApplicationsListT: Select "Allowed apps" to create a list of apps that are allowed and approved to install and run in the personal profile on the device. Select "Blocked apps" to create a list of apps that are prohibited and prevented from installing and running in the personal profile on the device.
SettingDetails.personalizationDesktopImageUrlDescriptio: Set a desktop background image that users cannot change. Applicable on devices running Windows 10/11 Enterprise and Windows 10/11 Education. Image file type must be PNG, JPG, or JPEG.
SettingDetails.personalizationLockScreenImageUrlDescrip: Set a lock screen picture (jpg, jpeg, png) and prevent users from changing it.
SettingDetails.personalizationPageDescription: Block access to Personalization in Settings app.
SettingDetails.playIntegrityVerdictOptionsDescription: Set the level of Play Integrity Verdict
SettingDetails.policySubjectAlternativeNameDescription: Enter how Intune automatically creates the values for the SAN in the certificate request.
SettingDetails.policySubjectAlternativeNameHelp: Please review SAN documentation on how to best use the SAN field.
SettingDetails.portNumberDescription: If your proxy server uses a particular port, enter it here.
SettingDetails.postponeRebootUntilAfterDeadlineDescript: Specifies if the device should auto reboot before deadline
SettingDetails.powerButtonActionBatteryDescription:
This policy setting specifies the action that Windows takes when a user presses the Power button while the device is powered by a battery.​
If you enable this policy setting, you must select the desired action.
If you disable this policy setting or do not configure it, users can see and change this setting.
SettingDetails.powerButtonActionPluggedInDescription:
This policy setting specifies the action that Windows takes when a user presses the Power button while the device is plugged in.​
If you enable this policy setting, you must select the desired action.
If you disable this policy setting or do not configure it, users can see and change this setting.
SettingDetails.powerSleepButtonActionBatteryDescription:
This policy setting specifies the action that Windows takes when a user presses the Sleep button while the device is powered by a battery.​
If you enable this policy setting, you must select the desired action.
If you disable this policy setting or do not configure it, users can see and change this setting.
SettingDetails.powerSleepButtonActionPluggedInDescripti:
This policy setting specifies the action that Windows takes when a user presses the Sleep button while the device is plugged in.​
If you enable this policy setting, you must select the desired action.
If you disable this policy setting or do not configure it, users can see and change this setting.
SettingDetails.preReleaseBuildsDescription: Enable pre-release builds if you want devices to be on a Windows Insider channel. Enabling pre-release builds will cause devices to reboot.
SettingDetails.preReleaseFeaturesDescription:
Microsoft runs, among others, anonymized tests to study user preferences and device behaviors. Use this setting to define the level of testing that Microsoft can run.

Not configured - Permits Microsoft to only configure device settings ​

Allow - Allows Microsoft to conduct all relevant testing, including configuring device settings ​

Block - Blocks Microsoft from conducting any testing, including configuring device settings
SettingDetails.primaryAuthenticationMethodTEAPDescripti: Choose the primary way you want users to authenticate. When you select Certificates, select one of the certificate profiles (SCEP or PKCS) that is also deployed to the device. This is the identity certificate that is presented by the device to the server.
SettingDetails.printersDescription: Automatically provision printers based on their network host names. This setting does not support shared printers.
SettingDetails.priorityDescription: The scheduling priority for downloading and preparing the requested update. This is only supported for minor OS updates (macOS 12.x to 12.y). Available in macOS 12.3 and later.
SettingDetails.privacyAutoAcceptPairingAndConsentPrompt: Allow automatic acceptance of the pairing and privacy user consent dialogs when launching apps.
Automatic acceptance of the pairing and privacy user consent prompts
SettingDetails.privacyBlockInputPersonalizationDescript: Block usage of cloud-based speech services for Cortana, dictation or Windows Store apps. If not configured, Microsoft may use user voice data to improve cloud speech services.
SettingDetails.privacyDisableLaunchExperienceDescriptio: This policy prevents the privacy experience from launching during user logon for new and upgraded users.

SettingDetails.privacyLocalActivitiesOnlyDescription: Block shared experiences/discovery of recently used resources in task switcher etc. based only on local activity.

SettingDetails.probeUrlOptionalDescription: This URL is a test and determines if the device is on an external network. The URL is probed every time a user tries to access a domain in the domains list. If the probe fails because the URL is unreachable or doesn't return a 200 HTTP status code, then a VPN connection is created. For example, enter https://corp.contoso.com/internalprobe, which can only be accessed when the device is joined to the internal network.
SettingDetails.probeUrlOptionalName: Enter the HTTP or HTTPS probing URL
SettingDetails.processesToExcludeName: Processes to exclude from scans and real-time protection
SettingDetails.promptUsersForSamplesSubmissionDescripti: Send telemetry to the Microsoft Active Protection Service for detection of suspicious activity.
SettingDetails.provideDerivedCredential: You have not specified a derived credential issuer for your tenant

SettingDetails.proxyExclusionListDescription: Add hostnames to prevent them from routing through the proxy.
SettingDetails.proxyServerAddressDescription: Enter the IP address of the proxy server.

SettingDetails.publicPlayStoreEnabledDescription: If you select "Allow", users get access to all apps, except the ones you've required uninstall in Client Apps. If you choose "Block" or "Not configured" for this setting, users can only access the apps you've listed as available or required in Client Apps.
SettingDetails.publicPlayStoreEnabledName: Allow access to all apps in Google Play store
SettingDetails.publicPlayStoreEnabledWarning: If you select "Allow", users are able to install any apps from the Google Play Store. If you later change your selection to "Block" or "Not configured", all apps will be removed from the device, except apps you've listed as available or required in Client Apps.
SettingDetails.publicUnicastResponsesToMulticastBroadca: Unicast responses to multicast broadcasts (Public networks)
SettingDetails.qualityUpdatesDeferralPeriodDescription: Defer quality updates for the specified number of days.
SettingDetails.radioWarningInfoBox: Warning! Disabling all radios will render the device unmanageable without a wired network connection
SettingDetails.readOnlyMappingDescription: If files are read-only, user will not be able to remove any detected malware
SettingDetails.recommendedResolutionDescription: Delete the profile if it's no longer being used. If the profile is still useful, re-create the policy in this portal and assign it to the same groups. After that's complete, delete this profile here or in the classic portal.
SettingDetails.recurrenceTooltip: Specify how often the system should check for apps with update failures to be restarted.
SettingDetails.redirectDescription: If enabled, the IKEv2 connection will be redirected if a redirect request is received from the server.​
SettingDetails.remoteAddressRangesDescription:
These remote address ranges will be allowed over the VPN interface.
For a single IP address, enter the same address in both fields.
SettingDetails.remoteInputOptionAndroid: Text entry in notifications (fully managed or dedicated)​
SettingDetails.remotePortRangesDescription:
Match this rule when the remote port is between the lower and upper port range.
Remote port ranges follow the same logic as local port ranges.
Local port range should be set only when protocol is either TCP or UDP (6 or 17), otherwise you will get an error trying to save the profile.
SettingDetails.requireAppStorePasswordDescription: Users must enter Apple ID password for each in-app and iTunes purchase.
SettingDetails.requireAppStorePasswordName: Require iTunes Store password for all purchases
SettingDetails.requireAppVerifyDescription: Enforce that the Verify Apps setting is turned on for work and personal profiles. Important: this setting will only work for devices that are Android O and above.
SettingDetails.requireClassroomRequestPermissionToLeave: Requires a student enrolled in an unmanaged course via Classroom to request permission from the teacher when attempting to leave the course. Only available in iOS 11.3+
Require teacher permission to leave Classroom app unmanaged classes
SettingDetails.requireCompanyPortalAppIntegrityDescript: Checks that the company portal app has the default runtime environment installed, is properly signed, and is not in debug-mode.
SettingDetails.requireCryptographicBindingDescription: Only connect to PEAP servers that use cryptographic binding during PEAP negotiation. We recommend setting this to Yes when possible. Setting this to No or Not Configured is less secure.
SettingDetails.requireDeviceCompliancePolicyAssignedDes: Default policy. Devices must have at least one compliance policy assigned to be compliant.
SettingDetails.requireEncryptionDescription:
Require encryption on device. Not all devices support encryption.

You must also:
1. Enable 'Require password'
2. Specify 'Password quality' of 'At least numeric'
3. Set 'Minimum password length' of at least 4, to correctly report compliance for this setting.
SettingDetails.requireEncryptionOnRemovableStorageDescr: Storage cards must be encrypted. Not all devices support storage card encryption. For more information, see the device and mobile operating system documentation.
SettingDetails.requireGooglePlayServicesDescription: Check that the  Google Play services app is installed and enabled. Google Play services allows security updates and is a base level dependency for many security features on certified Google devices.
SettingDetails.requireIntuneAppIntegrityDescription: Checks that the Intune app has the default runtime environment installed, and is properly signed.
SettingDetails.requirePINForPairingDescription: Require a PIN for new devices to initiate pairing
SettingDetails.requirePasswordFromIdleDescription: Force user to input password every time the device returns from an idle state.
SettingDetails.requirePasswordFromIdleName: Require password when device returns from idle state (Mobile and Holographic)
SettingDetails.requireRecentSSPHeartbeatDescription: Default policy. The Company Portal must be opened to report its jailbreak status to Intune at least once every 72 hours to be compliant.
SettingDetails.requireRemainContactDescription: Default policy. Device must regularly contact Intune to be considered compliant.
SettingDetails.requireSMIMEDescription: To enable S/MIME, a certificate is required.
SettingDetails.requireSSLDescription: Enable SSL to help secure all communications with the email server.
SettingDetails.requireSSPLocationServicesDescription: Default policy. The user must allow the company portal to use location services to be compliant.
SettingDetails.requireSSPLocationServicesName: Location services in the Company Portal
SettingDetails.requireSiriProfanityFilterDescription: Prevents Siri from dictating, or speaking profane language. Available with iOS 11.0 or later. This setting isn't available if you block Siri.
SettingDetails.requireUpToDateSecurityProvidersDescript: An up-to-date security provider can protect a device from known vulnerabilities.
SettingDetails.requireUserExistanceDescription: Default policy. The user must exist and have a valid Intune license.
SettingDetails.requiredAndroidPlayIntegrityVerdictEvalu: Select the evaluation type you want to use to compute the Play Integrity Verdict device attestation response.
Check strong integrity using hardware-backed security features
SettingDetails.requiredPasswordTypeDescription: Specify the type of password required.
SettingDetails.requiredPasswordUnlockDailyOption: 24 hours since last PIN, password, or pattern unlock
SettingDetails.resourcePathDescription: If your path isn't ipp/print, see the learn more link on this page for help.
SettingDetails.restartWarningsOnlyOption: Turn off all notifications, excluding restart warnings
SettingDetails.restrictAppDataToSystemVolume: Install app data on system volume
SettingDetails.restrictAppDataToSystemVolumeDescription: Specifies that app data can only be stored on the system disk volume.
SettingDetails.restrictAppInstallToSystemVolumeDescript: Specifies that apps can only be stored on the system disk drive.
SettingDetails.restrictPeerSelectionByDescription: Restricts peer selection via the selected option. Applies to Download Modes NAT (1) and Group (2).​
SettingDetails.restrictedAppsHelpDescription: Add bundle IDs for apps that should be restricted. A device that has at least one app installed which is found on the restricted apps list will be marked as non-compliant.
SettingDetails.restrictedAppsListOptionsDescription: Device compliance can be viewed in the Restricted Apps Compliance report.
SettingDetails.restrictedSitesSecurityLevelDescription: Enforce high security for restricted sites.
SettingDetails.revokeEncryptionKeysOnUnEnrollDescriptio: Revoke encryption keys when device is unenrolled (Yes recommended).
SettingDetails.revokeEncryptionKeysOnUnEnrollName: Revoke encryption keys when device is unenrolled
SettingDetails.roleAndRealmDescription: Role and realm value pairs, as required by vendor.
SettingDetails.ruleNameDescription: Name of rule - use a name that makes sense to you, to help order large numbers of rules
SettingDetails.sCCMComplianceState: Require device compliance from Configuration Manager
SettingDetails.sCCMComplianceStateDescription: Requires all compliance evaluations in Configuration Manager to be compliant. This is only applicable for co-managed devices running Windows 10 or later. All Intune-only devices will return N/A.
SettingDetails.sCEPPolicyCertificateValidityPeriodDescr: The amount of time remaining before the certificate expires. Enter a value that is equal to or lower than the validity period shown in the certificate template. Default is set at one year.
SettingDetails.sCEPPolicyCustomSubjectAlternativeNameFo: Value can include allowed variables combined with static text. UPN and Email address should include an @, for example: “{{AAD_Device_ID}}@contoso.com”. DNS cannot end with a symbol or contain an @ sign, e.g. “{{DeviceName}}.contoso.com“ or “{{DeviceName}}”. See support variables here: http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=2027630
Value can include allowed variables, for example: “{{UserPrincipalName}}” or “{{EmailAddress}}” . See support variables here: http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=2027630
SettingDetails.sCEPPolicyEnrollToPassport: Enroll to Windows Hello for Business, otherwise fail (Windows 10 and later)
SettingDetails.sCEPPolicyEnrollToTrustedOtherwiseFail: Enroll to Trusted Platform Module (TPM) KSP, otherwise fail
SettingDetails.sCEPPolicyEnrollToTrustedOtherwiseKSP: Enroll to Trusted Platform Module (TPM) KSP if present, otherwise Software KSP
SettingDetails.sCEPPolicyExtendedKeyUsageAnyPurposeClou: WARNING: Neither the Any Purpose EKU (OID 2.5.29.37.0) nor the Any App Policy EKU (OID 1.3.6.1.4.1.311.10.12.1) can be used with a certification authority created in Microsoft Cloud PKI.
SettingDetails.sCEPPolicyExtendedKeyUsageDescription: In most cases, the certificate requires at least Client Authentication so that the user or device can authenticate to a server. However, you can specify additional usages to further define the purpose of the key.
