SettingDetails.sCEPPolicyHashAlgorithmDescription: Use a hash algorithm type with the certificate. Make sure to select the strongest level of security that the connecting devices support.
SettingDetails.sCEPPolicyKeySizeDescription: Select the number of bits contained in the key.  2048 is the recommended minimum key length.
SettingDetails.sCEPPolicyKeyStorageProviderDescription: Select where you want to store the certificate’s key.
SettingDetails.sCEPPolicyKeyUsageDescription: Specify the cryptographic action that is required to exchange the certificate’s public key.
SettingDetails.sCEPPolicyObjectIdentifierColumnDescript: Object Identifier for EKU (Extended Key Usage)
SettingDetails.sCEPPolicyRenewalThresholdDescription: Enter the percentage (between 1 and 99 percent) of remaining certificate lifetime that is allowed before a device can request renewal of the certificate. The recommended amount in Intune is 20%.
SettingDetails.sCEPPolicySelectRootCertificateDescripti: Choose a previously configured and assigned root CA certificate profile. The CA certificate must match the root certificate of the CA that is issuing the certificate for this profile (the one you are currently configuring).
SettingDetails.sCEPPolicyServerURLSDescription: Add one or more URLs for the NDES Server that issues certificates through SCEP.
SettingDetails.sCEPPolicySubjectNameFormatCnAsAadDevice: Common name as Microsoft Entra identifier
SettingDetails.sCEPPolicySubjectNameFormatDescription: Select how Intune automatically creates the subject name in the certificate request. If the certificate is for a user, you can also include the user's email address in the subject name.
SettingDetails.sCEPPolicySubjectNameFormatHelp: Please review subject name documentation on how to best use the Subject name format field.
SettingDetails.sMIMEEncryptByDefaultDescription: Select whether or not all messages are encrypted by default.
SettingDetails.sMIMEEncryptByDefaultUserOverrideableDes: Select whether or not users can change the encrypt by default option.  Available in iOS 12+.
SettingDetails.sMIMEEncryptionCertificateUUIDUserOverri: Select whether or not users can change the S/MIME encryption certificate.  Available in iOS 12+.
SettingDetails.sMIMESigningCertificateUUIDUserOverridea: Select whether or not a user can change their S/MIME signing certificate.  Available in iOS 12+.
SettingDetails.sMIMESigningEnabledDescription: Select whether or not to enable S/MIME signing for this account.
SettingDetails.sMIMESigningUserOverrideableDescription: Select whether or not a user can change the S/MIME signing setting.  Available in iOS 12+.
SettingDetails.sModeProfileHeader: Once a device has been switched out of S mode, it can only be put back into S mode by factory re-setting the device.
SettingDetails.sModeProfileLearnMore: Learn more about Windows S mode.
SettingDetails.sSIDOrDNSName: SSIDs containing any of the following
SettingDetails.sSOAllowedAppsListDescription: The app bundle IDs of the apps on users’ devices that are allowed to use SSO. If this field is omitted, the login applies to all apps on the device. * wildcard characters may only be used with iOS 9.0 and later.
SettingDetails.sSOAllowedUrlsDescription: The list of URL prefixes that must be matched in order to use this account for Kerberos authentication over HTTP. The URL must begin with either http:// or https://.
SettingDetails.sSOPrincipalNameDescription: Select the Kerberos principal name. If not selected, the user is prompted for a principal name during MDM profile installation.
SettingDetails.sSORealmDescription: A Kerberos realm name. This value must be properly capitalized.
SettingDetails.safeSearchFilterDescription: Specify how Cortana filters adult content from search results.
SettingDetails.sampleSharingEnableOrNotConfiguredDescri: Returns or sets the Microsoft Defender for Endpoint Sample Sharing configuration parameter.
SettingDetails.scanFilesOpenedFromNetworkFoldersName: Scan files opened from network folders
SettingDetails.scanMappedNetworkDrivesDuringFullScanNam: Scan mapped network drives during a full scan
SettingDetails.scanRemovableDrivesDuringFullScanDescrip: Allows Microsoft Defender to scan for malicious and unwanted software in removable drives (e.g. flash drives) during a full scan. Microsoft Defender Antivirus scans all files on USB devices before execution.
SettingDetails.scanRemovableDrivesDuringFullScanName: Scan removable drives during a full scan
SettingDetails.scheduleImminentRestartWarningInMinutesD: Specify the period for auto-restart imminent warning notifications. Allowed values: 15, 30 or 60.
SettingDetails.scheduleImminentRestartWarningInMinutesN: Remind user prior to required auto-restart with permanent reminder (minutes)
SettingDetails.scheduleImminentRestartWarningValidation: Must be one of the following: 15, 30, 60.
SettingDetails.scheduleRestartWarningInHoursDescription: Specify the period for auto-restart warning reminder notifications. Allowed values: 2, 4, 8, 12 or 24.
SettingDetails.scheduleRestartWarningInHoursName: Remind user prior to required auto-restart with dismissible reminder (hours)
SettingDetails.scheduleRestartWarningValidationMessage: Must be one of the following: 2, 4, 8, 12, 24.
SettingDetails.scriptScanningName: Scan scripts loaded in Microsoft web browsers
SettingDetails.searchBlockDiacriticsDescription: Specify if search can use diacritics.
SettingDetails.searchBlockWebResultsDescription: This setting allows you to control whether or not Windows Search can perform queries on the web, and whether web results are displayed in Search. If you block this setting, queries will not be performed on the web and web results will not be displayed when a user performs a query in Search.
SettingDetails.searchDisableAutoLanguageDetectionDescri: Specify whether to use automatic language detection when indexing content and properties.
SettingDetails.searchDisableIndexerBackoffDescription: Disables the search indexer backoff feature. Indexing will continue at full speed even if system activity is high.
SettingDetails.searchDisableIndexingEncryptedItemsDescr: Block indexing of WIP-protected items to prevent them from appearing in search results for Cortana or Explorer.
SettingDetails.searchDisableIndexingEncryptedItemsName: Indexing of encrypted stores and items
SettingDetails.searchDisableIndexingRemovableDriveDescr: Prevent indexing of locations on removable drives. In addition, removable drives cannot be added to libraries.
SettingDetails.searchDisableUseLocationDescription: Specify if search can use location information
SettingDetails.searchDomainsDescription: Search domains are part of the advanced DNS settings of a network connection service (such as Wi-Fi or Ethernet).
SettingDetails.searchDomainsDescriptionWithHint: Search domains are part of the advanced DNS settings of a network connection service (such as Wi-Fi or Ethernet). To establish a VPN connection when a specific web domain is accessed, create an ‘Evaluate each connection attempt -> Connect if needed’ rule.
SettingDetails.searchEnableAutomaticIndexSizeManangemen:
When not configured, automatic indexing is off when the remaining hard disk space is 600MB or less.
If the setting is enabled automatic indexing will continue even when there is low disk space.
SettingDetails.searchEnableRemoteQueriesDescription: Enable remote queries of this computer's index.
SettingDetails.secondaryAuthenticationMethodTEAPDescrip: Choose the secondary way you want users to authenticate. When you select Certificates, select one of the certificate profiles (SCEP or PKCS) that is also deployed to the device. This is the identity certificate that is presented by the device to the server.
SettingDetails.securityAssociationIdleTimeDescription: Security associations are deleted after network traffic is not seen for this number of seconds.
SettingDetails.securityAssociationIdleTimeName: Security association idle time before deletion
SettingDetails.securityBlockAzureADJoinedDevicesAutoEnc: Prevent automatic device encryption during first use, when the device is Microsoft Entra joined
SettingDetails.securityCommonCriteriaModeDescription: This setting enables an elevated set of security standards on the device most often used in highly sensitive organizations, such as government establishments. Not configured by default.
SettingDetails.securityLogsTitle: Allow this app to access Android security logs
SettingDetails.securityRequireVerifyAppsDescription: Enable Google Play Protect to scan apps before and after they’re installed. If it detects a threat, it might warn the user to remove the app from the device. Required by default.
SettingDetails.selectATypeOfAutomaticVPNOption: Select a type of automatic VPN
SettingDetails.selectCertificateProfiles: Select one or more certificate profiles
SettingDetails.selectNetworkApp: Select an app to access Android network activity logs
SettingDetails.selectSecurityApp: Select an app to access Android security logs
SettingDetails.selectService: Which management type can we help you with?
SettingDetails.selectTimesToPreventUpdateInstallationsN: Select times to prevent update installations:
SettingDetails.semiAnnualChannelTargetedDeprecated: If you're using Microsoft Update for Business to deploy Windows 10, version 1903 and later, or Windows 11, your update options have changed. Updates will be delivered over the same channels, with the exception of Semi-Annual Channel (Targeted), which will no longer exist. Before you continue, go to the Intune documentation to learn more about these changes and how they affect your previously configured update ring.
SettingDetails.sendDoNotTrackHeaderDescription: Websites are allowed to track users. Select Yes, to send do-not-track headers to websites requesting tracking info.
SettingDetails.sendDoNotTrackHeaderV2Description: Do-not-track headers are sent to websites requesting tracking info. Select No, to allow websites to track the user.
SettingDetails.serverCertificateIssuerCommonDescription: Enter the server certificate’s common name only if it’s different than the remote identifier. The remote identifier will be used by default if no common name is specified.​
SettingDetails.serverCertificateIssuerCommonNameRequire: Server Certificate Issuer Common Name is required if Certificate Type is specified and Client Authentication is User Authentication.
SettingDetails.servicingBranchDescription: Set the channel from which devices will receive their updates.
SettingDetails.settingsBlockAddProvisioningPackageDesc: Specifies whether to block the runtime configuration agent to install provisioning packages.
SettingDetails.settingsBlockChangeLanguageDesc: Blocks the user from changing the language settings.
SettingDetails.settingsBlockChangePowerSleepDesc: Blocks the user from changing the power and sleep settings.
SettingDetails.settingsBlockChangePowerSleepName: Power and sleep settings modification (desktop only)
SettingDetails.settingsBlockChangeRegionDesc: Blocks the user from changing the region settings.
SettingDetails.settingsBlockChangeSystemTimeDesc: Blocks the user from changing the date and time settings.
SettingDetails.settingsBlockEditDeviceNameDesc: Blocks the user from editing the device name.
SettingDetails.settingsBlockMyMeetingsAndFilesDescripti: Blocks the "My meetings and files" feature in the Start menu, which shows the signed-in user's meetings and files from Office 365.
SettingDetails.settingsBlockRemoveProvisioningPackageDe: Specifies whether to block the runtime configuration agent to remove provisioning packages.
SettingDetails.settingsBlockSessionResumeDescription: Specify whether users can choose to resume a session when the session times out.
SettingDetails.settingsBlockSigninSuggestionsDescriptio: Disables auto-filling the sign-in dialog with invitees from scheduled meetings.
SettingDetails.settingsDefaultVolumeDescription: Default volume value for a new session. Range of values: 0-100.
SettingDetails.settingsScreenTimeoutInMinutesDescriptio: Specify the number of minutes until the Hub screen turns off.
SettingDetails.settingsSessionTimeoutInMinutesDescripti: Specify the number of minutes until the session times out.
SettingDetails.settingsSleepTimeoutInMinutesDescription: Specify the number of minutes until the Hub enters sleep mode.
SettingDetails.sharedDeviceBlockTemporarySessionsDescri: A temporary session allows a Shared iPad user to sign in with a guest account, which doesn't require a Managed Apple ID or password. Anyone can unlock and use the iPad during a temporary session. None of the user’s data is saved or synced to iCloud after they sign out. Available in iOS/iPadOS 13.4 and later.
SettingDetails.shieldedDescription: If this setting and the firewall setting are both enabled, all incoming traffic will be blocked.
SettingDetails.shortSupportMessageDefault: You do not have permission for this action. For more information, contact your IT admin.
SettingDetails.shortSupportMessageDescription: A short support message is text shown to the end user by the platform when they try to configure a managed setting on the device. The "All except when specified" Language message is shown if a custom message is not specified for a device's default language.
SettingDetails.showEverything: Organizer, time, and subject (subject hidden for private meetings)
SettingDetails.showWorkContactsInPersonalProfileDescrip: This setting controls whether or not users can search work contacts and view work contact caller-id in the personal profile.
SettingDetails.showWorkContactsInPersonalProfileName: Search work contacts and display work contact caller-id in personal profile.
SettingDetails.silentCertAccessMaxAppsWarn: Select a maximum of 50 apps to grant silent certificate access to
SettingDetails.silentCertAccessMinAppsWarn: Select at least one app to grant silent certificate access to
SettingDetails.silentCertAccessSpecificApps: Grant silently for specific apps (require user approval for other apps)
SettingDetails.silentCertAccessTypeDescription: Choose how certificate access is granted to applications
SettingDetails.silentCertAccessUserApproval: Require user approval for all apps
SettingDetails.simpleDownloadOption: Simple download mode with no peering (99)
SettingDetails.singleAppModeBundleIdsDescription: Enter the Bundle ID of the app.
SettingDetails.singleSignOnExtensionActiveDirectorySite: The name of the site that the app extension uses. The app extension can normally detect the site location automatically.
SettingDetails.singleSignOnExtensionBlockActiveDirector: If blocked, the Kerberos extension doesn’t automatically use LDAP and DNS to determine its Active Directory site name.
SettingDetails.singleSignOnExtensionBlockAutomaticLogin: If blocked, passwords are not allowed to be saved to the keychain. The user will not be prompted to save the password and will need to re-enter it when the Kerberos ticket expires.
SettingDetails.singleSignOnExtensionBundleIdAccessContr: Additional App IDs of the apps you would like to use the Microsoft Entra single sign-on extension. This setting gives these additional apps permission to use the SSO extension if they do not use any Microsoft libraries. The experience may not be as seamless as if the apps used Microsoft libraries. Older apps that use SAML authentication or do not use the newest Microsoft libraries will need to be added to this list to work properly with the SSO extension.
SettingDetails.singleSignOnExtensionCacheNameDescriptio: The Generic Security Service name of the Kerberos cache to use. Rarely set by administrators.
SettingDetails.singleSignOnExtensionConfigurationsDescr: Additional extension-specific data to pass to the app extension.
SettingDetails.singleSignOnExtensionConfigurationsValid: Use 'true' or 'false' for the configuration value when the value type is boolean (case insensitive). Use a number when the value type is integer.
SettingDetails.singleSignOnExtensionCredentialBundleIdA: The bundle IDs of the apps that are allowed to access the Kerberos ticket granting ticket (TGT).
SettingDetails.singleSignOnExtensionCredentialsCacheMon: When set to "Yes", the credential is requested on the next matching Kerberos challenge or network state change. When the credential is expired or missing, a new credential is created. Available for devices running macOS versions 12 and later.​
SettingDetails.singleSignOnExtensionDomainRealmsDescrip: Create a custom domain-realm mapping for Kerberos. This is used when the DNS names of hosts do not match the realm name. Most administrators do not need to customize this.
SettingDetails.singleSignOnExtensionDomainsDescription: The domain or host names that can authenticate through SSO. Matched case-insensitively and all domain/host names of all installed SSO app extension profiles must be unique.
SettingDetails.singleSignOnExtensionEnableSharedDeviceM: Configure this setting if these devices will be shared amongst multiple employees or students. This setting will change how your device works with applications. Do not use this setting unless you understand the consequences of Shared Device mode. Data loss and device misconfiguration requiring device reset can occur. Learn more about Shared Device mode.
SettingDetails.singleSignOnExtensionExtensionIdentifier: Bundle ID of the app extension that performs SSO.
SettingDetails.singleSignOnExtensionIsDefaultRealmDescr: Necessary if you’re configuring multiple Kerberos extensions in your organization.
SettingDetails.singleSignOnExtensionKerberosAppsInBundl: When set to "Yes", the Kerberos extension allows any apps entered with the app bundle ID, managed apps, and standard Kerberos utilities, such as TicketViewer and klist, to access and use the credential. Available for devices running macOS versions 12 and later.
SettingDetails.singleSignOnExtensionKerberosRealmDescri: Kerberos authentication realm name. Ensures appropriate routing and authentication during sign-in. Case sensitive and should be properly capitalized. If in an Active Directory forest, this is the realm where the user logs in.
SettingDetails.singleSignOnExtensionManagedAppsInBundle: When set to "Yes", the Kerberos extension allows managed apps, and any apps entered with the app bundle ID to access the credential. Available for devices running macOS versions 12 and later.
SettingDetails.singleSignOnExtensionModeCredentialUsedD: Select how other processes use the Kerberos Extension credential. If the SPN is listed in Domains, "Always" allows other processes to use the extension credential. When set to "When not specified", other processes use the credential only when another credential isn’t entered by the caller, and the SPN is listed in Domains. "Kerberos default" uses the default Kerberos processes for selecting credentials. Available for devices running macOS versions 11 and later.​
SettingDetails.singleSignOnExtensionPasswordBlockModifi: If blocked, users can’t change the password they use to sign in to your org’s apps and websites that support Kerberos authentication.
SettingDetails.singleSignOnExtensionPasswordChangeUrlDe: Configure the Kerberos SSO extension to open a password change website in the default browser when the user selects "Change password" or acknowledges a password expiration notice. Use this feature only when using a local account, as mobile accounts are not supported.
SettingDetails.singleSignOnExtensionPasswordEnableLocal: If enabled, the Kerberos SSO extension will set the local account password to match the user’s Active Directory password. When the user uses the extension to change passwords, this feature will set their local password to match their AD password. Should the local and AD passwords fall out of sync, the extension brings them back in sync.
SettingDetails.singleSignOnExtensionPasswordExpirationD: The number of days that a password can be used before the domain requires the user to change it. Most domains enforce a number already.
SettingDetails.singleSignOnExtensionPasswordExpirationN: Number of days prior to password expiration that users get notified their password will expire.
SettingDetails.singleSignOnExtensionPasswordMinimumAgeD: Number of days that a password must be used before the user can change it.
SettingDetails.singleSignOnExtensionPasswordMinimumLeng: The least number of characters that can make up a user’s password.
SettingDetails.singleSignOnExtensionPasswordPreviousPas: The number of prior passwords that cannot be reused on the domain.
SettingDetails.singleSignOnExtensionPasswordRequireActi: The Active Directory complexity requirements ensure that users create strong passwords. Requirements are enforced when creating or changing a password.
SettingDetails.singleSignOnExtensionPasswordRequirement: A text version of your organization's password requirements to show to users. Only appears if you don't require Active Directory's complexity requirements, or if you didn't specify a minimum password length.
SettingDetails.singleSignOnExtensionPkinitCertificateDe: Select the Public Key Cryptography for Initial Authentication (PKINIT) certificate to be deployed to the device. Used to reauthenticate the user’s Kerberos credential without any need for user intervention when the user’s SSO session expires.
SettingDetails.singleSignOnExtensionPreferredKDCsDescri: Creates an ordered list of preferred Key Distribution Centers (KDCs) to use for Kerberos traffic. This list is used when the servers are not discoverable using DNS. When the servers are discoverable, the list is used for both connectivity checks, and used first for Kerberos traffic. If the servers don’t respond, then the device uses DNS discovery. Available for devices running macOS versions 12 and later.​​
SettingDetails.singleSignOnExtensionRealmDescription: Authentication realm name. Ensures appropriate routing and authentication during remote sign-in. Case sensitive and should be properly capitalized.
SettingDetails.singleSignOnExtensionRequireUserPresence: Require users to provide Touch ID, Face ID, or device passcode when the credential is needed to refresh the Kerberos ticket. If automatic login is blocked, this setting is not applicable.
Require Face ID, Touch ID, or passcode
SettingDetails.singleSignOnExtensionSharedDeviceModeWar: If you enable shared device mode, all existing user accounts will be wiped from the targeted devices. Make sure you understand how this setting will change your devices so that you can avoid data loss or factory reset. Learn more.​
SettingDetails.singleSignOnExtensionSignInHelpTextDescr: Text displayed to the user at the Kerberos sign in window. Available for devices running macOS versions 11 and later.
SettingDetails.singleSignOnExtensionTLSForLDAPRequiredD: When set to "Yes", LDAP connections are required to use Transport Layer Security (TLS). Available for devices running macOS versions 11 and later.
SettingDetails.singleSignOnExtensionTeamIdentifierDescr: Team ID of the app extension that performs SSO.
SettingDetails.singleSignOnExtensionTypeDescription: Perform SSO with one of these extension types.
SettingDetails.singleSignOnExtensionUrlsDescription: The URLs where your identity provider can be reached. When a user is redirected to these URLs, the SSO app extension will intervene and prompt SSO. Each URL must be unique and can’t already exist in another profile. Must use HTTP or HTTPS protocols.
SettingDetails.singleSignOnExtensionUserPrincipalNameDe: The username of the Kerberos principal. You do not need to include the realm and you can use variables in the principal name by entering curly brackets {{ }}. For example to show the username, enter {{username}}.
SettingDetails.singleSignOnExtensionUserSetupDelayedDes: When set to "Yes", the user isn’t prompted to set up the Kerberos extension until the extension is enabled by the admin, or a Kerberos challenge is received. Available for devices running macOS versions 11 and later.
SettingDetails.singleSignOnExtensionUsernameLabelCustom: This label replaces the user name shown in the Kerberos extension. You can enter a name to match the name of your company or organization. Available for devices running macOS versions 11 and later.
SettingDetails.skipChecksBeforeRestartDescription: Configures the SetEDURestart policy, which is not recommended except in special conditions. See documentation for more details.
SettingDetails.skipChecksBeforeRestartTextBox: The Restart checks (EDU Restart) setting is being deprecated from Update Ring policies. You can still configure these using Settings Catalog an configuring the Set EDU Restart setting.
SettingDetails.smartScreenAppInstallControlDescription:
This setting determines the user experience when they attempt to install apps from places other than the Microsoft Store. Configuring a device with a setting that isn’t supported on that device’s build is the same as not configuring the setting.

Not configured: Users are able to install apps as defined by other policy settings. (RS3+)

Recommend store if available: When installing an app from the web that is available in the Microsoft Store, users will see a message recommending they download it from the store. (RS5+)

Warn when installing outside store: When installing an app from outside the Microsoft Store, users will see a warning advising them that files downloaded outside the store may not be safe. (RS5+)

App store only: Only permit app installations from the Microsoft Store. (RS3+)
SettingDetails.smartScreenBlockOverrideForFilesDescript: Block user from running unverified files.
SettingDetails.smartScreenEnableInShellDescription: Enable SmartScreen for file execution and running apps.
SettingDetails.smartScreenPromptOverrideDescription: Block users from ignoring the Microsoft Defender SmartScreen Filter warnings and block them from going to the site.
SettingDetails.smartScreenPromptOverrideForFilesDescrip: Block users from ignoring the Microsoft Defender SmartScreen Filter warnings and block them from downloading unverified files.
SettingDetails.softwareUpdateMajorOSDeferredInstallDela: Specify the number of days (1-90) to delay visibility of major OS software updates. This value takes precedence over the default visibility value. Available for devices running macOS versions 11.3 and later.
Delay visibility of major OS software updates
SettingDetails.softwareUpdateMinorOSDeferredInstallDela: Specify the number of days (1-90) to delay visibility of minor OS software updates. This value takes precedence over the default visibility value. Available for devices running macOS versions 11.3 and later.
Delay visibility of minor OS software updates
SettingDetails.softwareUpdateNonOSDeferredInstallDelayD: Specify the number of days (1-90) to delay visibility of non-OS software updates (such as Safari updates). This value takes precedence over the default visibility value. Available for devices running macOS versions 11.3 and later.
SettingDetails.softwareUpdateNonOSDeferredInstallDelayN: Delay visibility of non-OS software updates
SettingDetails.ssoCredentialRenewalCertificateDescripti: Select the certificate used to reauthenticate the user’s Kerberos credential without any need for intervention when the user’s SSO session expires.
SettingDetails.startDateTimeTooltip: Specify the time for apps to be restarted
SettingDetails.startMenuPinnedFolderDocumentsDescriptio: Enforces the visibility (Show/Hide) of the Documents folder shortcut on the Start menu.
SettingDetails.startMenuPinnedFolderDownloadsDescriptio: Enforces the visibility (Show/Hide) of the Downloads folder shortcut on the Start menu.
SettingDetails.startMenuPinnedFolderFileExplorerDescrip: Enforces the visibility (Show/Hide) of the File Explorer folder shortcut on the Start menu.
SettingDetails.startMenuPinnedFolderHomeGroupDescriptio: Enforces the visibility (Show/Hide) of the HomeGroup folder shortcut on the Start menu.
SettingDetails.startMenuPinnedFolderMusicDescription: Enforces the visibility (Show/Hide) of the Music folder shortcut on the Start menu.
SettingDetails.startMenuPinnedFolderNetworkDescription: Enforces the visibility (Show/Hide) of the Network folder shortcut on the Start menu.
SettingDetails.startMenuPinnedFolderPersonalFolderDescr: Enforces the visibility (Show/Hide) of the Personal folder shortcut on the Start menu.
SettingDetails.startMenuPinnedFolderPicturesDescription: Enforces the visibility (Show/Hide) of the Pictures folder shortcut on the Start menu.
SettingDetails.startMenuPinnedFolderSettingsDescription: Enforces the visibility (Show/Hide) of the Settings folder shortcut on the Start menu.
SettingDetails.startMenuPinnedFolderVideosDescription: Enforces the visibility (Show/Hide) of the Videos folder shortcut on the Start menu.
SettingDetails.startPagesDescription: List of URLs that specify home pages for MDM-enrolled devices (Desktop only).
SettingDetails.startTimeDescription: Select the beginning of the interval to stop updates from installing.
SettingDetails.statusBarDisabledDescription: Block access to the status bar, including notifications and quick settings.
SettingDetails.stayOnPluggedModesDescription: The battery plugged in modes for which the device stays on.  When using this setting, it is recommended to clear the Time to lock screen setting so that the device doesn't lock itself while it stays on.
SettingDetails.stayOnPluggedModesName: Screen on while device plugged in
SettingDetails.stealthModeDescription: If not configured, the server operates in stealth mode. Firewall rules used to enforce stealth mode are specific to your implementation.
SettingDetails.storageBlockUsbFileTransferDescription: Block transfer of files over USB.
SettingDetails.stringProbeName: But only if this URL probe succeeds
SettingDetails.syncScheduleDescription: How often the device connects to the server to synchronize email.
SettingDetails.synchronizeDescription: Control how much email to store on the device and how often to connect to the server.
SettingDetails.systemExtensionTeamIdsMustBeUnique: The same team ID cannot be listed in both allowed team identifiers and allowed system extensions.
SettingDetails.systemInfoOnlyStatusBarOption: Show system information in device's status bar
SettingDetails.systemPageDescription: Block access to System in Settings app.
SettingDetails.systemScanName: Day and time to perform a full or quick scan
SettingDetails.systemTelemetryProxyServerDescription:
Specify the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) or IP address of a proxy server to forward Connected User Experiences and Telemetry requests, using a Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) connection. The format for this setting is server:port. If the named proxy fails, or if there is no proxy specified when this policy is enabled, the Connected User Experiences and Telemetry data will not be transmitted and will remain on the local device.​

Examples of formats:​
IPv4: 192.246.246.106:100​
IPv6: [2001:4898:4010:4013:95c1:a8b2:953c:c633]:100​
FQDN: www.contoso.com:345 ​
SettingDetails.systemUpdateFreezePeriodEndDateColumnDes: Set the end date (MM/DD) of the annually repeating freeze period. Ensure that this date is no more than 90 days later than the start date.
SettingDetails.systemUpdateFreezePeriodEndDateEmptyValu: Enter the end date for your freeze period (MM/DD)
SettingDetails.systemUpdateFreezePeriodStartDateColumnD: Set the start date (MM/DD) of the annually repeating freeze period. If setting multiple freeze periods, make sure this date is at least 60 days later than the previous freeze period's end date.
SettingDetails.systemUpdateFreezePeriodStartDateEmptyVa: Enter the start date for your freeze period (MM/DD)
SettingDetails.systemUpdateFreezePeriodsTableDescriptio: Configure an annually repeating time period where all incoming system updates and security patches are blocked for up to 90 days. This freezes the OS version running on the device. When a device's clock is outside the freeze period, it wil receive updates as defined by whatever update behavior is assigned to the device via policy. To set multiple freeze periods, ensure they are separated by at least 60 days.
SettingDetails.systemUpdateInstallDescription: When over-the-air updates are available for this device, they will be installed based on this policy.​
SettingDetails.systemUpdateOptionWindowEndTimeDescripti: End of the maintenance window in the device’s time zone.​
SettingDetails.systemUpdateOptionWindowStartTimeDescrip: Beginning of the maintenance window in the device’s time zone.​
SettingDetails.systemWindowsBlockedDescription: Disable window notifications such as toasts, incoming calls, outgoing calls, system alerts, and system errors.
SettingDetails.tLSMinMax: TLS minimum version must be less than or equal to TLS maximum version.
SettingDetails.tLSVersionRangeMaximumDescription: Enter a maximum TLS version of 1.0, 1.1, or 1.2. If left blank, a default value of 1.2 will be used.​
SettingDetails.tLSVersionRangeMinimumDescription: Enter a minimum TLS version of 1.0, 1.1, or 1.2. If left blank, a default value of 1.0 will be used.​
SettingDetails.takeATestWinCompatibilityInfoText: Local guest account sign-in can only be used on devices running Windows 10, version 1903 or later, or Windows 11.
SettingDetails.taskManagerBlockEndTaskDescription: This setting determines whether non-administrators can use Task Manager to end tasks. Learn more
SettingDetails.telemetryReportingEnableOrNotConfiguredD: Expedite Microsoft Defender for Endpoint telemetry reporting frequency.
SettingDetails.testDisplayNameDescription: The name of the local guest account used for testing. The name is displayed on the local guest account tile on the bottom-left of the device's sign-in screen. Students click the tile to launch the test.
SettingDetails.thirdPartySuggestionsDescription: Block third party content in Windows Spotlight
SettingDetails.timeAndLanguagePageDescription: Block access to Time and Language in Settings app.
SettingDetails.timeExtensionForFileScanDescription: Specify the maximum amount of time that Microsoft Defender Antivirus should block a file while waiting for a result from the cloud.The base amount is 10 seconds-any additional time specified here(up to 50 seconds) will be added to those 10 seconds. This amount is a theoretical maximum-in most cases the scan will take less time than the maximum. Extending the time allows the cloud to thoroughly investigate suspicious files.</br> We recommend you enable this setting and specify at least 20 additional seconds.
SettingDetails.timeExtensionForFileScanName: Time extension for file scanning by the cloud
SettingDetails.timeForDailyQuickScanName: Time to perform a daily quick scan
SettingDetails.timeToLockScreenDescription: Maximum time after which the device will lock.  Can disable screen lock as well so that it never times out.
SettingDetails.timeWindowDescription: A period of time during which updates will be made available for automatic installation.
SettingDetails.timeWindowSameStartEndDayTime: End day/time cannot be the same as the start day/time.
SettingDetails.timeZoneDescription: Select the time zone for the targeted devices.
SettingDetails.toggleConfigurationPkgDescription: Upload a signed configuration package that will be used to onboard the Microsoft Defender for Endpoint client
SettingDetails.toggleConfigurationPkgName: Microsoft Defender for Endpoint client configuration package type:
SettingDetails.trafficRuleDirectionDescription: Inbound allows traffic from external sites over VPN. Outbound allows traffic to external sites over VPN. To allow both, create two rules.
SettingDetails.trafficRuleRoutingPolicyTypeDescription:
Choose between split tunnel and force tunnel.

Split tunnel = only the traffic meant for the VPN interface (as determined by the networking stack) goes over the interface. Internet traffic can continue to go over other interfaces.

Force tunnel = all IP traffic must go through the VPN interface only (for this traffic rule).

Applicable only when this rule is associated with an app.
SettingDetails.trustDescription: Configure the certificate(s) that will be presented by the server when the client attempts to connect to the Wi-Fi network.
SettingDetails.trustedServerCertificateNamesDescription: This is the common name used in the certificates issued by your trusted certification authority (CA). If you provide this information, you can bypass the dynamic trust dialog that is displayed on end-users' devices when they connect to the Wi-Fi network.
SettingDetails.tunnelConfigurationToolTip: All IKEv2 settings will apply only to the chosen network interface on the device. Choose Cellular only if you’re deploying this to devices with the Wi-Fi interface disabled or removed.​
SettingDetails.typeOfSystemScanName: Type of system scan to perform
SettingDetails.unicastResponsesToMulticastBroadcastsDes: This setting blocks all unicast responses to multicast broadcast traffic.
SettingDetails.unmuteMicrophoneDisabledDescription: Block unmuting the microphone and adjusting the microphone volume.
SettingDetails.unpairedExternalBootToRecoveryAllowedDes: Available for devices running iOS and iPadOS versions 14.5 or later.
SettingDetails.unpairedExternalBootToRecoveryAllowedNam: Allow users to boot devices into recovery mode with unpaired devices
SettingDetails.unsupportedText: Intune in the Azure portal does not support this profile's device configurations.
SettingDetails.updateAndSecurityPageDescription: Block access to Update ​and Security in Settings app.
SettingDetails.updateDelayPolicyDescription:
If you defer software updates, newly released updates won't become visible to users until after the deferral period (which you'll configure in the next settings). Deferring software updates doesn't impact scheduled updates.

OS-related updates can be deferred on devices running macOS 10.13 or later; non OS-related updates (such as Safari updates) can be deferred on devices running macOS 11 or later.
SettingDetails.updateNotificationLevelDescription: Specifies what Windows Update notifications users see.
SettingDetails.updatesClassificationName: Minimum classification of updates to install automatically
SettingDetails.useDeadlineSettingsDescription: Allows user to use deadline settings
SettingDetails.useOAuthDescription: Specifies whether the connection should use OAuth for authentication.
SettingDetails.useWindows10ForcedUpdates: Force restart apps on update failure
SettingDetails.useWindows10ForcedUpdatesTooltip: To ensure apps are always up-to-date, use this setting to configure a recurring or one time date to restart apps whose update failed due to the app being in use.
SettingDetails.userAccountControlDescription: How is user notified about device changes (recommend Always notify).
SettingDetails.userApprovedAndAutomatedDeviceEnrollment: These settings work for devices that were enrolled in Intune with user approval, and for devices enrolled using Apple School Manager or Apple Business Manager with automated device enrollment (formerly DEP). This includes all supervised devices.
User approved and automated device enrollment
SettingDetails.userCustomDomainDescription: The value Intune uses for the user domain name that will be used by this profile e.g. contoso.com or contoso.
SettingDetails.userDomainAADAttributeDescription: The attribute Intune gets from Microsoft Entra ID to dynamically generate the user domain name that will be used by this profile e.g. contoso.com (full domain name) or contoso (NetBIOS name).
SettingDetails.userDomainAADAttributeLinkText: Learn more about Microsoft Entra attributes for email profiles.
SettingDetails.userDomainAADAttributeName: User domain name attribute from Microsoft Entra ID
SettingDetails.userNameTypeDescription: The attribute Intune gets from Microsoft Entra ID to dynamically generate the username that will be used by this profile e.g. MyName@contoso.com (UPN) or MyName (username).
SettingDetails.userNameTypeLinkText: Learn more about Microsoft Entra attributes for Email profiles.
SettingDetails.userNameTypeName: Username attribute from Microsoft Entra ID
SettingDetails.userPauseAccessDescription: An option in Windows Update that, when enabled, lets device users pause updates for a certain number of days.
SettingDetails.userRightsAccessCredentialManagerAsTrust: This user right is used by Credential Manager during Backup/Restore. Users' saved credentials might be compromised if this privilege is given to other entities.
Access Credential Manager as trusted caller
SettingDetails.userRightsActAsPartOfTheOperatingSystemD: This user right allows a process to impersonate any user without authentication.
SettingDetails.userRightsActAsPartOfTheOperatingSystemN: Act As Part Of The OS
SettingDetails.userRightsAddSidBladeTitleName: Add local users or groups by SID
SettingDetails.userRightsAddSidTableDescriptionDesc: Admin’s description of this local user or group.
SettingDetails.userRightsAddSidTableNameDesc: The name of this local user or group.
SettingDetails.userRightsAddSidTableSidDesc: The security identifier of this local user or group (e.g. *S-1-5-32-544).
SettingDetails.userRightsAllowAccessFromNetworkDesc: This user right determines which users and groups are allowed to connect to the computer over the network.
SettingDetails.userRightsAllowLocalLogOnDesc: This user right determines which users can log on to the computer.
SettingDetails.userRightsBackupFilesAndDirectoriesDesc: This user right determines which users can bypass file, directory, registry, and other persistent objects permissions when backing up files and directories.
SettingDetails.userRightsBlockAccessFromNetworkDesc: This user right determines which users are prevented from accessing a computer over the network.
SettingDetails.userRightsChangeSystemTimeDesc: This user right determines which users and groups can change the time and date on the internal clock of the computer.
SettingDetails.userRightsCreateGlobalObjectsDesc: This security setting determines whether users can create global objects that are available to all sessions. Users who can create global objects could affect processes that run under other users' sessions, which could lead to application failure or data corruption.
SettingDetails.userRightsCreatePageFileDesc: This user right determines which users and groups can call an internal API to create and change the size of a page file.
SettingDetails.userRightsCreatePermanentSharedObjectsDe: This user right determines which accounts can be used by processes to create a directory object using the object manager.
SettingDetails.userRightsCreateSymbolicLinksDesc: This user right determines if the user can create a symbolic link from the computer to which they are logged on.
SettingDetails.userRightsCreateTokenDesc: This user right determines which users/groups can be used by processes to create a token that can then be used to get access to any local resources when the process uses an internal API to create an access token.
SettingDetails.userRightsDebugProgramsDesc: This user right determines which users can attach a debugger to any process or to the kernel.
SettingDetails.userRightsDelegationDesc: This user right determines which users can set the Trusted for Delegation setting on a user or computer object.
SettingDetails.userRightsDenyLocalLogOnDesc: This security setting determines which service accounts are prevented from registering a process as a service.
SettingDetails.userRightsDenyLocalLogOnName: Deny log on as a service
SettingDetails.userRightsGenerateSecurityAuditsDesc: This user right determines which accounts can be used by a process to add entries to the security log. The security log is used to trace unauthorized system access.
SettingDetails.userRightsImpersonateClientDesc: Assigning this user right to a user allows programs running on behalf of that user to impersonate a client. Requiring this user right for this kind of impersonation prevents an unauthorized user from convincing a client to connect to a service that they have created and then impersonating that client, which can elevate the unauthorized user's permissions to administrative or system levels.
SettingDetails.userRightsIncreaseSchedulingPriorityDesc: This user right determines which accounts can use a process with Write Property access to another process to increase the execution priority assigned to the other process
SettingDetails.userRightsLoadUnloadDriversDesc: This user right determines which users can dynamically load and unload device drivers or other code in to kernel mode.
SettingDetails.userRightsLocalAccountAndMemberOfAdminis: Local account and member of Administrators group
SettingDetails.userRightsLockMemoryDesc: This user right determines which accounts can use a process to keep data in physical memory, which prevents the system from paging the data to virtual memory on disk.
SettingDetails.userRightsManageAuditingAndSecurityLogsD: This user right determines which users can specify object access auditing options for individual resources, such as files, Active Directory objects, and registry keys.
SettingDetails.userRightsManageVolumesDesc: This user right determines which users and groups can run maintenance tasks on a volume, such as remote defragmentation.
SettingDetails.userRightsModifyFirmwareEnvironmentDesc: This user right determines who can modify firmware environment values.
SettingDetails.userRightsModifyObjectLabelsDesc: This user right determines which user accounts can modify the integrity label of objects, such as files, registry keys, or processes owned by other users.
SettingDetails.userRightsProfileSingleProcessDesc: This user right determines which users can use performance monitoring tools to monitor the performance of system processes.
SettingDetails.userRightsRemoteDesktopServicesLogOnDesc: This user right determines which users and groups are prohibited from logging on as a Remote Desktop Services client.
SettingDetails.userRightsRemoteDesktopServicesLogOnName: Deny log on through Remote Desktop Services
SettingDetails.userRightsRemoteShutdownDesc: This user right determines which users are allowed to shut down a computer from a remote location on the network. Misuse of this user right can result in a denial of service.
SettingDetails.userRightsRestoreDataDesc: This user right determines which users can bypass file, directory, registry, and other persistent objects permissions when restoring backed up files and directories, and determines which users can set any valid security principal as the owner of an object.
SettingDetails.userRightsTakeOwnershipDesc: This user right determines which users can take ownership of any securable object in the system, including Active Directory objects, files and folders, printers, registry keys, processes, and threads.
SettingDetails.userRightsTakeOwnershipName: Take ownership of files or objects
SettingDetails.userToggleEnabledToolTip: Unless allowed, users can’t turn off always-on VPN.​ The default value for this setting is the most secure option.
SettingDetails.userWindowsUpdateScanAccessDescription: A button in Windows Update that, when enabled, lets device users check the update service for updates.
SettingDetails.userWindowsUpdateScanAccessName: Option to check for Windows updates
SettingDetails.vPNAppsDescription: When at least one app is selected, the VPN connection will be limited to the apps in the list.
SettingDetails.vPNAppsName: Select apps that would be allowed to use this VPN connection
SettingDetails.vPNAuthMethodDescription: Select how you want users to authenticate to the VPN server. Using certificate-based authentication provides enhanced capabilities such as zero-touch experience, on-demand VPN, and per-app VPN.
SettingDetails.vPNCitrixDataDescription: Enter key and value pairs for the Citrix VPN attributes.
SettingDetails.vPNCustomDataDescription: Enter key and value pairs for the custom VPN attributes.
SettingDetails.vPNDnsAutoTriggerDescription: Automatically connect to the VPN when the device connects to this domain​
SettingDetails.vPNDnsPersistentDescription: Keep this rule active even when the VPN is not connected: Select Enable to keep this rule in the Name Resolution Policy table (NRPT) until the rule is manually removed from the device, even after the VPN is disconnected. By default, NRPT rules in the VPN profile are removed from the device when the VPN is disconnected.
SettingDetails.vPNEAPXMLDescription: Enter the extensible authentication protocol (EAP) configuration in XML format.
SettingDetails.vPNEAPXMLHelpLinkDescription: Learn more about creating an EAP configuration for your VPN profile.
SettingDetails.vPNIKEv2RemoteIdentifierDescription: Specify the address of the IKEv2 server. This is usually the same value used in the IP address or FQDN field under Base VPN. The address must be a FQDN, UserFQDN, network address, or ASN1DN.
SettingDetails.vPNNetMotionMobilityCustomDataDescriptio: Enter key and value pairs for the NetMotion Mobility VPN attributes.
SettingDetails.vPNPerAppDescription: When users start using the selected apps, traffic will automatically route through the VPN connection if the connection is configured to be Always On or if the connection has been manually started by the user.
SettingDetails.vPNPolicyAddressDescription: Proxy server address (fully-qualified host, or IP address).
SettingDetails.vPNPolicyAssociatedAppsDescription: Apps added here will automatically start this VPN connection.
SettingDetails.vPNPolicyAssociatedDomainsUrlsDescriptio: Associated domains require additional setup outside of this VPN profile. Learn more.
SettingDetails.vPNPolicyAutomaticConfigurationScriptDes: URL to proxy automatic configuration file
SettingDetails.vPNPolicyBypassVPNOnCompanyWiFiDescripti: Bypass VPN when connected to company Wi-Fi network
SettingDetails.vPNPolicyBypassVPNOnCompanyWiFiName: Bypass VPN on company Wi-Fi network
SettingDetails.vPNPolicyBypassVPNOnHomeWiFiDescription: Bypass VPN when connected to home Wi-Fi network
SettingDetails.vPNPolicyBypassVPNOnHomeWiFiName: Bypass VPN on home Wi-Fi network
SettingDetails.vPNPolicyConnectionDescription: This is a descriptive name for the VPN connection and will be displayed to end-users on their device.
SettingDetails.vPNPolicyConnectionTypeDescription: This is the type of VPN server you use in your company. If your VPN vendor is not listed, select Custom VPN, then add your VPN identifier and any custom attributes that enable extra features like single sign-on.
SettingDetails.vPNPolicyConnectionTypeDescriptionNoCust: This is the type of VPN server you use in your company.
SettingDetails.vPNPolicyDNSNamesAndServersName: Domains and servers for this VPN connection
SettingDetails.vPNPolicyDNSRegistrationDescription: Allows registration of the VPN's address in the internal DNS.
SettingDetails.vPNPolicyDNSRegistrationName: Register IP addresses with internal DNS
SettingDetails.vPNPolicyDNSSuffixSearchListDescription: Specify DNS suffixes to add to the DNS search list to properly route short names. The first suffix in the list is also used as the primary connection-specific DNS suffix for the VPN interface.
SettingDetails.vPNPolicyDefaultServerDescription: Ensure exactly 1 server is selected as the default.
SettingDetails.vPNPolicyEnableAlwaysOnDescription: When Always On is enabled, a VPN connection will be automatically attempted when the user logs in, when the network the device is connected to changes, and on a mobile device when the screen is turned back on after being turned off.
SettingDetails.vPNPolicyEnableDeviceTunnelDescription: Enable connection without end-user interaction or logon. Only applies to PCs joined to Micosoft Entra ID.
SettingDetails.vPNPolicyExcludedDomainsUrlsDescription: A list of domains that can bypass the VPN when per-app VPN is activated. Applies to iOS 14 and later
SettingDetails.vPNPolicyNameResolutionPolicyTableRulesD: Name Resolution Policy table (NRPT) rules define how the DNS resolves names when connected to the VPN. Each row in the table specifies a domain and the DNS suffixes or web proxy server to use to resolve that domain.
SettingDetails.vPNPolicyNetworkTrafficRulesDescription:
Careful: By adding network rules, the VPN connection will be limited to only the rules specified.
     When adding traffic rules, make sure to add a catch-all rule that is least restrictive, to avoid VPN issues.
SettingDetails.vPNPolicyNetworkTrafficRulesName: Network traffic rules for this VPN connection
SettingDetails.vPNPolicyOnlyTheseAppsCanUseVPNDescripti: Restrict VPN connection to these apps (per-app VPN). Add associated apps BEFORE enabling this, as the list will become read-only after enabling. Traffic rules for apps in the table will automatically be added to the network traffic rules table when Enable is set.
SettingDetails.vPNPolicyOnlyTheseAppsCanUseVPNName: Restrict VPN connection to these apps
SettingDetails.vPNPolicyProfileScopeDescription: This is the scope for whether the VPN Profile will be per user, or per device
SettingDetails.vPNPolicyProfileScopeSelection: Use this VPN profile with a user/device scope
SettingDetails.vPNPolicyProfileTargetDescription: Turns this profile into an always-on VPN connection that connects without user interaction and uses machine certificates for authentication. Only supports an IKEv2 connection type. VPN profile is removed from the device after the AutoPilot out-of-box experience completes.
SettingDetails.vPNPolicyProfileTargetName: Use this VPN profile for Windows AutoPilot
SettingDetails.vPNPolicyProxyExclListCsvInvalid: File must be a comma-separated list comprising any combination of IP addresses in CIDR notation and properly formatted hostnames.
SettingDetails.vPNPolicyProxyExclListCsvToLarge: File must have fewer than 501 entries.
SettingDetails.vPNPolicyProxyExclListDescription1: List of hosts to exclude using the proxy on connections for. These hosts can use wildcards such as *.example.com.
SettingDetails.vPNPolicyProxyExclListDescription2: A list of host names for which the proxy is bypassed. The host names may contain wildcards such as *.example.com.
SettingDetails.vPNPolicyRoutesForThisConnectionName: Split tunneling routes for this VPN connection
SettingDetails.vPNPolicySafariUrlsDescription: URLs should be for a valid Safari domain. Example: contoso.com
SettingDetails.vPNPolicySafariUrlsName: Safari URLs that will trigger this VPN
SettingDetails.vPNPolicySelectAClientCertificateDescrip: A client authentication certificate is an Identity certificate.
SettingDetails.vPNPolicySendAllNetworkTrafficThroughVPN: Enable split tunneling if you only want certain web traffic to use the VPN tunnel. Disable this if you want all traffic to use the VPN tunnel when the VPN connection is active.
SettingDetails.vPNPolicyServerIPAddressOrFQDNDescriptio: This is the fully qualified domain name or IP address of your VPN server on the network. Make sure that end-users can access this network location.
SettingDetails.vPNPolicyServersDescription: List of VPN servers. Exactly one needs to be marked as the default server.
SettingDetails.vPNPolicyTrustedNetworkDomainDescription: Enter DNS suffixes used to determine if the device is connected to a trusted network. If any of them are reachable by the device, the device will not automatically connect to the VPN, even if there are auto-triggers set.
SettingDetails.vPNPolicyTrustedNetworkDomainMustBeUniqu: The trusted network domains list already contains this item.
SettingDetails.vPNPolicyUseProxyServerDescription: Proxy used when profile is active.
SettingDetails.vPNProxyDescription: Web proxy address for redirected intranet traffic.
SettingDetails.vPNProxyDescription1809: Web proxy server used to resolve the specified domain.
SettingDetails.vPNServerListExample: ServerDescription, IP Address or FQDN (e.g. Company-wide VPN, 10.0.0.1) (e.g. Apps-only VPN, vpn.contoso.com)
SettingDetails.vPNWipOrAppsDescription: Because WIP defines policies and app lists, additional network traffic rules are not required when WIP is selected, unless specifically needed.
SettingDetails.vPNWipOrAppsName: Associate WIP or apps with this VPN
SettingDetails.validTLSVersion: TLS Version must be one of the following values: 1.0, 1.1, 1.2
SettingDetails.validateFreezePeriodLength: Freeze period cannot be longer than 90 days.
SettingDetails.validateFreezePeriodSeparation: Freeze periods must be separated by at least 60 days.
SettingDetails.validateSingleSignOnMessage: Property Single sign-on (SSO) must be set to Disable when Authentication Mode is set to Machine or Guest.
SettingDetails.versionAndroid4: (This compliance check is supported for devices with OS versions Android 4.0 and above)
SettingDetails.versionAndroid4SamsungKStandard4: (This compliance check is supported for devices with OS versions Android 4.0 and above, or KNOX 4.0 and above)
SettingDetails.versionIOS8: (This compliance check is supported for devices with OS versions iOS 8.0 and above)
SettingDetails.versionWin10Desktop: (This compliance check is supported for desktop devices running Windows 10 or later)
SettingDetails.virtualHomeButtonDescription: Enable a soft-key button that returns users to the Managed Home Screen. Choose between a persistent, floating button or a button activated by a swipe-up gesture.
SettingDetails.visibleAppsListOptionsDescription: Set whether the list is a list of apps to hide or a list of apps to make visible.
SettingDetails.voicemailExceptionToolTip: Choose what happens with voicemail traffic when always-on VPN is enabled. The default value for this setting is the most secure option.
SettingDetails.vpnProviderTypeDesc: Choose app-proxy to tunnel traffic at the application layer. Choose packet-tunnel to tunnel traffic at the IP layer. Modern VPN clients for iOS devices require you to select packet-tunnel. Check the VPN client documentation to confirm requirements.
SettingDetails.vpnRoamingOverCellularName: VPN roaming over the cellular network
SettingDetails.wHfBEnhancedAntiSpoofingForFacialFeature: If enabled, devices will use enhanced anti-spoofing, when available. If not configured, the client configuration for anti-spoofing will be honored.
SettingDetails.wHfBPinExpirationInDaysDesc: If configured, the user will be forced to change their PIN after the set number of days. The user can still proactively change their PIN before expiration.
SettingDetails.wHfBPinLowercaseCharactersUsageDesc: If required, user PIN must include at least one lowercase letter.
SettingDetails.wHfBPinMaximumLengthDesc: Maximum PIN length must be between 4 and 127.
SettingDetails.wHfBPinMinimumLengthDesc: Minimum PIN length must be between 4 and 127.
SettingDetails.wHfBPinPreviousBlockCountDesc: If configured, the user will not be able to reuse this number of previous PINs.
SettingDetails.wHfBPinRecoveryEnabledDesc: Allows user to use the Windows Hello for Business PIN recovery service. If enabled, the PIN recovery secret will be stored on the device and the user can change their PIN if needed. If disabled or not configured, the recovery secret will not be created or stored.
SettingDetails.wHfBPinSpecialCharactersUsageDesc: If required, user PIN must include at least one special character.
SettingDetails.wHfBPinUppercaseCharactersUsageDesc: If required, user PIN must include at least one uppercase letter.
SettingDetails.wHfBSecurityDeviceRequiredDesc: A Trusted Platform Module (TPM) provides additional security benefits over software because data stored within it cannot be used on other devices. If you enable this policy setting, only devices with a usable TPM provision Windows Hello for Business. If you disable or do not configure this policy setting, the TPM is still preferred, but all devices provision Windows Hello for Business.
SettingDetails.wHfBUnlockWithBiometricsEnabledDesc: If allowed, Windows Hello for Business can authenticate using gestures, such as face and fingerprint. Users must still configure a PIN in case of failure.
SettingDetails.wHfBUseCertificatesForOnPremisesAuthEnab: If configured, Windows Hello for Business can use certificates to authenticate to on-premise resources.
SettingDetails.wHfBUseSecurityKeyForSigninDesc: Enable Windows Hello security key as a logon credential for all PCs in the tenant.
SettingDetails.wHfBWindowsHelloForBusinessBlockedDesc: Windows Hello for Business is an alternative method for signing into Windows by replacing passwords, Smart Cards, and Virtual Smart Cards. If you enable or do not configure this policy setting, the device provisions Windows Hello for Business.                        If you disable this policy setting, the device does not provision Windows Hello for Business for any user.
SettingDetails.wakeScreenWhenSomeoneInRoomName: Wake screen when someone is in room
SettingDetails.wallpaperDisplayLocationDescription: Wallpaper display Location. If you want to block users from changing the wallpaper, go to Device restrictions > General.
SettingDetails.wallpaperModificationBlockedMacDescripti: Yes prevents the wallpaper from being changed. Available for devices running macOS versions 10.13 or later.
SettingDetails.webBrowserCookiesAllowAll: Allow all cookies, and allow cross site tracking
SettingDetails.webBrowserCookiesPreventAndBlock: Block all cookies, and block cross site tracking
SettingDetails.webBrowserCookiesPreventCrossSite: Allow all cookies, and block cross site tracking
SettingDetails.webContentFilterTypeBlockAllUrlsHeaderNa: By selecting this option you block access to all URLs. User will not be able to access any website from their iOS device.
SettingDetails.webContentFilterTypeBlockedUrlsDescripti: Use this filtering system to only block URLs that you don’t want students to access. Any URL not in this list will be accessible by students.
SettingDetails.webContentFilterTypeBlockedUrlsTableDesc: Access to these URLs is blocked.
SettingDetails.webContentFilterTypeConfigureUrlsHeaderN: Use Apple’s built in AutoFilter algorithm that looks for adult language, i.e. swearing and sexually explicit language. This function evaluates each web page as it is loaded and attempts to identify and block content not suitable for children. If you have specific URLs that need to bypass Apple’s filtering algorithm, add them to Permitted URLs list. If you have specific URLs that need to be blocked regardless of Apple’s AutoFilter, add them to the Blocked URLs list.
SettingDetails.webContentFilterTypeDescription: The filtering mechanism that would be employed in determining whether a URL is accessible or not. You can choose to use Apple’s AutoFilter or specify the exact list of URLs or block all URLs.
SettingDetails.webContentFilterTypePermittedBookmarkUrl: For each URL provide the bookmark path to better organize the URLs. If no bookmark path provided, the bookmark is added to the default bookmark’s directory.
SettingDetails.webContentFilterTypePermittedUrlsDescrip: Use this filtering system to explicitly allow URLs that bypass the Apple’s built in AutoFilter. URLs added here will be allowed access even if they might get blocked by the Apple AutoFilter.
SettingDetails.webContentFilterTypePermittedUrlsHeaderN: These URLs are added to the browser’s bookmarks, and the user is not allowed to visit any sites other than these. This is the most stringent method of filtering web content – use this only if you know the exact list of URLs that can be accessed by users.
SettingDetails.webContentFilterTypePermittedUrlsLinkTex: Learn more about URLs added automatically in this filter type
SettingDetails.webContentFilterTypePermittedUrlsTableDe: Specifies the URLs that can be accessible regardless of the default automatic filtering rules set by Apple.
SettingDetails.webRtcBlockLocalhostIpAddressDescription: User's localhost IP address is displayed when making phone calls using the web RTC protocol. Select No, to hide.
SettingDetails.weeklyScheduleEndTimeDescription: Select the end time for the interval to allow or prevent updates. You cannot select end day and time that is the same as the start day and time.
SettingDetails.whatHappenedDescription: Intune in the Azure portal does not support this profile's configurations. Settings for this profile can only be viewed in the classic portal in Policy > Configuration Policies.
SettingDetails.wiFiForceOnlyConfiguredNetworksDescripti: Force the device to use only Wi-Fi networks set up through configuration profiles. Available for devices running iOS and iPadOS versions 14.4 or earlier. Devices running 14.5+ should use the setting, “Require devices to use Wi-Fi networks set up via configuration profiles."
SettingDetails.wiFiForceOnlyConfiguredNetworksName: Require joining Wi-Fi networks only using configuration profiles
SettingDetails.wiFiPolicyConnectAutomaticallyDescriptio: Choose Enable to automatically connect to this network when the device is in range. Choose Disable to prevent devices from automatically connecting to this network when the device is in range.
SettingDetails.wiFiPolicyConnectWhenNotBroadcastingDesc: Connect to this network, even when it is not broadcasting its SSID.
SettingDetails.wiFiPolicyProxySettingsDescription: Specify the proxy configuration used by your organization.
SettingDetails.wiFiPolicySSIDDescription: Service Set Identifier. The name of the Wi-Fi connection.
SettingDetails.wiFiPolicySecurityTypeDescription: Select the security protocol to use for authentication.
SettingDetails.wiFiScanIntervalDescription: How often devices scan for Wi-Fi networks. Supported values are 1-500, where 100 = normal frequency, and 500 = low frequency.
SettingDetails.wiFiToAllowedNetworksOnlyForcedDescripti: Available for devices running iOS and iPadOS versions 14.5 or later.
SettingDetails.wiFiToAllowedNetworksOnlyForcedName: Require devices to use Wi-Fi networks set up via configuration profiles
SettingDetails.wifiAccessPointConfigurationDescription: Block user creation or editing of any Wi-Fi configurations.
SettingDetails.wifiConfigDisabledDescription: Block user creation or editing of any Wi-Fi configurations.
SettingDetails.wifiConfigsLockdownEnabledDescription: Block changes to Wi-Fi configurations created by the device owner. Users can create their own Wi-Fi configurations.
SettingDetails.wifiPowerOnForcedDescription: Available for iOS/iPadOS 13.0 and later. Force Wi-Fi to always be turned on.
SettingDetails.win10AccountManagerConfigurationHeader: In organizations where multiple OS versions are supported, these settings may not apply across all versions the same. Account manager settings are the only settings applicable to HoloLens devices.
SettingDetails.win10AllowedWebsitesDescription: List of allowed URLs users can access. If you upload a list, make sure to include the default home page URL.
SettingDetails.win10AllowedWebsitesHeader: By default, users can access all websites from the Microsoft Kiosk Browser. To restrict access to a specific set of websites, upload a file with up to 500 URLs on separate lines. Then users will only have access to these URLs. Wildcard(*) characters are permitted.
SettingDetails.win10AppLockerApplicationControlTypeAudi: "Audit Only" mode logs all events in local client event logs, but does not block any apps from running
SettingDetails.win10AppLockerApplicationControlTypeDesc: Specifies the types of apps that can be trusted to run by application control code integrity policies
SettingDetails.win10AppLockerEnforcementTypeDescription: Choose the application control code integrity policies for your users' devices
SettingDetails.win10BlockedWebsiteExceptionsDescription: Specify URLs that kiosk browsers are allowed to navigate to. If a URL is in both the Blocked website list as well as the Blocked website exception list, the exception will take effect.
SettingDetails.win10BlockedWebsitesDescription: Block websites from user access in the kiosk browser app.
SettingDetails.win10DefaultPrivacyHeader: Define information that all apps on the device can access. You can define exceptions on a per-app basis using “Per-app privacy exceptions”.
SettingDetails.win10KioskAccessDownloadsFolderDescripti: Allow users to access downloads folder in Windows Explorer. Commonly used to access items downloaded from a browser.
SettingDetails.win10KioskBrowserDefaultWebsiteDescripti: Default webpage that opens when kiosk browser opens and restarts.
SettingDetails.win10KioskBrowserEnableEndSessionButtonD: End Session button clears all browsing data and navigates user back to the default home page URL.​
SettingDetails.win10KioskBrowserHeader: Configure the Kiosk Browser app. Before you begin, go to the Mobile Apps blade and make sure the Kiosk Browser app is assigned to your kiosk devices.
SettingDetails.win10KioskBrowserHomeButtonDescription: By default, home button is not configured.
SettingDetails.win10KioskBrowserNavigationButtonDescrip: Refers to the forward and back buttons users click to get from one page to another.
SettingDetails.win10KioskBrowserRestartAfterIdleTimeDes: Specifies when Kiosk Browser should restart. Determined by the idle time, which is the number of minutes since the user’s last interaction.
SettingDetails.win10LogonBlockFastUserSwitchingDesc: Disables the ability to quickly switch between users that are logged on simultaneously without logging off.
SettingDetails.win10PolicyOverrideHeader: Override Group Policy settings with Intune settings when there are conflicting settings.
SettingDetails.win10PolicyOverrideInstructions: This setting cannot be reset on a device until you unenroll the device from management in Intune.
SettingDetails.win10SharedGuestAccountDescription: Create a Guest option on the sign-in screen. Requires no user credentials or authentication, and creates a new local account each time it is used.
SettingDetails.win10SharedPCAccountDeletionDescription: Shared PC mode can be configured to delete accounts immediately at sign-out, when disk space is low, and when accounts are inactive for too long.
SettingDetails.win10SharedPCAccountDeletionDiskSpaceIna: At storage space threshold and inactive threshold
SettingDetails.win10SharedPCAccountDiskSpaceLeftBeforeD: Delete oldest accounts when free disk space drops below

Sets the percentage of disk space remaining on a PC before cached accounts will be deleted to free disk space. Accounts that have been inactive the longest will be deleted first. You can enter any number from 0 to 100 here.
SettingDetails.win10SharedPCAccountManagerDescription: When the account management service is turned on in shared PC mode, accounts are automatically deleted. Deletion applies to accounts in Active Directory and Microsoft Entra ID, and local accounts created by guests. Account management occurs automatically at sign-off time and during system maintenance time periods.
SettingDetails.win10SharedPCDaysBeforeInactive: Number of days an account is unused before it's considered inactive
SettingDetails.win10SharedPCDaysBeforeInactiveDescripti: Set number of days before account is inactive. You can enter any number from 1 to 365 here.
SettingDetails.win10SharedPCDiskLevelCachingDescription: Account manager stops deleting cached accounts as soon as total disk/storage space meets your configured threshold.
SettingDetails.win10SharedPCDiskLevelDeletionDescriptio: Account manager begins deleting cached accounts as soon as total disk/storage space drops below your configured threshold. It will continuously delete to reclaim disk space. Accounts that have been inactive the longest are deleted first.
SettingDetails.win10SharedPCDiskSpaceLeftCached: Stop account deletion when percentage storage/disk space is
SettingDetails.win10SharedPCDiskSpaceLeftCachedDescript: Sets the minimum percentage of available disk space a PC should have before it stops deleting cached accounts. You can enter any number from 0 to 100 here.
SettingDetails.win10SharedPCFastFirstSignInDescription: Allow auto connect of new non-admin Microsoft Entra accounts to the pre-configured candidate local accounts.
SettingDetails.win10SharedPCHeader: Configure access, account deletion, maintenance, and power management settings for your shared devices running Windows 10 or later used by multiple users in your organization.
SettingDetails.win10SharedPCInactiveThresholdDescriptio: The number of consecutive days after which an account that has not signed in is deleted.
SettingDetails.win10SharedPCLocalStorageDescription: With local storage, users can save and view files on the device's hard drive.
SettingDetails.win10SharedPCMaintenanceStartTime: Maintenance start time(in minutes from midnight)
SettingDetails.win10SharedPCMaintenanceStartTimeDescrip: The time when automatic maintenance tasks, such as Windows Update, run. The default start time is midnight, or zero minutes. You can adjust the start time in this setting by entering a new start time in minutes from midnight. For example, if you want maintenance to begin at 2 AM, enter 120 as the value.
SettingDetails.win10SharedPCMaintenanceStartTimeEmpty: Enter number of minutes from midnight
SettingDetails.win10SharedPCModeDescription: Optimize devices for shared use to allow one user at a time to sign in to device.
SettingDetails.win10SharedPCSetEduPoliciesDescription: Recommended settings for devices used in schools
SettingDetails.win10SharedPCSetPowerPoliciesDescription: Power policies prevent users from changing power settings, turns off hibernate, and overrides all power state transitions—such as lid close—to sleep.
SettingDetails.win10SharedPCSignInOnResumeDescription: Require the user to sign in with a password when device comes out of sleep mode.
SettingDetails.win10SharedPCSleepTimeOutDescription: Number of inactive seconds before device goes into sleep mode. If you don't set a time, the device will go to sleep after 60 minutes.
SettingDetails.win10StartBlockUnpinningAppsFromTaskbarD: Block the user from unpinning apps as specified through policy.

SettingDetails.deviceLockComplexityValidationFailureNot:
Notes:

  • The device lock can require a password complexity of: LOW, MEDIUM, or HIGH targeted to Android 12+. For devices operating on Android 11 and earlier, setting a complexity value of Low/Medium/High will default to the expected behavior for "Low Complexity".
  • The password definitions below are subject to change. Please refer to DevicePolicyManager|Android Developers for the most updated definitions of the different password complexity levels.

Low

  • Password can be a pattern or PIN with repeating (4444) or ordered (1234, 4321, 2468) sequences.

Medium

  • PIN with no repeating (4444) or ordered (1234, 4321, 2468) sequences with a minimum length of at least 4 characters
  • Alphabetic passwords with a minimum length of at least 4 characters
  • Alphanumeric passwords with a minimum length of at least 4 characters

High

  • PIN with no repeating (4444) or ordered (1234, 4321, 2468) sequences with a minimum length of at least 8 characters
  • Alphabetic passwords with a minimum length of at least 6 characters
  • Alphanumeric passwords with a minimum length of at least 6 characters

SettingDetails.edgeGSAssignment: Choose the user groups that you want to include to have Edge mobile installed. Edge will be installed on all iOS and Android devices enrolled by these users.
SettingDetails.edgeGSIntroBenefitHTML:
Get the Microsoft Edge app for your users on iOS or Android so they can browse seamlessly across their corporate devices! Edge lets users cut through the clutter of the web with built-in features that help them consolidate, arrange and manage work content. Users of iOS and Android devices who sign-in with their corporate Microsoft Entra accounts in the Edge application will find their browser pre-loaded with workplace Favorites and website filters you define.

If you have blocked users from enrolling either iOS or Android devices, this scenario will not enable enrollment, and the users will need to install Edge for themselves.
SettingDetails.edgeGSIntroPrereqHTML:
We'll ask you about the workplace favorites your users need, and the filters you require for web browsing. Make sure you complete the following tasks before you continue:

  • Add users to Microsoft Entra groups
  • Enroll iOS or Android devices in Intune. Learn more
  • Gather list of workplace favorites to add in Edge.
  • Gather list of website filters to enforce in Edge.

SettingDetails.mdmWipInvalidVersionSettings:
One or more apps have invalid minimum/maximum version definitions.

Windows Information Protection With Enrollment policies support specifying only one of the minimum or maximum versions, unless both versions are specified as being equivalent. When only the minimum version is specified, the rule is set for greater than or equal to minimum version. Similarly, when only the maximum version is specified, the rule is set for lesser that equal to the maximum version.

SettingDetails.userImpactTextDetails:
Assigned iOS and Android users must enter a PIN or use biometrics to access work or school content after a period of inactivity. After 5 failed PIN attempts, user must reset their PIN.

If advanced data protection controls are enforced, users will not be able to share work or school content with personal apps or personal accounts and will be required to use Microsoft Edge.

Caution: modifying these settings changes how Intune blocks or allows data transfer to other applications. Do not modify these settings unless you understand the potential for data leaks. You can learn more here.

For newer policies, telecommunication protocols would no longer be added to the default exempt apps list. If the application is using a newer version of Intune SDK (Version 12.7.0+), use the Transfer telecommunications data to setting under Send org data to other apps to address telecommunication transfer settings. For applications using an older version of Intune SDK, add telecommunication protocol (tel and telprompt) to this list. Learn More.
